loans.name: Safarmo

texts.ru:
Сафармо жительница района Бохтар. Она профессиональная швея, а также заботливая мать и жена. Ей 43 года. Сафармо имеет четверых детей. Муж уехал работать в Россию, чтобы обеспечивать семью. Сама Сафармо вместе с дочерью занимается пошивом женской одежды на протяжении 6 лет.   
По причине нехватки финансов уже несколько лет Сафармо не делала ремонт в доме. Она отложила немного денег и чтобы провести этот долгожданный ремонт в доме, она еще просит кредит. Сафармо хочет улучшить условия быта и жить в нормальных условиях. Сафармо нуждается в вашей поддержке. Кредит она обещает погашать за счет своей швейной деятельности.
texts.en: Safarmo is a resident of the Bohtar region of Tajikistan.  She is a professional seamstress, as well as a caring mother and wife; she is 43 and has four children.  Her husband helps support the family as a migrant worker in Russia, while Safarmo and her daughter make women's clothing together and have been doing so for 6 years.  Safarmo's house has been in need of repairs for some time, but she's continually put them off for financial reasons.  She's managed to set aside some money for home repairs, and is requesting a loan as well to be able to start repairing her home at long last.  She wants to improve her quality of life and be able to live in a normal home, and needs your help to do so.  Through the money she earns as a seamstress, she guarantees that she'll be able to pay her loan back in full.

loans.use: improve her quality of life by renovating her home

loans.name: Virny Anne

texts.en:
Virny Anne is a hardworking lady who wants to become a future doctor. She is studying at the university taking up a BS in Biology. Virny Anne has four siblings and she is the third child. She is someone who is very dedicated to her studies and love of family. Her father works as a driver and her mother is a teacher.

She used her previous loan for her tuition fees for the past school year and to continue her journey in studying, she is requesting this loan to pay school tuition fees for the first semester. Her goal is to find a better career and encourage her siblings to continue studying, so that they both can become professionals and can earn a better income for themselves.

loans.use: to pay school tuition fees for the first semester

loans.name: Rogelio

texts.en: Rogelio is 58 years old. He lives in his own house with his wife and their three children. He makes a living farming corn and rice and he sells his products in the agencies for buying and selling staple grains. He manages to afford some household expenses with what he earns from his sales. He is asking for a loan to be able to have a larger income and to give his family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and seeds to grow.

loans.name: Ramon

texts.en: Ramon is a 46-year-old married man with two children who both go to school. They live in Rizal, a province of Isabela. He is a farmer and grows mainly rice. He has practiced this for 17 years and has managed to maintain the welfare of his family and meet some daily expenses. He dreams of expanding his farm by buying a big piece of land that contains rice so he can harvest more rice to sell. He is challenged by unpredictable weather changes. He will use the loan to buy rice seed and fertilizer.

loans.use: to buy rice seed and fertilizer.

loans.name: Wenjell

texts.en: Wenjell owns and operates a farmland, planting and harvesting corn for sale in the local community to earn a living. She has been in this business for more than ten years and earns well for her only child. With her generated income, she was able to maintain and sustain her farm and solely care with her family. Recently, she took a new loan from GDMPC  to purchase organic fertilizer in order to improve her farm. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her farm.

loans.use: to purchase organic fertilizer in order to improve her farm

loans.name: Elizardo

texts.en: Elizardo provides for the family's needs with his income that he derives from farming. He has been growing and harvesting corn for many years, earning well, and he has successfully repaid his previous loans from GDMPC.  He needs more financial capital to expand his farm.  With more financial capital, he took a new loan to purchase fertilizer in order to improve the farm. He hopes to see his children become successful in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer

loans.name: Emlyn

texts.en: Emlyn helps her husband in their fishing business for a living. She sells seafood in their community and has been been in this business for more than eight years, earning well for the family.  With her income, her previous loan was successfully repaid. Earlier this month, she took a new loan to buy additional crabs for sale.  In the future, Emlyn plans to support her children's education for a better future.

loans.use: to buy additional crabs

loans.name: Nancy

texts.en:
Nancy is 58 years old and married with six children. She works very hard to provide for them.

Nancy runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 9,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell.

Nancy has been in this business for four years and sells a variety of items such as snack food, school supplies and other groceries.

In the future Nancy would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Mansour

texts.en:
Mansour is a 26-year-old married man with three children. His oldest child is 4-years-old and the youngest one is 1-year-old.  He lives with his family in their own house in Sana'a. He is an active and vigorous baker. For four years, he has been baking breads and cakes in his bakery.  This business is the only source of income for the family. Mansour's bakery is famous for its delicious breads and cakes and you can always buy hot, fresh bread from his store. This is why he always has a lot of customers.  Mansour wants to expand his business. He wants to buy equipment to purchase a large amount of flour in order to expand his business more. In order to accomplish this goal, Mansour requested a loan of 300,000 YER from AMB which he plans to use to buy a large amount of flour.

Mansour hopes to improve the condition of his family. He hopes to renovate his house from the inside. Also, he plans to purchase dough equipment in order to improve his work more.

loans.use: to buy a large amount of flour.

loans.name: Benkadi Group

texts.fr:
Les quatre membres du groupe  BENKADI  sont des femmes mariées avec une moyenne d’âge de 36 ans, et ont en moyenne 4 enfants. Elles vivent la plupart dans des familles traditionnelles à OUAYERMA I un des quartiers populaires de la ville de Sikasso 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles sont à leur troisième prêt solidaire avec l’institution de micro finance Soro Yiriwaso afin de satisfaire le besoin de leur clientèle. 
Madame MARIAM débout à la deuxième position de la droite vers la gauche sur la photo dans ce groupe des femmes  BENKADI, fait la vente d’encens.
Elle compte acheter avec son prêt  5 bouteilles de parfums guéni, des quantités importantes  des matières premières pour la préparation d'encens  d’où elle est beaucoup sollicitée de sa clientèle par la qualité de ses produits.
La vente se fait en détail dans le marché à une clientèle composée des hommes et des femmes au comptant et à crédit.
Elle  envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 30 000 francs CFA dont une partie est  utilisée  pour payer le prêt et son interêt et l’autre pour son épargne.
texts.en:
The four members of the group BENKADI are married women, who average 36 years of age and four children each, all living for the most part in traditional families in OUAYERMA I, a working-class district in Sikasso City (3rd administrative region of the Republic of Mali).  

The women are on their third solidarity loan with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso to meet the needs of their customers. 

Ms. MARIAM, who is standing second from the right in the photo in this women’s group of BENKADI, sells incense. She intends to use her loan to purchase 5 bottles of guéni perfumes and significant amounts of raw materials for making incense, for which she is much in demand by her customers for the quality of her products. Her sales are made at the retail level to a customer base composed of men and women paying with cash or credit. 

She envisions making an average monthly profit of 30,000 francs CFA. Part of the profits will be used to pay back the loan with interest, and part will go to savings.

loans.use: to purchase raw materials for making incense

loans.name: Fotima

texts.ru: Фотима профессионально занимается шитьем. Она в швейном цехе своего города Кургантюбе принимает заказы на пошив женских платьев национальных фасонов. Фотима работает в этой профессии уже 4 года. Она научилась этому делу у своей старшей сестры. Фотима неудачно вышла замуж и сейчас живет с родителями. Ей 24 года. Сейчас ее интересует только ее бизнес. Она стремится расширить его и поэтому просит кредит для купли еще одной профессиональной швейной машинки. Этот кредит ей очень важен.
texts.en: Fotima is a 24-year-old seamstress, and has been one for 4 years.  She learned her trade from her older sister and works in a dressmaking shop in her home town of Qurgan-Tube, where she makes Tajikistani dresses to order.  She's had some marital issues, and is currently living with her parents.  At the moment, the only thing she's interested in is her business, which she hopes to expand by taking a loan to buy an additional professional-quality sewing machine.  This loan is crucial for her.

loans.use: buy a professional sewing machine

loans.name: Talal

texts.en:
Talal is a 28-year-old married man from Rafah city. He lives with his wife and four kids; three sons and one daughter, in a very simple house. He works as an employee in the public sector where he gets a low income. This income barely covers the family needs. Talal would like to improve the family living conditions and buy all the needed stuff.

Talal took a USD Murabaha loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy a water purification machine for his home. By taking this loan, Talal will be able to improve the living conditions and provide clean water for the family.

Talal appears in the photo

loans.use: to buy a water purification machine for his home.

loans.name: Meda

texts.en: Meda runs her sari-sari store (general store) while her husband farms.  She is married and has four children and lives in  the village of Aurora, Zamboanga Del Sur. Her husband is a farmer, which provides their main source of income. Meda successfully repaid her previous loan from Gata Daku MPC, which she used as additional capital in her business. She took out a new loan recently to purchase additional canned goods, noodles, dairy and bottled products.  She is thankful to GDMPC  because it gives her an opportunity to improve her business. She plans to save the revenue she generates for the future education of her children.

loans.use: to purchase additional canned goods, noodles, dairy and bottled products

loans.name: Nancy

texts.en: In 2012, Nancy learned about Paglaum Multi Purpose Cooperative and the financial assistance it gives start-ups. Nancy tried her luck on doing a business focusing on her farming activities. She feels she owes her fortune to the Cooperative for having trusted her with the money she used as capital. Nancy used another another loan amount to pay for seedlings and compost. This will help her farming income with a big boost. Nancy looks for better business opportunities and would love to be in the position to help others.

loans.use: to pay for seedlings and compost

loans.name: Amparo

texts.en:
Amparo works hard to support her family. Amparo is widowed and has a rug making business in the Philippines.

Amparo requested a PHP 19,500 loan through NWTF to buy additional materials for her business.  Amparo has been in this business for seven years now.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

Amparo would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional materials for her business

loans.name: Maria Teresa

texts.es:
María, es casada, vive con sus tres hijos y su esposo, ella y su esposo desempeñan actividades económicas diferentes con las que tienen los ingresos para costear los gastos de su hogar, por su parte la Sra.: María atiende una tienda en la que oferta productos de la canasta básica, su horario es de seis de la mañana a siete de la noche, por su experiencia no representa dificultades en administrar su negocio.
Utilizará el préstamo para mejorar la variedad de mercadería que tiene en su establecimiento, comprara jabón, detergentes, aceite, arroz, maíz, frijoles, jugos, sodas, papel higiénico, azúcar, sal, pan, galletas, boquitas, dulces, etc., será muy útil dicha compra para atraer nuevos clientes, tener mejores ventas e ingresos con los que aportara en los gastos familiares y cancelara la deuda adquirida.
Su sueño es apoyar a sus hijos para que puedan culminar una carrera universitaria y remodelar su vivienda.
texts.en:
María is married and lives with her three children and husband. She and her husband work in different economic activities that allow them to pay for the expenses of the home. For her part, María runs a store in which she offers basic-need products. Her schedule is from six in the morning to seven at night. Since she has experience, she does not have difficulty in running her business. 

She will use the loan to improve the variety of merchandise that she has in her establishment. She will buy soap, detergents, oil, rice, corn, beans, juices, sodas, toilet paper, sugar, salt, bread, cookies, snacks, candy, etc. The purchase will be very useful to attract new customers, and have better sales and income which will support the family expenses and pay off the acquired debt. 

Her dream is to support her children so that they can complete a university degree and remodel their home.

loans.use: to buy soap, detergents, oil, rice, corn, beans, juices, sodas, toilet paper, sugar, salt, bread, cookies, snacks, candy, etc.

loans.name: Mehriniso

texts.ru:
Мехринисо мирная жительница района Хуросон. Она замужем и имеет двоих сыновей и дочь. Ей этой осенью будет 39 лет. 
Мехринисо любит разводить животных в своем хозяйстве. Она как и многие ее односельчане занимается скотоводством, чтобы обеспечивать семью. Этот бизнес она начала 6 лет назад. Мехринисо в основном выращивает молодых бычков в течение месяца и затем по прибыльной цене продает на скотном рынке. Сейчас она просит кредит для купли нескольких голов молодых бычков для развития бизнеса. Она ждет вашу поддержку.
texts.en:
Mehriniso lives in the Khuroson region. She is married and has two sons and one daughter. This fall she will be turning 39.
Mehriniso enjoys raising livestock. As many in her village, she raises livestock in order to support her family. She launched this business six years ago. She mostly fattens bull calves for a month and then sells them at the animal market, with a good profit margin. At present she is requesting a loan to buy several heads of cattle to develop her business further. She is counting on your support.

loans.use: to buy several calves.

loans.name: Suta Pertiwi Group

texts.en:
Six months ago, the Suta Pertiwi group planned to use their loans for farming. With the persistence they do, the business can be run well. Supported by good weather and proper care, they got satisfactory results.

Wayan managed to sell his crops at a satisfactory price. He can fulfill his dream to improve his home and celebrate the holiday. Wayan thanks for the help he received. He and Suta Pertiwi group plan to continue their loan to improve their businesses.

Wayan, 47 years old, is living in a village in West Bali. He lives with his wife because his son is grown up and lives with his wife. As the leader of Suta Pertiwi group, he coordinates its members, both in terms of loans and business management. The total group lending was 20,000,000 IDR and Wayan got 2,500,000 IDR.

Wayan used the loan to buy fertilizer and insecticide. This time he has planted long beans, nuts and other crops which need less water because the dry season is coming. The crops need to be cultivated and sprayed with insecticide to get good results. Wayan hopes he will have a good result so it will be enough to save and repay the loan.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and insecticide

loans.name: Yousef

texts.en:
Yousef is a 27-year-old single man from Khan Younis city. He lives with his family in a very simple house. He has a small store to sell women's clothing in the city. It is a good business but the income is not high. Yousef would like to improve the family living conditions and buy all the needed stuff.

Yousef took a USD Murabaha loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy a water purification machine for his home. By taking this loan, Yousef will be able to improve the living conditions and provide clean water for the family.

Yousef appears in the photo

loans.use: to buy a water purification machine for his home.

loans.name: Nelia

texts.en: Nelia is a married woman with four children, living in Cabilinan, Aurora, Zamboanga del Sur. With her generated income from raising pigs, she was able to repay her previous loan successfully and had put up capital for her retail store to earn more income. She took a new loan recently to purchase additional grocery goods to sell. She wants to improve the business as well as the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional grocery goods to sell

loans.name: Mercedes Faustino

texts.es: Mercedes es de la comunidad de salitre tiene 44 años de edad , comenta que el estudio hasta tercer grado de primaria ya que sus padres no podían seguir apoyándolo a el y sus hermanos pues estaban pasando en ese momento por una mala situación económica así que se dedico a trabajar a muy temprana edad en lo que es agricultura pasaron los años creció se forjo como un hombre de bien trabajador luchador y responsable , cuando tenia 26 años se caso de ese matrimonio  procreo 5 hijos a los que les inculta que deben ser personas de bien en la vida . en la comunidad no cuentan con energía eléctrica por las noches se alumbran con candelas es por eso que ahora el quiere aplicar a tramite de crédito para  comprar un pequeño sistema solar para su vivienda.
texts.en:
Mercedes is from the saltpeter community and is 44 years old.   He says that he only studied up to the third grade of primary school since his parents could not continue to support him and his siblings.  They were going through economic hard times then.  So he started making a living at an early age in agriculture.  With the passage of time, he grew and turned himself into a man who is hard-working, a fighter and responsible.  When he was 26 years old, he got married and from this union came five children whom he has tried to raise to be good people in this life.

In the community, they don't have electricity.  At night, they use candles.  For this reason, he now wants to apply for a loan to buy a small solar system for his house.

loans.use: to buy a solar system.

loans.name: Ramón José

texts.es:
Ramón de 55 años de edad, estudio 2° grado debido a lo económico ya no siguió, ya que su padre no vio importante el estudio. Esta acompañado y su pareja se dedica al cuidado del hogar, tienen 3 hijos pero ya todos están acompañados pero 1 de los 3 se quedo a vivir con ellos.

 Ramón, toda su vida se a dedicado a la agricultura oficio que aprendió con su padre, también desde hace 38 años se dedica al oficio de veterinaria, esto lo aprendió en una hacienda que trabajo, el patrón lo mando a sacar un curso de veterinaria y comenta que este pequeño curso que saco le ha ayudado mucho para sacar adelante a su familia y también le ha dado muchas satisfacciones pues ha podido ayudar a muchos animales.- Dice que a sus 55 años todavía siente fuerzas para trabajar, se levanta a las 5:00 am pues para llegar donde trabaja tiene que caminar unos 30 minutos y para aprovechar el día labora 7 horas y por las tardes aprovecha para ejercer la veterinaria.


El crédito sera invertido en la compra de semilla, abono y veneno y para preparar la tierra.

Su deseo es comprar unas 3 vacas lecheras, comprar un terreno para dejarles donde construyan cada hijo su casa y mejorar la vivienda que tiene.
texts.en:
Ramón is 55 years old. He was in school until second grade but because of the economic situation he did not continue, and because his father did not see studies as important. He is in a common-law marriage, and his partner cares for their home. They have three children who all are in relationships, but one of the three still lives with them.

All of his life, Ramón has worked in agriculture, which he learned with his father. For the past 38 years he has also worked in a veterinary office. He learned this on a ranch where he worked. The boss sent him to take a class in veterinary medicine. Ramón said that this little class he took has really helped to advance his family, and has also given him the satisfaction of helping many animals. 

Ramón says that at 55, he still has strength to work. He wakes up at 5:00 am to get to where he works. He has to walk 30 minutes and to make the most of the day he works 7 hours. Then in the afternoons he works at the veterinary office. 

The loan will be used to buy seeds, fertilizer and pesticides, and to prepare the land. His dream is to buy three dairy cows, buy some land to keep them on, build each child a house, and to improve his house.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizer and pesticides, and to prepare the land.

loans.name: Irving Omar

texts.es:
Irving de 22 años de edad, estudio hasta 5ª grado, esta casado su esposa se dedica a los oficios domésticos tiene 1 hijo de 1 año de edad.

Irving es soldado desde hace 3 años. El crédito lo necesita para reparar el  techo de su casa, comprara tejas y madera.
 
Su deseo es tener su casa propia y digna en buen estado para que su familia viva en en lo propio y bien.
texts.en: Irving is 22 years old and went to school through the fifth grade. He is married, and his wife takes care of the household and their 1 year old son. Irving has been a soldier for three years. He needs the loan to repair the roof of his house. He will buy shingles and wood. His dream is to have his own home that is in good condition so that his family can live well.

loans.use: to buy shingles and wood to repair the roof of his house.

loans.name: Eloida

texts.es:
Eloida de 33 años de edad,  estudio hasta 6 grado, esta soltera tiene 3 hijos.
Ella tiene aproximadamente 6 meses de trabajar en un comedor de la ciudad, pero ella también vende yuca, pasteles etc, los fines de semana.

El crédito lo necesita para comprar yuca, aceites, papas, zanahorias, maíz, condimentos, etc.  mas productos para la venta de los fines de semana.

Su propósito es brindarle el estudio a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Eloida is 33 years old. She went to school through the 6th grade. She is single and has 3 children. She has been working at a restaurant in town for about 6 months, but she also sells, yucca, pastries and more on the weekends. 

She needs the loan to buy yucca, oils, potatoes, carrots, corn, seasonings, and other products to sell on the weekends. Her goal is to give her children an education.

loans.use: to buy yucca, oils, potatoes, carrots, corn, seasonings, etc. as well as other products to sell on the weekends.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to improve his security system, and to buy a living room and bedroom set.

loans.name: Rosa Marina Del Carmen

texts.es:
Rosa, con la ayuda del crédito anterior remodelo parte de su vivienda y ha mejorado el servicio a sus clientes ofreciéndoles productos frescos y de mucha calidad a buenos precios, sus nuevas ganancias le permiten brindar un mejor estilo de vida a su familia y cancelar su deuda.
Opta por un nuevo crédito para tener surtida su venta de frutas y verduras comprara tomates, pepinos, uvas, manzanas, güisquiles, repollos, granadillas, papayas, zapotes, aguacates, etc., para mantener la continuidad de su negocio.
texts.en:
Rosa, with the help of the previous loan, remodeled part of her house and has improved the service to her customers, offering them high quality, fresh produce at a good price. Her new profits allow her to provide her family with a better lifestyle and pay off her debt. 

She has opted for a new loan to have her fruit and vegetable stand well supplied. She will buy tomatoes, cucumbers, grapes, apples, chayote squash, cabbages, passion fruit, papayas, zapotes, avocados, etc. to mantain the continuity of her business.

loans.use: To buy tomatoes, cucumbers, grapes, apples, chayote squash, cabbages, passion fruit, papayas, zapotes, avocados, etc.

loans.name: Ismael

texts.es:
La bocina de un microbús suena a las 6 de la mañana, un grupo de niños con sus uniformes limpios suben a su transporte de color azul para dirigirse a la escuela. Ismael, de 63 años, es quien desde hace 7 años, cuida de los niños para que asistan a su colegio. Afortunadamente su esposa y cuatro hijos, entre las edades de 33 a 40 años, lo apoyan siempre, pues no tiene otro ingreso más que como transportista de estudiantes. Anteriormente, Ismael había trabajado como taxista y hace como 33 años haciendo recorridos privado, para salir adelante, pues no tuvo una educación completa, dado a que por problemas económicos solo llegó a tercer grado de primaria.
Ismael sueña con tener una pequeña cooperativa de viajes privados, iniciando con un segundo microbús, pero sabe que para eso necesita incrementar sus ingresos. Por esta razón, necesita de un préstamo para invertir en su microbús, componer los asientos, revisar el motor y las llantas, para ofrecer un mejor servicio, llegar a más clientes y generar mayor ingresos. Al medio día, Ismael regresa al colegio para recoger a los niños para llevarlos de regreso a sus hogares.
texts.en:
The micro bus horn beeps at 6 in the morning. A group of cleanly uniformed children get into the blue vehicle to go to school. Ismael, 63 years old, is the person who for 7 years has cared for the children so that they can get to school. Fortunately, his wife and four children, aged 33 to 40, have always supported him, because he has no other source of income besides student transportation. Previously, Ismael worked as a taxi driver and for about 33 years, he did private routes to get ahead. He didn't have a formal education because due to financial problems, he was only able to go through the third grade.   

Ismael dreams of have a small private travel cooperative, starting with a second micro bus, but he knows that to do that he needs to increase his income.  To do that , he needs a loan to invest in a micro bus, fixing the seat and checking the motor and the tires to offer a better service, get more customers and generate more income. At mid day, Ismael goes back to the school to pick up the children to take them back home.

loans.use: to invest in his micro bus by fixing the seats and checking the motor and the tires.

loans.name: Aimons Nous Group

texts.fr:
Mme ADAMA est responsable du groupe  AIMONS NOUS. Mariée, elle est mère de 06 enfants. Le plus âgé a 20ans et le moins âgé a 02ans. 02 vont à l’école. 
Mme fait de l’agro pastoral depuis  plus de 20ans.  Elle s’approvisionne au marché de son village. 
Elle veut s’acheter  02 sacs de petit mil et 02 sacs de sorgho blanc pour stocker et revendre en temps de soudure.	
Elle veut utiliser ses bénéfices afin de renforcer son activité. Mme  ambitionne agrandir son activité et mieux s’occuper de sa famille surtout ses enfants.
texts.en:
Mrs Adama is the leader of the Aimons Nous ["Let Us Love One Another"] group. She is married and has six children. The eldest is 20 years old, and the youngest is two. Two of her children are in school.

Mrs. Adama has been selling agricultural products for over 20 years. She stock up at the marker of her village.
She would like to buy two bags of finger millet and two bags of white sorghum in order to keep them for resale later, during the dry season. She would like to use her revenues to strengthen her business. Her goal is to grow her business and better provide for her family, especially her children.

loans.use: to buy two bags of finger millet and two bags of white sorghum  for resale  during the dry season.

loans.name: Jesus Maria

texts.es:
A sus 46 años, Jesús es padre de un joven de 15 años y vive en una finca junto a su hijo y su esposa a los cuales adora con todas sus fuerzas y procura brindarles lo mejor.
El es un hombre humilde, de campo y con gran experiencia en el manejo de cultivos y animales.
Tiene un pequeño terreno en el cual tiene cultivos de café y de plátano y el cual atiende todos los días con el afán de cosechar unos buenos productos.
El solicita un crédito para comprar insumos agropecuarios como fertilizantes y de esta forma realizarle un mantenimiento a su terreno de una forma adecuada.
Su mayor sueño es tener una finca propia y dedicarse en pleno a la agricultura, generando unos ingresos propios y brindarle un buen futuro a su hijo.
texts.en:
At 46, Jesús is the father of a young man of 15, and lives on a farm with his son and his wife whom he adores with all his heart and tries to provide for as best he can.

He is a modest farmer with great experience in agriculture and livestock-raising. He has a small piece of land where he grows coffee and plantains, which he looks after every day with the desire to harvest good crops.

He is requesting a loan to buy agricultural supplies such as fertilizers, and this way carry out proper maintenance to his plot of land.

His greatest desire is to have his own farm and to devote himself completely to agriculture, generating his own income and providing his son with s good future.

loans.use: TO buy agricultural supplies.

loans.name: Ronny

texts.es:
Ronny es un joven muy trabajador, tiene 21 años de edad, es soltero y vive en Lima junto a su familia.
Desde hace varios años se dedica a la venta de accesorios para celulares, como llaveros, protectores, carcasas. Le va muy bien porque es una persona con muchas ganas de salir adelante, innovador, emprendedor y porque ofrece productos que están a la vanguardia de la moda en estos tiempos.
Ronny está muy agradecido con los prestamistas Kiva porque con el apoyo que le han brindado él podrá comprar más mercadería para suministrar el negocio y así obtener mayores ganancias con los que podrá mejorar su nivel de vida y brindarle un futuro mejor a su familia.
texts.en:
Ronny is a hard-working young man. He is 21 years old, single and lives in Lima with his family. For several years he has been selling cell phone accessories, such as key chains, protectors and cases. He is doing very well because he is a person who really wants to get ahead, is innovative and enterprising, and because he offers products that are on the cutting edge of fashion today. 

Ronny is very grateful to the the Kiva lenders because, with the support they have given him, he will be able to buy more merchandise to supplie the business and obtain greater profits to improve his standard of living and provide for a better future for his family.

loans.use: To buy merchandise to supply his business.

loans.name: Omar Antonio

texts.es: Omar  es originario de matiguas aquí ha vivido toda su vida ,con mucho apoyo y esfuerzo de sus padres dice que estudio solo primer grado de primaria  en la casa cural de la pequeña iglesia que había en su comunidad , desde muy chico dice aprendió los labores del campo como es sembrar granos básicos , cortar café , cuidar ganado entre otros así que eso hoy en día le ha servido mucho , el vivió con sus padres hasta la edad de 24 años después se caso y formo su familia en el que vive dice felizmente con su esposa y su tres hijos , sus hijos están estudiando el los motiva para que se preparen y sean personas profesionales en un futuro. su esposa es ama de casa y el se dedica al cultivo y comercio de la siembra que cosecha.En la comunidad no tienen energía eléctrica  es bien triste no poder tener  luz dice ya que si tuvieran luz dejarían de estar contaminándose con el humo de los candiles que usan ahora el quiere aplicar a crédito y comprarse un Kits solar para su hogar.
texts.en:
Omar is originally from Matiguas, Matagalpa. He has lived here his whole life. He says that with much support and effort from his parents, he was able to study only through the first grade of primary school, in the rectory of the small church that was in his community. He says he has been learning to do the field work, such as sowing basic grains, picking coffee, raising cattle and more, since he was very young. Today, that helps him a lot. 

He lived with his parents until age 24. Following that, he got married and formed his family - a wife and three children - with whom he lives happily. His children are studying. He motivates them to be prepared, and become professional people in the future. His wife is a housewife, and he makes a living cultivating and selling the crops he harvests. 

In the community, they do not have electric energy. It is very sad not to be able to have electricity, he says, because if they did they would stop contaminating with the smoke of the candles that they use now. He wants to apply for a loan and buy solar energy kits for his home.

loans.use: to buy solar energy kits for his home

loans.name: Nohelia Esperanza

texts.es:
La sonrisa de Nohelia muestra lo feliz que la hace su vocación como maestra en colegios rurales desde hace 6 años, ya que para ella es agradable saber que se puede ayudar a enseñar a los demás. La amabilidad y el espíritu trabajador de esta mujer, la han hecho escalar en su vida laboral, pues tras obtener su título en la escuela técnica, ha trabajado y ahora está como supervisora en el Ministerio de Educación municipal. A pesar de ser una madre soltera, siempre ha llevado a sus dos hijos de 12 y 15 años a la escuela, porque considera que con la educación se aspira para salir adelante, alcanzar sus metas, convertirse en profesionales y ayudar en la sociedad. 
Nohelia siempre ha visto por lo demás, ahora quiere también invertir en su calidad de vida, ya que no posee un buen servicio higiénico en su cocina y baño. Es por esto que necesita de un préstamo para mejorar los servicios higiénicos y las condiciones de su vivienda, construyendo un cuarto y optimizar la cocina.  Entre sus planes está seguir apoyando a sus hijos a salir adelante, mejorar su calidad de vida y seguir ayudando a los demás.
texts.en:
Nohelia’s smile shows how happy her work as a teacher in rural schools makes her. She has been doing this for six years, and for her is nice to know that she can help in the education of somebody else. 

The kindness and hardworking spirit of this woman have made her grow in her professional life. After getting her degree at a technical school, she has worked hard and now she is a supervisor at the local Ministry of Education.

In spite of being a single mother, she has always made her two children, ages 12 and 15, attend to school. She believes that education is the mean by which people can get ahead in life, reach their goals, become professionals and help the society.  

Nohelia has always taken care of other people. Now she would like to invest in her own quality of life, since she doesn’t have proper sanitary facilities or hygienic service in her kitchen. 

This is why she needs a loan to improve the hygienic services and housing conditions, by building a room and optimizing the kitchen. Among her plans, she wants to keep supporting her children to succeed, improve their quality of life and keep helping other people.

loans.use: to improve the hygienic services and housing conditions.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a solar system for heating water and a tank

loans.name: Vilma

texts.en: At 43 years of age, Vilma is now a widow. She solely supports the needs of her two children thru her cellphone loading station and manicure/pedicure services. As a single parent, she is working hard to give what her children needed especially with regards to their education so that they can find stable jobs in the future. Vilma’s eldest child, Geraldine, is now attending to her university, but unfortunately they do not have enough money to pay for her full tuition fee. With that, Vilma wants to avail loan from KIVA lenders amounting to Php 200, 000. Geraldine is a loving daughter to her mother. Her main goal in life is to help her mother in their daily expenditures and to send her sibling to college. Geraldine hopes that lenders will approve her mother’s request for it will definitely change their lives positively.

loans.use: To pay her child's tuition fee in full

loans.name: María Santos Magdalena

texts.es: María tiene 54 años de edad y habita en casa propia junto a su esposo, su hija de 25 años y su hijo de 19 años de edad. María se dedica a la elaboración y  venta de tortillas desde hace 5 años. Este negocio es el que le permite llevar ajustar las necesidades de su familia dado que con el salario de su esposo no logra cubrir los gastos del hogar. Con el deseo de mejorar sus condiciones de vida solicita este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la reparación del techo de la vivienda dado que se encuentra deteriorado. Con el monto comprará lámina galvanizada, madera y clavos.
texts.en:
María is 54 years old and lives in her own house with her husband, 25-year-old daughter and 19-year-old son. María has been making and selling tortillas for 5 years. This business is what allows her to barely budget for the needs of her family, because she is unable to cover the household expenses with her husband's salary. 

She is requesting this loan from FUSAI with the hope of improving their living conditions, to invest it in the repair of the roof of the house, which is in bad shape. With this amount, she will buy galvanized sheet metal, wood and nails.

loans.use: To buy galvanized sheet metal, wood and nails to repair the roof on her house.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more goats to raise and sell

loans.name: Me

texts.en:
Me is 55 years old and a married woman, with seven children. She owns and operates a small store, selling items such as sugar, salt, noddles, soft drinks, and cookies. She has been doing this work for more than nine years.

Me needs a loan to buy a deep freezer, fridge, new cash machine, new stock, and to extend her business. She hopes to use her profits to grow her business, to become a supermarket in the future. She became a member of SPBD in 2008, to gain access to capital for her business.

loans.use: to buy a deep freezer, fridge, new cash machine, and new stock for her store

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a solar system for heating water and a tank for her home

loans.name: Marga Indah Ternak Group

texts.en:
Marga Indah Ternak group is very grateful that they passed through the loan period with success. No problems were found raising their pigs. The pigs grew big and healthy and they sold them at a satisfactory price. Marga Indah Ternak members intend to continue borrowing with MUK because in addition to providing loans, MUK also provides training and a consulting veterinarian for free.

Ni Komang managed to sell the piglets for a satisfactory price. Her sow gave birth to 10 piglets, but 2 died. She earned 150.000 IDR profit per piglet. The advantage is that she saved to expand the business. She hopes that MUK will always accompany the group until all members can be independent.

To continue the effort and increase the number of pigs, the Marga Indah Ternak group took another loan for the same amount. These loans are used to purchase piglets, especially the superior species. The pig breeding business can help increase their family's income because of easy maintenance and can be used as additional work. Most of the members work as farmers. Two of the members couldn't attend the meeting because they had a religious ceremony at the temple.

They hope their efforts this time will be more advanced so they can save money and send their children through high levels of education.

Ni Komang used her portion of the loan to purchase feed only because now she has two sows and nine superior piglets. She will save all the profit to use later as capital.

loans.use: to purchase feed for her pigs

loans.name: Tilda

texts.en:
Tilda is driven by passion in selling. She is a widow, aged 56, and she lives in Oroquieta City. She runs a store that is the primary means of support for her family. She never gets tired, tending her store.

She is a full-fledged member of PMPC and has taken several loans, already. She religiously paid her obligations without any records of default. Now, she has borrowed another loan, which she will use to pay for inventory, including sugar, milk, oil, and noodles. Having enough inventory would mean income opportunities. In the future, she dreams of sustaining her store, to continuously provide for her family.

loans.use: to pay for inventory, including sugar, milk, oil, and noodles.

loans.name: Ermilinda

texts.en: Retailing helped Ermilinda provide for the family. She retails charcoal and brings a meager income of Php 6,000 per month. She found the business of buying and selling charcoal easy and simple because all she needed to do is to weigh and repack the charcoal for her buyers. Ermilinda plans to expand her retailing business. She applied a loan to PMPC for the needed capital. She wants to purchase inventories of charcoal for retail. Ermilinda smiles at the fact to see all her children finish their studies.

loans.use: to purchase inventories of charcoal for resale

loans.name: Arcilyn

texts.en: Arcilyn is married with five children and operates a tailoring service business, while her husband works  as a lineman for a living. For fifteen years in running the service, Arcilyn was happy to say that this helps a lot to her family, while waiting for the salary of her husband. She borrowed a loan from GDMPC micro finance to buy fabrics and thread used for sewing . In the future, she wants to have a better standard of living for her family.

loans.use: to buy fabrics and thread used for sewing

loans.name: Roceline

texts.en:
Roceline is 52 years old, married, and has five children. Four of her children are in school. Roceline is in the agricultural business, farming sugarcane and rice in the Philippines. She has been farming sugarcane and rice for 20 years.

Roceline requested a PHP 23,000 loan through NWTF. She will use the loan in order to buy fertilizer and other farm supplies. She has borrowed 14 times in the past from NWTF, to sustain her business.

In the future, Roceline would like to build and expand her business, to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Flordeliza

texts.en:
Flordeliza is 31 years old, married with two children, one of whom is in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Flordeliza has a purified drinking water retail business in the Philippines. Flordeliza requested a PHP 17000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy more stocks of purified water to offer for resale.

Flordeliza has been in this business for two years. In the future, Flordeliza would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more purified water to offer for resale.

loans.name: Celestina

texts.en:
Celestina is 57 years old and married with two children. Celestina works very hard to provide for them.

Celestina runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 21000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional items like canned goods, snack foods, beer, shampoo, noodles, biscuits, etc. to sell. Celestina has been in this business for 15 years. 

Celestina would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional items like canned goods, snack foods, beer, shampoo, noodles, biscuits, etc. to sell

loans.name: Conchita

texts.en:
Conchita is a married woman with nine children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Conchita is 46 years old and has four children who are currently in school.

Conchita has a general store business in the Philippines. Conchita requested a PHP 10000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more groceries to sell to her customers.

Conchita has been in this business for 5 years. In the future, Conchita would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell to her customers

loans.name: Nenita

texts.en:
As a married mother of six children, Nenita works hard to support her family.

She has a business selling native products in the Philippines and earns additional income from selling vegetables. Nenita is borrowing PHP 18,500 through NWTF in order to buy more stocks of native products to sell to customers.

Nenita has been sustaining her business activities through her past 24 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of native products to sell.

loans.name: Diomedesa

texts.en:
Diomedesa is married and she works hard to support her family. She has a fish vending business in the Philippines. Diomedesa has been in this business for 18 years now.

Diomedesa has requested a PHP 13000 loan through NWTF to purchase more fish to sell. Diomedesa would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more fish to sell

loans.name: Maria Maximina

texts.es:
María, es parte de una familia muy unida integrada por su compañero de vida, sus dos hijos de 23 y 19 años de edad, los cuales trabajan, siendo muy joven la Sra.: María aprendió de su madre a elaborar y vender tortillas, inicio a trabajar de forma independiente hace ya 15 años, por la necesidad de generar ingresos para apoyar en los gastos de su hogar, actualmente lo hace junto a su hija en un horario de seis de la mañana a cinco de la tarde.
Utilizará el préstamo para comprar maíz, cal, leña y gas propano al por mayor, abastecerá su negocio con los materiales necesarios para realizar mejor su trabajo y satisfacer las necesidades de sus clientes, espera aumentar sus ventas e ingresos para cancelar su deuda y brindar un mejor estilo de vida a su familia.
Su aspiración es expandir su negocio empleando a otra persona para vender tortillas en un sector diferente, lo que le ayudara a tener una mejor estabilidad económica.
texts.en:
Maria is part of a family that includes her life’s partner and two children, ages 23 and 19, who have jobs.  When she was very young Maria learned to make and sell tortillas from her mother.  She started working on her own 15 years ago out of the need to generate an income to help with the household expenses.  She currently does it with her daughter from 6:00 am to 5:00 pm.

She will use the money from this loan to buy dried corn, lime, firewood, and propane gas in quantity.  She will stock her business with the necessary materials to do her job better and satisfy her customer needs.  She expects her sales to increase, along with her income so she can pay off her debt and provide a better quality of life for her family.

Her aspiration is to expand her business and create another job selling tortillas in a different area.  This will help her have better financial stability.

loans.use: to buy supplies and ingredients.

loans.name: Melany De Jesús

texts.es:
Melany de 48 años de edad,  estudio hasta tercer grado, la falta de escuelas en la zona con más grados de enseñanza no pudo continuar, pero el aprendizaje que adquirió cuando estaba aprendiendo, es lo que hoy en día le esta siendo útil por la actividad a la que se dedica. 

 Está casada, su pareja se dedica al comercio de productos desechables en las unidades de buses que transita en la zona, ambos son los responsable de la manutención de sus hijos; por lo que los ingresos van a una misma causa, es madre de cuatro hijos quienes ya están grandes, el menor tiene 13 y todos están estudiando, el mayor va a la universidad y los demás a básica, por lo que tiene un gasto considerado.

Ella tiene un puesto en el mercado, en el que vende helados, frescos y licuados, está en un punto céntrico donde circula bastante gente, tiene 7 años de dedicarse al negocio, analizando ella lo que faltaba que vendieran en el mercado se dio cuenta que no había nada para refrescarse, por lo que tomo la decisión de innovar dando este paso importante, no tiene más actividades a las que se dedique; anteriormente le ayudaba a una tía a vender ropa. La distancia que recorre es de un kilómetro diario, solo ella es la que realiza esta actividad, su horario de trabajo es de las 7 am a 3 pm. 

El préstamo que esta solicitando a CREDICAMPO, es para comprar más helados, banano, fresas, zapote, leche, para elaborar los licuados y más fruta para hacer los refrescos naturales. La mejora que el préstamo hará, es el poder cumplir el sueño de ampliarse con las venta y  dar una mejor variedad al cliente.

Los sueños que tiene es poder crecer siempre en las ventas y con eso tener mejores ingresos, con lo que podrá cubrir sus necesidades y las de su familia. Las ganancias serán invertidas en el pago de la cuota y ampliar el negocio.
texts.en:
Melany is 48 years old and studied up to the third grade. She could not continue studying due to the lack of schools with higher grades in the region, but what she learned in school helps her today in her job. 

She is married and her partner works selling disposable products in buses around the region. Both of them are responsible for supporting their children and their income goes toward that sole objective. Melany has four children who are no longer small. The youngest is 13 years old. They are all studying. The oldest goes to university and the rest are in middle school and high school, which means they have considerable expenses. 

She has a stand in the market, where she sells ice cream, smoothies and juices. Her stand is in a central location with a lot of pedestrian traffic. She has had this job for 7 years. After analyzing what was lacking in the market, she realized that there were no refreshing products for sale, which is why she decided to take a chance and innovate. This is her only occupation -- she previously helped an aunt selling clothes. The distance to her job is one kilometer. She works alone and her work schedule is 7:00 a.m. to 3:00 p.m. 

She is asking for this loan to buy more ice cream, bananas, strawberries, sapotes and milk to make smoothies, and more fruit to make natural juices. The loan will allow her dream to improve her sales and provide more variety to her clients come true. 

She dreams of her sales always growing and of improving her income, with which she will be able to cover her needs and those of her family. Her profits will be invested in repaying her loan and expanding her business.

loans.use: to buy more ice cream, bananas, strawberries, sapotes and milk to make smoothies, and more fruit to make natural  juices.

loans.name: Rovelyn

texts.en:
Rovelyn signed up for her membership with PMPC and obtained the needed capital to start up a sari-sari store business. She is thankful for the capital that was extended to a small-time borrower like her.

Rovelyn is able to turn the tide in her favor and is making good sales, these days. She wants to take advantage of the good fortune. Recently, she took a loan to restock her store with basic commodities, like canned goods, oil, and soy sauce. In the future, she hopes to build a decent home for the family.

loans.use: to restock her store, with items like canned goods, oil, and soy sauce.

loans.name: Desa

texts.en:
Desa is 26 years old and married. She has two children, one of whom is in school. Desa works very hard to provide for them, running a general store in the Philippines. She has been in this business for three years and sells a variety of items, such as soft drinks, sardines, and other groceries.

Desa has requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF. She will use the loan to purchase more groceries to sell.

In the future Desa would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Santos Isabel

texts.es:
Santos, manifiesta que con el financiamiento anterior ha logrado mejorar la productividad de sus cultivos, su situación económica es más favorable.
Nuevamente solicita crédito por los buenos beneficios que estos le dan, con el que podrá contar de manera inmediata con los insumos agrícolas para realizar los preparativos para la próxima siembra, comprara abono, semilla, herbicidas, plaguicidas e insecticidas.
texts.en:
Santo states that with his prior loan, he achieved an improvement in crop production, and his economic situation became more favorable. 

He is requesting a loan again because of the good benefits that these loans give him. With the loan, he will have immediate access to agricultural supplies so he can make preparations for the next harvest. He will buy compost, seeds, herbicide, pesticide and insecticide.

loans.use: to buy compost, seeds, herbicide, pesticide and insecticide

loans.name: Carmen

texts.es:
Carmen de 61 años de edad,  estudio hasta tercer grado, la falta de docente para enseñar la limito a poder seguir aprendiendo, pero con lo poco que aprendió se defiende hoy ante cualquier necesidad, esta soltera, anteriormente estuvo casada pero la relación con su esposo no se pudo formalizar nunca, tomando ambos caminos diferentes, es madre de cuatro hijos quienes son mayores de edad, ya cada quien vive aparte, unos en el extranjero y otros cerca de donde vive ella, por hoy vive sola.

Anterior mente se dedicaba al comercio del pescado fresco, por hoy comercializa con productos de primera necesidad (trastos), ya tiene 6 meses de dedicarse a esta actividad, la necesidad de ingresos la llevo a tomar decisiones, mencionar que ella trabajo con un préstamo con nuestra institución, el que invirtió y se vio la mejora que tubo, nuevamente solicita un nuevo crédito para invertirlo en la compra de más mercadería, no tiene otras actividades a las que se dedique por lo que trabaja de lleno con su negocio actual, la venta la realiza en las casas de la comunidad, por lo que ya tiene su clientela, la distancia que recorre es variada ya que no siempre va al mismo lugar, el recorrido lo hace a pie, nadie más de la familia se involucra en el negocio, el horario de trabajo es de las 7 am a 11 pm.    

El préstamo será invertido en la compra de más utensilios para la cocina para vender, con lo que tendrá más inventario para realizar su negocio, la mejora que el préstamo hará es el comprar por mayor  y tener siempre mercadería disponible. 

Los sueños que tiene es poder crecer siempre en las ventas y con eso tener mejores ingresos, con lo que podrá cubrir sus necesidades. Las ganancias serán invertidas en el pago de la cuota y ampliar el negocio.
texts.en:
Carmen is 61 years old and studied until third grade. The lack of available teachers limited Carmen's ability to continue her studies. However, with what she did learn, today Carmen is able to make it through any situation. Carmen is single and lives alone; she was previously married, but she could not formalize her relationship with her husband and they both took separate paths. Carmen is the mother of four adult children who are all living on their own now, some far away and the others quite close to where Carmen lives. 

Previously, Carmen made a living trading fresh fish, but now she sells basic goods, including dishes. She has been in this business for six months. The need for more income brought Carmen to make important decisions and Carmen started to work with a loan from CrediCampo. She invested the loan and saw the improvement it made in her business. She is requesting another loan to invest in the purchase of more merchandise. She no longer has any other sources of income because she is completely occupied by this business. Carmen makes her sales in homes around her community as she already has a loyal client base. She travels various distances and she does not always go to the same place. She works from 7am to 11pm. She travels on foot and no one else in her family is involved in the business. 

This loan will be invested in the purchase of more cooking utensils to sell. With this loan, she can have more inventory to stock her business. This loan can improve her business because she can buy greater quantities of cooking utensils and always have merchandise available. 

Her dream is to be able to keep growing her sales and earn more income so she will be able to afford her necessities. The profits will be invested in making her loan repayments and enlarging her business.

loans.use: to purchase cooking utensils to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more goats, which he will raise and sell

loans.name: Terisa

texts.en:
Terisa is 28 years old and has one child. She has a small business of 'elei' printing. She has four years of experience with this business.

Terisa needs a loan to buy paint, design board, sponge, and other materials. She will use her profits to build up an 'elei' shop and to support her family financially. Terisa joined SPBD in 2001, to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to buy materials for making 'elei,' including paint, design board, and sponge

loans.name: Lito

texts.en:
Lito is 36 years old and lives with his partner in the Rizal. The main industries in the area are agriculture, cattle-raising, and trade. The community has basic amenities such as water and electricity, and is located in the Tumuini area, which is part of the region. 

Lito works growing and selling rice, and has been doing this for over five years. He is requesting a loan of Php 50,000 from ASKI to buy fertilizer and to pay for the maintenance of his rice plantation so that he can generate more income for his family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and to pay for the maintenance of his rice plantation

loans.name: Gregoria

texts.es: Gregoria se dedica al cultivo de productos agricolas en combinacion con la cria  de animales o explotacion mixta  Gregoria es de las que recibe ingresos semanales  por la venta de su produccion Gregoria ha estado comparando su situacion con la de otras agricultoras y ha llegado a la conclusión de que necesita un credito para invertir en la compra de semilla mejorada para su actividad para incrementar sus ingresos Gregoria es una mujer muy responsable por lo que se recomienda ayudarla
texts.en:
Gregoria engages in the cultivation of agricultural products along with raising animals, which is also known as mixed farming. She generates a weekly income from the sale of her products.

Gregoria compared her situation to other farmers and came to the conclusion that she needs a loan. She will invest in the purchase of improved seeds for her business so that she can increase her earnings. Gregoria is very responsible woman, so she is being recommended for assistance.

loans.use: to buy improved seeds for cultivation.

loans.name: Confiance Group

texts.fr:
Les quatre membres du groupe   CONFIANCE  sont des femmes mariées avec une moyenne d’âge de 39 ans, et ont en moyenne 3 enfants. Elles vivent la plupart dans des familles traditionnelles à OUAYERMA I un des quartiers populaires de la ville de Sikasso 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles sont à leur troisième prêt solidaire avec l’institution de micro finance Soro Yiriwaso afin de satisfaire le besoin de leur clientèle. 
Madame AFOUCHATA débout à la première position de la droite vers la gauche sur la photo dans ce groupe des femmes CONFIANCE, fait la vente d’encens.
Elle compte acheter avec son prêt  5 bouteilles de parfums guéni, des quantités importantes  des matières premières pour la préparation d'encens  d’où elle est beaucoup sollicitée de sa clientèle par la qualité de ses produits.
La vente se fait en détail dans le marché à une clientèle composée des hommes et des femmes au comptant et à crédit.
Elle  envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 30 000 francs CFA dont une partie est  utilisée  pour payer le prêt et son interêt et l’autre pour son épargne.
texts.en:
The four members of the Trust group are married women who on average are 39 years old with three children. Most of them live in traditional families in Ouayerma I, one of the populous areas of the city of Sikasso, in the third administrative region of Mali.

They are on their third group loan with the  Soro Yiriwaso micro-finance institution, to meet the needs of their customers.

Mrs. Afouchata, who is standing in the first position from right to left in the photo of this Trust group of women, sells incense.

With the loan she intends to buy five bottles of gueni (a fragrant root) perfume, and large quantities of raw materials for the preparation of incense.

She is in high demand by her customers due to the quality of her products. Retail sales are conducted in the market, to a clientele composed of men and women, for cash and on credit.

She expects to make an average monthly profit of 30,000 CFA francs, a portion of which will be used to pay the loan and its interest, and the remainder put into savings.

loans.use: buy raw materials to make incense

loans.name: Elsie

texts.en:
Elsie is 36 years old and married, and she has four children. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines. She has been running the general store for one year, and she earns additional income from selling purified drinking water.

She has requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF. She will use it to buy additional items to sell, like juice, shampoo, coffee, canned goods, diapers, and sanitary pads. Elsie has borrowed and repaid four loans from NWTF, before this loan.

Elsie aspires to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy additional items to sell, like shampoo, coffee, and canned goods

loans.name: Mercedita

texts.en:
As a married mother of two children, Mercedita works hard to support her family. She has a business selling tobacco in the Philippines and she also earns additional income from fruit vending.  Mercedita is borrowing PHP 10000 through NWTF in order to purchase more stocks of tobacco to sell to her customers.

Mercedita has been sustaining her business activities through her past six loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks of tobacco to sell.

loans.name: Emielyn

texts.en:
Emielyn is 36 years old, and married with two children.

Emielyn works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a 13,000 Philippine Pesos (PHP) loan through NWTF to buy more stocks to sell in her general store.

Emielyn has borrowed and repaid five loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for three years, and she earns additional income from selling purified drinking water.

Emielyn wants to expand her business to help to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more stocks to sell in her general store

loans.name: Jose Rosario

texts.es:
José, es una persona que se esfuerza por trabajar para que su familia cuente con lo necesario para tener una vida digna, vive junto a su compañera de vida y un hijo de 14 años de edad; desde hace 10 años se dedica a la siembra de granos básicos tales como frijol, maíz y maicillo, al mismo tiempo practica la crianza de ganado, estos trabajos lo hace junto a su compañera de vida. Por el momento no tiene dificultades en administrarlo. 
Con el préstamo fortalecerá su negocio comprando concentrado para ganado, herbicidas, plaguicidas, semilla, insecticidas y abono, con esta compra tendrá una cosecha más abundante y sana, así mismo mejorara la alimentación de su ganado, esperando recuperar lo invertido con buenas ganancias y resarcir la deuda.
Su visión es trabajar mucho para lograr tener un negocio más rentable y así  tener mejores condiciones de vida junto a su familia.
texts.en:
Jose is a person who puts a lot of effort into his work so that his family can have what is necessary to lead a dignified life. He lives with his life partner and his 14-year old son. Together with his life partner, he has grown staple grains such as beans, corn, and sorghum while raising livestock for ten years.  For the time being, he doesn't have any difficulties managing his work.

With this loan, he will strengthen his business by buying feed for his livestock, herbicides, pesticides, seeds, insecticides, and manure. This purchase will allow him to have a more abundant and healthy harvest and improve the feed of his livestock towards the aim of earning back what he has invested, making good profits, and repaying his debt.  His vision is to work hard to have a more profitable business and therefore improve the quality of life of his family.

loans.use: to buy feed for livestock, herbicides, pesticides, seeds, insecticides and manure

loans.name: Hector

texts.es:
Héctor tiene 46 años de edad, de estado civil conviviente tiene 4 hijos dependientes que viven en el Distrito de Querocotillo, una comunidad con clima variado, su población se dedica a la agricultura, especialmente al cultivo de café, maíz amarillo, ganadería y comercio que se ubica en la Provincia de Cutervo que pertenece a la Región Cajamarca, sierra norte del Perú.

El se dedica a la destilación de “aguardiente”, una bebida que se procesa artesanalmente a base del jugo de la caña, con un equipo artesanal llamado trapiche. ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 2 000 nuevos soles para la compra de equipos de destilación que le permitirán procesar en mayor cantidad y de esta manera generar mayores ingresos para su familia.
texts.en:
Héctor is 46 years old. He is in a common law marriage and lives with his four children in the District of Querocotillo, a community with a varied climate located in the Province of Cutervo in the Cajamarca region of the northern highlands of Peru. The population there works in agriculture, particularly in the cultivation of coffee, yellow corn, livestock, and trade. 

He works distilling "aguardiente," a beverage that is processed with a cane juice base using a piece of artisanal equipment called a mill. He has applied for a loan to Edpyme Alternativa for 2,000 soles to purchase equipment that will allow him to distill in greater quantity and thus generate more income for his family.

loans.use: to buy a mill used for distilling beverages.

loans.name: Lala Lemou

texts.fr:
Madame LALA  LEMOU est née en Décembre 1964 à BAMAKO, mariée et mère de 5 enfants, elle réside avec son époux et leurs enfants dans une famille traditionnelle à KADIOLO un cercle dans la région de Sikasso 3ième région administrative de la république du MALI. 
Cette brave femme après avoir mener beaucoup d’activité sans succès madame LALA LEMOU s’est initiée des activités d’achat et de vente des friperies, des essences. Elle s’approvisionne à BAMAKO.
A fin de satisfaire le besoin de sa clientèle de plus en plus croissante, elle sollicite auprès de l’Institution de Micro Finance Soro Yiriwaso un treizième prêt individuel commerçant. Les prêts antérieurs ont été correctement remboursé.
Ce prêt lui permettra de faire l’achat de 2 balles de friperies, 8 bidons de 20 litres d’essences pour la revendre en détail au marché à une clientèle composée d’homme et de femme au comptant et à crédit.  
Elle envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 82 000 francs CFA par mois. Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer le prêt et son intérêt et l’autre pour son épargne.
texts.en:
Mrs. Lala Lemou was born in December,1964 in Bamako. She is married with five children, and lives with her husband and their children in a traditional family in Kadiolo, a district circle in the region of Sikasso, the third administrative region of the Republic of Mali.

After unsuccessful attempts at a number of activities, this courageous woman began dealing in second-hand clothing and gasoline. She resupplies in Bamako.

To satisfy the needs of a steadily growing number of customers, she is requesting a thirteenth individual merchant loan from the  Soro Yiriwaso micro-finance institution. Previous loans have been fully repaid.

This loan will enable her to buy two bales of second-hand clothes and eight 20-liter cans of gasoline, for retail sales at the market, to a clientele composed of men and women, for cash and on credit.

She plans to attain an average monthly profit of 82,000 CFA francs. This profit will enable her to pay off the loan and its interest, and put the rest into savings.

loans.use: buy various items

loans.name: Abdoulaye

texts.fr:
Monsieur ABDOULAYE est né en août 1971 à KADIOLO, marié et père de 5 enfants  il réside avec son épouse dans une famille traditionnelle à KAI un village de cercle de KADIOLO  dans la région de SIKASSO 3ième région administrative de la république du MALI. 
Monsieur ABDOULAYE mène des activités d’achat et de vente de céréales  il ya plus de 10 ans, il s'approvisionne à KAI , à LOULOUNI et dans les villages environnants de KAI.
 Il est à son neuvième prêt  individuel  avec l’Institution de Micro Finance Soro Yiriwaso dans le souci de mieux satisfaire sa clientèle de plus en plus croissant. Les prêts précédents ont été correctement remboursés.  
Ce prêt lui permettra de faire l’achat de 40 sacs de 100 kg de céréales ( maïs, mil ) après l’achat il les stocke durant un moment dans son magasin à domicile avant la revente. La vente s’effectue en détail au marché  à une clientèle composée d’homme et de femme au comptant et à crédit.
 Il envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 110 000 francs CFA par mois. Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer le prêt et son intérêt et investir le reste dans son activité.
texts.en:
Mr. Abdoulaye was born in August, 1971 in Kadiolo. He is married with five children, and lives with his wife in a traditional family in Kai, a village in the circle of Kadiolo, which is part of Sikasso, the third administrative region of the Republic of Mali.

Mr. Abdoulaye has been in business trading grain cereals for more than ten years. He gets his supplies from Kai and Loulouni, and from the villages surrounding Kai.

This is his ninth individual loan with the Soro Yiriwaso micro-finance institution, in order to better satisfy his increasing number of customers. All previous loans have been fully repaid.

This loan will enable him to buy forty 100-kilo bags of cereals (maize, millet). After purchase, he stores them for a while in his shop at home before reselling. Retail sales are conducted in the market to a clientele composed of men and women, for cash and on credit.

He expects average monthly profits of 110,000 CFA francs, which will enable him to pay off the loan and its interest, and invest the rest in his activity.

loans.use: buy grain cereals

loans.name: Gabriel Eugenio

texts.es: Gabriel tiene 33 años de edad y habita en casa propia junto a su esposa, su hijo de 16 años y su hija de 110 años de edad. Gabriel trabaja como albañil desde hace mucho tiempo lo cual le permite ganarse el sustento diario y dar a su familia lo necesario. Gabriel es un hombre trabajador y visionario quien desea construir un cuarto dormitorio para para lo cual solicita este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la compra de los materiales necesarios como: cemento, ladrillo, arena y hierro.
texts.en: Gabriel is 33 years old and lives at home with his wife, his 16-year-old son, and 10-year-old daughter. Gabriel has worked as a bricklayer for a long time, allowing him to earn his daily sustenance and give his family what they need. Gabriel is a hard-working and visionary man who wants to build a bedroom. He is requesting this loan through FUSAI to buy the necessary materials such as cement, bricks, sand, and iron.

loans.use: to buy cement, bricks, sand, and iron to build a room.

loans.name: Jose Rumaldo

texts.es:
José, opta por un  nuevo préstamo para invertirlo en insumos agrícolas, de esta manera aprovechar la temporada de invierno para sembrar, comprara abono, semilla, insecticidas, herbicidas y plaguicidas, que son necesarios para poder acondicionar el terreno en el que realiza la siembra y ayudar a tener un buen desarrollo de los cultivos.
En la temporada pasada con la ayuda del crédito anterior tuvo un impacto positivo, pues sus producción ha sido muy abundante, su núcleo familiar sigue siendo el mismo con la diferencia que hoy viven en mejores circunstancias.
texts.en:
Jose is applying for a new loan to invest in agricultural inputs and therefore take advantage of the winter season to plant seeds and buy the manure, seeds, insecticides, herbicides, and pesticides necessary to be able to condition the land that he is planting and help his crops to develop well.  

The previous loan had a positive impact last season, since his production was very abundant.  His immediate family continues to be the same, with the difference being that today they live under better circumstances.

loans.use: to buy manure, seeds, insecticides, herbicides, and pesticides

loans.name: Jiosima

texts.en:
Jiosima, 41, is a married woman with five children who are in school. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. 

Jiosima has a banana-vending business in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more bananas to sell. She has been in this business for 10 years. 

In the future, Jiosima would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more bananas to sell.

loans.name: Lesly Carolina

texts.es:
La Señora Lesly  es una persona muy trabajadora y responsable  humilde vive junto a su hija en una comunidad en la zona sur de Honduras. Su negocio es la venta  de ropa y cosméticos  el cual es muy conocido en su caserío.
Lesly necesita el préstamo para la compra de mercadería  como: lociones,  cremas,  talcos  y desodorantes. Los cuales  necesita para seguir  vendiendo su  producto. Ella espera que gracias al préstamo poder contar con los productos  necesarios para seguir realizando su negocio y así cubrir la demanda de sus clientes y de igual manera que las ventas tengan un gran aumento considerable el cual se vea reflejado en la calidad de vida de la familia en el hogar con el aumento de los ingresos.
Ella espera que su negocio  siga creciendo y convirtiéndose en el más conocido de la comunidad para de esta manera poder seguir apoyando a su familia y  que  sus hijas continúe con los estudios y tengan mayores oportunidades en la vida.

Choluteca, Honduras – Mayo  del  2014
texts.en:
Lesly is a very hard-working, responsible, and humble person who lives with her daughter in a community in southern Honduras.  Her clothing and cosmetics business is very well known in her small village.  

Lesly needs a loan to buy goods such as lotions, creams, talcum powder, and deodorant, which she needs to continue selling her products.  She hopes that the loan will enable her to count on the products necessary to continue operating her business and therefore cover the demand of her clients and increase her sales considerably.  This increase in earnings will be reflected in the quality of life of her household.

She hopes that her business continues to grow and becomes the most well known in the community so that she can continue to support her family and allow her daughters to continue their studies and have greater opportunities in their lives.  

Choluteca, Honduras
May 2014

loans.use: to buy lotions, creams, talcum powder, and deodorant for her business

loans.name: Fidelia Mariela

texts.es:
Al entrar a la pulpería de Fidelia, de 30 años, la amabilidad es quien nos da la bienvenida, mientras atiende a un niño quien llegaba a comprar leche. Esta madre soltera, terminó su universidad e inició hace 6 años con su negocio propio, pues necesitaba cubrir las inversiones de su pequeño hijo y ella. La joven comerciante, había solicitado un préstamo tiempo atrás, préstamo el cual le ayudó a comprar granos básicos, gaseosas, pan, entre otros productos para seguir creciendo.
Tras ver sus buenos resultados, haber cumplido sus metas cercanas, trabajando bien y cumplido con los pagos, nuevamente necesita de un nuevo préstamo para volver a invertir en su pulpería. Fidelia piensa comprar arroz, frijoles, azúcar, sardina, huevos, entre otros productos de gran demanda. Con el apoyo de su familia y MiCrédito-KIVA sabe que va a salir adelante y más ahora que se está pasando la crisis de la canasta básica en Nicaragua. Considera que son empeño y dedicación saldrá adelante, cancelara este nuevo préstamo, seguirá trabajando con MiCrédito, seguirá creciendo hasta llegar a ser autosuficiente.
texts.en:
Upon entering Fidelia's grocery, one will notice her friendliness welcoming people while she attends to a child who came to buy milk. This single mother, age 30, finished college six years ago and started her own business as she needed to cover the costs for her and her son. Fidelia requested a loan a while back which helped her to buy bulk grains, soft drinks, bread, and other products to get ahead.

After seeing good results, having fulfilled her immediate goals and working hard to make ​​the payments, she again needs a new loan to re-invest in her grocery store. Fidelia plans to buy rice, beans, sugar, sardines, eggs, and other high-demand products. With the support of her family and MiCrédito-KIVA, she knows she will get ahead especially now that there is a crisis with basic needs stores in Nicaragua. She believes that with resolve and dedication she can get ahead, repay the new loan, and continue to work with MiCrédito to grow and become self-sufficient.

loans.use: to buy rice, beans, sugar, sardines, eggs, and other products.

loans.name: Jesusa

texts.en:
Jesusa is married with 5 children. She is 55 years old and lives in Libertad Alto, Sinacaban, Philippines.

Jesusa is a farmer and grows corn crops to earn a living, and she has been doing this for 10 years. She has requested a loan to buy sacks of fertilizers. She has been a member of PMPC for 9 years.

In the future, Jesusa hopes to save for future consumption.

loans.use: to buy sacks of fertilizers

loans.name: Lusia

texts.en:
Lusia is 55 years old and married with 7 children. 

She runs a small food stall business in her community and has been doing this for 10 years. Lusia has requested a loan to buy a new oven, taro, bananas, large pots, salt, cooking oil, a new deep freezer, plastic bags, wrapping foil and taro leaves. She joined SPBD in 2007 to gain access to capital. 

With her earnings, Lusia will help with her family's weekly expenses.

loans.use: to buy a new oven, taro, bananas, large pots, salt, cooking oil, a new deep freezer, plastic bags, wrapping foil and taro leaves

loans.name: Valentino

texts.en:
Planting and harvesting rice is how Valentino spends his time.
