He has been growing rice for 20 years, and with his long experience in the farming business, Valentino can say that his expertise helps him to gain a higher income. He knows what his crops need, and when. 

With his aim to get higher yields, Valentino is requesting a loan of PHP 30,000 to pay for the cost of land preparation and laborers for planting his fields. He will also use the loan to buy fertilizers and seeds. 

Valentino expects higher income if he applies the exact amount of farm inputs required in his fields.

loans.use: to pay for the cost of land preparation and laborers for planting his fields.

loans.name: Jirah Grace

texts.en:
Jirah Grace is studying at university as she has the ambition to make a better living in the future. She is single and lives in Liloan, Bonifacio, Misamis Occidental with her family. Her parents work as dressmakers. She is very determined and wants to finish her studies in order to have a bright future of her own. 

She is thankful to GDMPC because, with their specialized services for students, they give every student a chance to continue studying. 

She has taken out a new loan recently to pay for the school tuition fees for the first semester for this current year. She hopes to be successful and be able to have a good job in the future to reward her for her untiring efforts.

loans.use: to pay the school tuition fees for the first semester

loans.name: Jocely

texts.en:
Jocely works hard to support her family. She is married and has a buy-and-sell, ready-to-wear business in the Philippines.

Jocely has requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stock of ready-to-wear to sell. She has been in this business for 10 years now.

In the future, she would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of ready-to-wear to sell

loans.name: Phrister

texts.en:
Phrister is a hardworking woman. She is 24 years old and lives in the town of Kitintale in the Kampala South region of Uganda. She is single and has one child who is currently in school. 

For the past 2 years, Phrister has been working hard to manage her restaurant, which sells cooked food and soft drinks. 

To help expand her business, she has requested a loan of 800,000 Ugandan Shillings (UGX) from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy food items and soft drinks, and will help her to generate greater profits and to educate her child. She hopes that in the future she will be able to build a house. 

Phrister is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities and a forum for life skills training.

loans.use: to buy food items and soft drinks

loans.name: Numia

texts.en: Numia is 32 years old and single with four children. She runs a small business selling fish in her community and has been doing this for more than five years. Numia has requested a loan to buy a torch, fishing net, a spear, goggles, etc. She joined SPBD in 2000 to gain access to capital. With her earnings, Numia will use her profit to support her children's education.

loans.use: to buy a torch, fishing net, a spear, and goggles

loans.name: Norma

texts.en: Despite being a widow, Norma was able to improve their living conditions. Norma developed her retailing business selling a variety of grocery items in their village. Aside from the retailing business, Norma manages their farm. She grows rice in their fields. Due to the high cost of farm inputs in the market, Norma is requesting a loan of PHP 50,000 to buy seeds, fertilizers, and herbicides for her rice crops. Norma believes that by applying the exact amount of these inputs, she will harvest higher yields than her usual yields. Norma hopes to earn a higher income for the future of her children.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizers, and herbicides for her rice crops

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en: Elizabeth owns and operates a plot of farmland, cultivating rice and harvesting it for sale to earn a living. She has successfully repaid her previous loans used for the farm and was able to put in a new plot of rice as expansion. To improve the farm, she took a new loan to buy farm inputs like seeds and fertilizer. In the future, Elizabeth hopes to expand her farm.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs like seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Marina

texts.en:
As a married mother of five children, Marina works hard to support her family.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines and earns additional income from rice retailing. Marina is borrowing PHP 21,000 through NWTF in order to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Marina has been sustaining her business activities through her past seven loans from NWTF and more recently, through Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Esmeralda

texts.en:
Esmeralda is 34 years old and has five children. She is married and three of her children are currently in school.

Esmeralda is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. Esmeralda requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Esmeralda has been raising pigs for 10 years now and has borrowed five times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

In the future, she would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Donato

texts.en: Donato is married and has spent three years in the rice production business. He will use the Kiva loan to pay for labor costs and buy fertilizer for planting rice. He needs to buy fertilizer in order to increase production. With the profits from his farming, he wishes to invest in his business so that in the future, he can acquire machines and tractors that will enhance his farming capacity.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pay labor costs

loans.name: Noel

texts.en: Noel is happily married and living with his wife and children. Noel is sending his children to school. He runs his farming business, which involves growing rice in their fields. Noel is working hard to take care of his rice crops. He always visits his crops in their field to be sure that his crops are not affected by any crop diseases. Noel is asking for a loan of PHP 35,000 to buy farm inputs such as seeds, herbicides, pesticides, and fertilizers. He is managing his farming business well, since it is his only source of income.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs such as seeds, herbicides, pesticides, and fertilizers.

loans.name: Sandra Del Carmen

texts.es:
Sandra tiene 32 años de edad, estudió hasta cuarto grado de educación básica, está acompañada y su pareja trabaja de motorista en la alcaldía de la ciudad, tiene 2 hijos que están estudiando en la escuela, y son los que dependen de Sandra.

Ella tiene un negocio de venta de atol chuco y atol agrio en la ciudad donde vive, la venta la hace todas las tardes, ella decidió implementarlo ya que es una manera de ganarse la vida honradamente y por la necesidad de sacar adelante   sus hijos.

Ella utilizará el préstamo para comprar materia prima para ampliar más su negocio, comprará 3 mesas, 2 quintales de azúcar, 2 docenas de trastos y golosinas que le agrega al atol, el préstamo le servirá de mucho ya que podrá darles un mejor servicio a sus clientes y obtendrá mayores ingresos.

Su sueño para un futuro es tener un buen negocio establecido que le permita generar ingresos diariamente, pues necesita seguir ayudando a sus hijos para que sigan estudiando.
texts.en:
Sandra is 32 years old. She finished the fourth grade of primary school and has a partner who works as a motorcyclist for the municipality. She has two children who go to school and those two are the only ones who depend on Sandra.

She has a business selling "atol chuco" and "atol agrio" (typical warm cornflour soups) in the town where she lives. She sells them every afternoon. She decided to set up this business because it is a honorable way of earning money, and because it is necessary to get her two children ahead.

She will use the loan to buy prime materials in order to increase her business. She will buy three tables, two quintals of sugar, two dozen dishes, and sweet treats which she adds to the atol. The loan will help her a lot, because she will be able to offer a better service to her clients and earn more money.

Her dream for the future is to have a good and established business which allows her go make money every day, because she has to help her children to continue their education.

loans.use: to buy prime materials to increase her business: to buy 3 tables, 2 quintals of sugar, 2 dozen dishes, and sweet treats which she adds to the atol.

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn is a married woman with six children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Jocelyn is 45 years old and has five children who are currently in school.

Jocelyn has a sound system rental business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional spare parts and tools for her business.

Jocelyn has been in this business for three years. In the future, Jocelyn would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional spare parts and tools for her business

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn is 62 years old and married with two children. She works very hard to provide for them.

Evelyn runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more items like soy sauce, noodles, bread, shampoo, coffee, sugar, etc. to sell.

She has been in this business for seven years and sells a variety of items such as soy sauce, noodles, bread, shampoo, coffee, sugar, etc. 

Evelyn would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more items like soy sauce, noodles, bread, shampoo, coffee, and sugar

loans.name: Ahmmed

texts.en:
Ahmmed is a 40-year-old married man with four children. His oldest child is 15 years old and the youngest one is 4 years old, living with them in their own house in Dhamer, Yemen. Ahmmed has a University education. He is a very active and dynamic man. He wants to provide his family with a better future. Unfortunately, the country passes with many crises. One of these crises is the powering off of the electricity. Many of the people live in darkness most of the nights around the country. The electricity crisis is one of the biggest problems in Yemen, especially after the 2011 revolution. Many of the people purchase a power generator in order to get suitable light. For this reason, Ahmmed applied for a loan of 200,000 YER from AMB to purchase a power generator for the house.

Ahmmed looks forward to improving the living standards of his family. He hopes to start his own business in order to provide his family with a secure future.

loans.use: to purchase a power generator for the house

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy metal sheets, wood, and nails to repair the roof of her home.

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan has four children and her husband is working abroad. She did not have the opportunity to enter college due to financial constraints, and did not even experience entering high school. Susan has made this experience from her own childhood her inspiration to succeed with the business she now has so she can provide a better way of living for her children.

Susan is engaged in a retail business selling grocery items and beverages. She is wanting to borrow a loan of PHP 20,000 to buy grocery items like canned goods, noodles, powdered milk, coffee and sugar. She hopes to sell more items and increase her income. Susan will prioritize her children's school allowances with the profit she produces from her business.

loans.use: to buy grocery items like canned goods, noodles, powdered milk, coffee and sugar.

loans.name: Wilson

texts.en:
Wilson is 34 years old and very responsible with his household obligations since he has always been known to provide the best for his family. He currently lives with his wife and two children. He is a farmer who plants varieties of vegetables.

Wilson wants to increase his sales. Consequently, he has requested a loan that will enable him to purchase seeds, compost and fertilizer, among other items, so that he can continue to put bread on the table in his home.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, compost and fertilizer

loans.name: Jovia

texts.en:
Jovia is a hardworking woman. She is 18 years old and lives in the town of Kitintale in the Kampala South region of Uganda. She is single and has no children. For the past 1.5 years, Jovia has been working hard to manage her clothing shop, where she sells kids clothes. 

To help expand her business, Jovia has requested a loan of 300,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more stock of clothes, and will help Jovia to generate greater profits and educate her siblings. Jovia hopes that in the future, she will be able to improve the family's welfare. 

Jovia is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities, and a forum for life-skills training.


"

loans.use: to buy more stock of clothes

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy merchandise to use in her business selling beauty products.

loans.name: Fatima

texts.en:
Fatima is a 26-year-old married woman living with her spouse in Mokala, Yemen. She is uneducated but she is very active and dynamic. Fatima has been working for more than two years selling women's clothes door to door. She has found this business to be profitable for her.

To further expand her business, Fatima has asked for a loan of 45,000 YER from AMB in order to purchase more women's clothes to sell to her customers.

She looks forward to expanding her business more through purchasing all kinds of women's clothes, accessories, make-up, and perfumes.

loans.use: to purchase more women's clothes to sell to her customers

loans.name: Roselinda

texts.en:
Roselinda is a married woman with five children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Roselinda is 36 years old and all of her children are in school.

Roselinda has a food vending business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 14,000 loan through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business.

Roselinda has been in this business for six years. In the future, Roselinda would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose, aged 16, is a hard-working woman. She is single and has no children currently in school. Rose lives in the town of Kitintale in the Kampala south region of Uganda. For the past three years, Rose has been working hard to manage her food stall which sells food items. 

To help expand her business, Rose has requested a loan of 800,000 Ugandan shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy soft drinks to add to her stock. This will help Rose to generate greater profits and educate her siblings. Rose hopes that in the future she will be able to complete her studies. 

Rose is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to micro-finance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities, and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: to buy soft drinks to add to her stock

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
Maria, aged 21, is a hard-working woman. She is single and has no children. Maria lives in the town of Kitintale in the Kampala south region of Uganda. For the past three years, she has been working hard to manage her restaurant which sells cooked food. 

To help expand her business, Maria has requested a loan of 800,000 Ugandan shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy food items like bananas, meat, rice and potatoes for her restaurant. This will help Maria to generate greater profits and improve her standard of living. She hopes that in the future she will be able to become a wholesaler. 

Maria is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to micro-finance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities, and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: to buy food items like bananas, meat, rice and potatoes for her restaurant

loans.name: Lorna

texts.en:
Lorna is single and has had a banana vending business in the Philippines for the past four years.

She has requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more bananas to sell to her customers.

In the future, Lorna would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more bananas to sell to her customers

loans.name: Madelyn

texts.en:
Madelyn, aged 32, is married and has two children, one of whom is currently in school. She is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines which she has been doing for the past three years

Madelyn has borrowed five times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business. She is now requesting a PHP 16,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of feed, vitamins and other supplies for her business.

Madelyn would like to build and expand her business to secure her family's future.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of feed, vitamins and other supplies for her pig-raising business

loans.name: Maria Anabelle

texts.en:
Maria Anabelle is 39 years old and married with four children. With two children currently in school, she works very hard to provide for them. Maria Anabelle has run a general store in the Philippines for the past six years. She sells a variety of items such as vinegar, seasonings, coffee, canned goods, fabric conditioner, detergent soap, etc. 

Maria Anabelle has requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to buy more groceries to sell in her general store.

In the future, she would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell in her general store

loans.name: Luis Ramon

texts.es:
El orden y la limpieza son las principales características del pequeño taller de vulcanización de Luis, donde día a día repara gran cantidad de neumáticos, al mismo tiempo brinda productos de calidad y excelente atención. Tiene 42 años, está casado y tiene tres hijos. Es un hombre trabajador y emprendedor, hace 14 años inició en el negocio con el objetivo de mejorar la situación económica, poco a poco, con el apoyo de su esposa ha ido progresando.
Luis solicita otro crédito para la compra de un motor compresor, con el que espera  incrementar la reparación de los neumáticos, puesto que agilizará el procedimiento, de tal manera que logrará obtener más clientela. Él está muy agradecido con el primer financiamiento de Kiva a través de MiCrédito, puesto que logró comprar productos para la pequeña pulpería de su esposa, lo que ha sido un soporte en la economía familiar. Por lo tanto, espera seguir trabajando para poder brindarle a su familia educación y salud de calidad.
texts.en:
Tidiness and cleanliness are the main characteristics of Luis’ small workshop, where he repairs a great number of tires every day. At the same time, he offers high-quality products and excellent service. He is 42 years old, married with three children. He is a hard-working and enterprising man. He started his business 14 years ago with the aim to improve his economic situation and, bit by bit, with the help of his wife, he got ahead.

Luis aks for a new loan to buy a compressor engine. With this engine, he hopes to be able to repair more tires, because it will streamline his work. So he will be able to attract more customers.

He is very grateful for his first Kiva loan via MiCrédito, because he could buy products for the small grocery store of his wife, which was a great economic support for the family. Therefore, he hopes to be able to continue to work and to offer his family an education and good health.

loans.use: to buy a compressor engine.

loans.name: Jaime Alonso

texts.es:
Jaime desde hace 5 años se dedica a la producción agrícola y diariamente se levanta para trabajar y atender sus tierras en las cuales tiene cultivos principalmente de plátano.
Es una actividad aprendida de manera empírica y poco a poco ha ido perfeccionando sus técnicas y habilidades en este campo.
Adicionalmente genera ingresos alternos gracias a sus conocimientos en panadería, hecho por lo cual elabora y vende panes.
Hoy en día se siente orgulloso de lo que ha podido construir con su esfuerzo y se siente muy agradecido con la vida por las oportunidades que le brinda.
El pide un préstamo para invertirlo en la compra de abonos, riegos y pesticidas, de este modo mantener sus tierras en optimas condiciones para los cultivos, también para comprar un horno de panadería.
Su mayor sueño es tener una casa propia y allí poder disfrutar de su vejez al lado de su esposa.
texts.en:
Jaime has worked in farming for 5 years, and every day he gets up to work and tend his fields where he grows mainly plantains. He learnt this activity empirically and, bit by bit, perfected his techniques and habits in this area. In addition, he has another source of income thanks to his knowledge in baking, which allows him to make and sell bread.

Today, he takes pride in what he could achieve with his hard work, and he is very thankful for the opportunities he has been offered in life. 

He asks for a loan to invest it in the purchase of fertilizer, irrigation, and pesticides. By this he wants to keep his fields in the best condition for his crop. In addition, he wants to buy an oven for baking.

His greatest dream is to have his own house, where he can enjoy his old age together with his wife.

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies and a baking oven.

loans.name: Elsie

texts.en: Elsie is 35 years old and has one sibling. Despite hardships, she and her husband are determined to uplift their status of living. To earn additional income, they also engage in making and selling soft brooms within their community. They want to make more soft brooms to sell, but they have limited capital. For this reason, Elsie is requesting for a loan of PHP 8,000 to buy the needed soft brooms, plastics and rattan. Through this financial assistance, they are hoping that they will produce more soft brooms and earn sufficient income.

loans.use: to buy soft brooms, plastics and rattan.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for the tuition fees for her son.

loans.name: Zenaida

texts.en:
Zenaida is 48 years old and lives in Becor Taboo, Jimenez, Philippines. She is married with two children. 

Zenaida works in the fish industry and sells fish for a living. She has been doing this for 20 years. She has requested a loan to buy fishing materials and accessories.

Zenaida has been a member of PMPC for six years. She is thankful that her fishing activities brought good fortune for her family and that she is able to support the education of her children.

loans.use: to buy fishing materials and accessories.

loans.name: Phiona

texts.en:
Phiona, aged 18, is a hard-working woman. She is single and has no children currently in school. Phiona lives in the town of Kitintale in the Kampala south region of Uganda. For the past two years, she has been working hard to manage her timber sales business.

To help expand her business, Phiona has requested a loan of 300,000 Ugandan shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy timber, and will help Phiona to generate greater profits and pay her school fees. She hopes that in the future she will be able to expand  the business. 

Phiona is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to micro-finance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities, and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: to buy timber to sell

loans.name: Merlene

texts.en:
Merlene is 29 years old, married and has two children. To earn additional income, she engages in making and selling soft brooms within her community. 

Despite the hardships of living, Merlene and her husband aim to improve their status of living in order to educate their children and give them a better life. With this in mind, Merlene wants to strengthen her business to generate sufficient income. 

Due to insufficient capital, she would like to request a loan of PHP 8,000 to buy soft brooms, and the rattan and plastics needed. Through this loan, she believes that she will make her business more profitable.

loans.use: to buy soft brooms, and the rattan and plastics needed

loans.name: Winnie

texts.en:
Winnie is a hard-working woman. Winnie is 19 years old and lives in the town of Kitintale in the Kampala south region of Uganda. She is single and has no children. For the past three years, Winnie has been working hard to manage her clothing shop, which sells ladies and children's clothes. 

To help expand her business, Winnie has requested a loan of 300,000 Ugandan shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more clothes, and will help Winnie generate greater profits and improve family welfare. She hopes that in the future she will be able to open up another branch. 

Winnie is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: to buy more clothes.

loans.name: Marlyn

texts.en:
Marlyn, aged 42, is a married woman with three children who are in school. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur who has had a food vending business in the Philippines for the past 14 years. 

Marlyn has requested a PHP 18,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional ingredients like sliced bread, pasta, meat, flour, etc. for her business.

In the future, she would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy ingredients like sliced bread, pasta, meat, flour, etc. for her business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase construction materials such as slabs and cement to repair his old house.

loans.name: Maria Gloria

texts.en:
Maria Gloria is widowed and has a fish vending business in the Philippines. She works hard to support her family and has been in this business for the past 45 years. 

Maria Gloria has requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more fish to sell to her customers.

In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more fish to sell to her customers

loans.name: Essineta

texts.pt:
Nasceu em Chibuto Província de Gaza tem 57 anos de idade, é viúva, mãe de 4 filhos maiores de idade, responsabiliza-se pelas suas sobrinhas que vivem em sua casa.
É reformada do banco Millennium bim. Com este empréstimo pretende dar continuidade a sua obra adquirindo material de construção como: cimento, blocos e areia. Este é o seu 6º empréstimo na hluvuku, sendo que os últimos foram aplicados para mesma actividade.
Futuramente pretende construir dependências para aluguer.
texts.en:
Essineta was born in Chibuto, in the Gaza province of Mozambique. She is 57 years old and is a widow, and has four grown children. She cares for her nieces, who live with her.
Essineta is retired; she worked for the Millennium BIM bank. With this loan she would like to continue with a construction project by buying materials such as cement, blocks, and sand. This is her 6th loan with Hluvuku (Kiva Field Partner), and her last few loans have also been for this construction project.
In the future she hopes to build outbuildings on the property to rent.

loans.use: continue with her construction project by buying materials such as cement, blocks, and sand.

loans.name: Shakira

texts.en:
Shakira, aged 16, is a hard-working woman who is single and has no children. She lives in the town of Kitintale in the Kampala south region of Uganda. For the past two years, Shakira has been working hard to manage her food stall business, which sells snacks and charcoal. 

To help expand her business, Shakira has requested a loan of 300,000 Ugandan shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more charcoal to sell. This will help her to generate greater profits and pay her school fees. Shakira hopes that in the future she will be able to move into a retail business. 

Shakira is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to micro-finance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities, and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: to buy more charcoal to sell

loans.name: Madinah

texts.en: Madinah is a hardworking woman. She is 22 years old and lives in the town of Kitintale in the Kampala south region of Uganda. She is single and has one child who is currently in school. For the past three years, Madinah has been working hard to manage her hair-dressing salon business. To help expand her business, Madinah has requested a loan of 600,000 Ugandan Shillings (UGX) from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy hair weaves and chemicals, and it will help Madinah to generate greater profits, educate her child and improve their welfare. Madinah hopes that in the future she will be able to expand the business. Madinah is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: to buy hair weaves and chemicals for her business.

loans.name: Sheena

texts.en:
Sheena is married and has one child. She runs a business as a travelling vendor of live chickens in different villages. Her husband is her partner in running the business. Sheena's husband is the one who drives their tricycle around to sell the chickens. 

Sheena was at the college level of education when she got married. Her dream is to finish her college education even though she already has her own family. By finishing college, this will lead her to provide a better future for her family. At present, Sheena's goal is to sell more chickens, earn profits and save some of these profits for her education.
 
Sheena is asking for a loan of PHP 21,000 to buy more live chickens to sell in villages. She hopes to earn more, continue her college education and finish it someday.

loans.use: to buy more live chickens to sell in villages.

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en: Erlinda manages their fish pond. She buys fingerlings from a fishery, puts them in their fish pond, and grows them for almost four months. The buyers come to their village and buy her tilapia (fish). Erlinda is applying for a loan of PHP 25,000 to buy feed for her fingerlings. She grows 10,000 fingerlings in their fishpond. Erlinda will use her loan wisely for her business. She will prioritize her children’s school allowances with her earnings, as she believes education is the greatest inheritance she can give her children.

loans.use: to buy feed for her fingerlings.

loans.name: Sumaiya

texts.en:
Sumaiya, aged 17, is a hard-working woman who is single and has no children. She lives in the town of Kitintale in the Kampala south region of Uganda. For the past two years, Sumaiya has been working hard to manage her hairdressing salon business. 

To help expand her business, Sumaiya has requested a loan of 600,000 Ugandan shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy chemicals, weaves and dryers. This will help Sumaiya to generate greater profits and expand the salon. She hopes that in the future she will be able to own a big well-known salon. 

Sumaiya is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to micro-finance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities, and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: to buy chemicals, weaves and dryers

loans.name: Lillian

texts.en: Lillian is a hardworking woman. Lillian is 19 years old and lives in the town of Kitintale in the Kampala south region of Uganda. She is single and has no children. For the past two years, Lillian has been working hard to manage her bakery business, which sells cakes, cookies and bread. To help expand her business, Lillian has applied for a loan of 600,000 Ugandan Shillings (UGX) from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy flour, sugar and icing, and it will help Lillian to generate greater profits and educate her siblings. Lillian hopes that in the future she will be able to own a big bakery in the area. Lillian is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: buy flour, sugar and icing for her bakery.

loans.name: Mealii

texts.en: Mealii is married and has three children. Two are in school and one is an adult. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are for school fees and food. She has operated fish-selling and tailoring businesses for the last two years, selling in the market to her neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. With the loan, she wants to purchase fish, and thread and fabrics, for her businesses. She decided to join Yehu to acquire business financial services.

loans.use: to purchase fish, and thread and fabrics, for her businesses.

loans.name: Siham

texts.en: Siham is a 51-year-old married woman from a small village near Hebron called Bane Na'eem. She is the mother of four sons and five daughters. Her husband is a construction worker with a low and unstable income. Ten years ago, Siham started her own project, which is a small sheep barn. She started with few sheep and goats and developed progressively from there. Siham took out a dollar loan from FATEN. This loan will help her to buy feed for her sheep and goats. By taking out this loan, Siham will be able to improve her project and increase its productivity. Siham appears in the photo in the sheep barn.

loans.use: to buy feed for her sheep and goats.

loans.name: Merlinda

texts.en:
Merlinda has been helping her husband operate their farm to make a living. For more than six years, they have been able to sustain their living standards and has successfully repaid her previous loan. 

The farm is still doing well, but she has to fertilize it to gain more produce. Earlier this month, she took out a new loan to purchase fertilizer. 

In the future, Merlinda wants to make improvements to her house and to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay her daughter’s tuition fees

loans.name: Bintimalim

texts.en:
Bintimalim is a married woman with three children, two of whom are in school and one who is under age. She owns a house that has piped water but no electricity. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

Bintimalim operates a food-making business, making food such as beans and chapati (flat bread) for sale to passersby and neighbours. 

With the loan, she wants to purchase food items, such as wheat flour, cooking oil and beans for her business. She dreams of expanding her business to earn more income and establish a restaurant in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase food items, such as wheat flour, cooking oil and beans for her business.

loans.name: Nerissa

texts.en:
Nerissa, aged 34, is a married woman with two children, one of whom is currently in school. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur who has had a barber shop business in the Philippines for the past five years. 

Nerissa has requested a PHP 21,000 loan through NWTF to purchase equipment and tools for her business.

She would like to build and expand her business to secure her family's future.

loans.use: to purchase equipment and tools for her business

loans.name: Carmen

texts.es:
Carmen tiene 48 años de edad, estudió hasta 6°grado de educación básica, ella es madre soltera de 3 hijos, uno de ellos es militar trabaja en el cuartel, y los otros 2 trabajan en la agricultura.
 
 
Ella se dedica al trabajo de la agricultura, tiene 8 años de realizar esta actividad, ya que este se lo enseñaron sus padres cuando estaba pequeña, en este trabajo también le ayudan sus 2 hijos que viven con ella en la casa, además de esto ella se dedica al cuido de animales domésticos, cerdos y aves de corral, y vende lociones de una empresa de cosméticos,

Ella utilizara el préstamo para comprar los insumos agrícolas para poder darle un buen manejo a la milpa, comprará 4 sacos de fertilizante, una bolsa de semilla de maíz certificada y pagará la mano de obra. 

Sus sueños son tener mayor rendimiento de cosecha para asegurar la alimentación de su familia, y además le gustaría seguir criando cerdos y aves.
texts.en:
Carmen is 48 years old. She studied until 6th grade in primary school and is single mother of three children. One of them is a soldier and works in the barracks, and the other two work in farming.

Carmen works in farming, she has been doing this for 8 years and this is the activity her parents taught her when she was a child. Also, her two children who live with her help with this work. In addition, she raises small animals, pigs and poultry, and sells creams of a cosmetics company.

She will use the loan to buy the agricultural supplies she needs to maintain her cornfield in a good condition. She will buy four sacks of fertilizer, one bag of certified corn seeds, and will pay for hired labor.

She dreams of having a better harvest to be able provide enough food for her family, and also she would like to continue raising pigs and poultry.

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies to maintain her cornfield: to buy 4 sacks of fertilizer and a bag of certified corn seeds, and to pay for hired labor.

loans.name: Rosaura Isabel

texts.es:
Rosaura tiene 38 años de edad, estudió hasta sexto grado de educación básica, por motivos de escasos recursos económicos ella ya no pudo continuar con sus estudios, está acompañada y su pareja trabaja en la agricultura, ellos tiene 2 hijos que estudian, y son los que dependen de Rosaura.

Ella tiene 15 años de experiencia en el cuido de animales domésticos como cerdos y gallinas, sus padres desde muy pequeña le enseñaron este trabajo y lo realiza en su casa por lo cual no debe trasladarse a otro lugar.

El crédito lo necesita para comprar 4 cerdos pequeños, 12 quintales de harinilla y vitaminas para los mismos, espera criar animales gordos y sanos para luego venderlos.

Ella planea seguir trabajando para que a sus hijos no les falte nada y sean profesionales.
texts.en:
Rosaura is 38 years old. She went to school until 6h grade of primary school, then she could not continue her education because of scarce economic resources. She has a partner who works in agriculture and they have 2 children who are at school and depend on Rosaura.

She has 15 years of experience raising small animals like pigs and hens. When she was very small, her parents showed her this work and she performs it at home, therefore she does not have to travel to another place.

She needs the loan to buy four small pigs, and 12 quintals of whole-grain corn flour and vitamins for them. She hopes to raise fat and healthy animals and then to sell them. She plans to continue working, so that her children lack nothing and can take up a professional career.

loans.use: to buy 4 piglets, and 12 quintals of corn flour and vitamins for them - she hopes to raise fat and healthy pigs and then to sell them.

loans.name: Roberto

texts.es:
Roberto es un hombre emprendedor, tiene 36 años de edad, vive en el Distrito de Guadalupe junto a su esposa y sus dos hijos.
Desde hace 8 años se dedica a la comercialización de leña y carbón y al Servicio de transporte ya que tiene su mototaxi con el que traslada a los clientes a diversos lugares de la Ciudad.
Roberto está muy agradecido con los prestamistas Kiva porque con el apoyo que le han brindado él podrá colocar un techo nuevo a su vivienda para mayor seguridad de su familia y así puedan sentirse más cómodos y mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Roberto is an enterprising man. He is 36 years old and lives in the District of Guadalupe with his wife and his two children. 

For eight years, he has worked selling wood and coal and providing transportation services. He has his own motorcycle taxi which he uses to drive passenger to various places in the city.

Roberto is very grateful to Kiva lenders. Thanks to their help, he can put a new roof to his home, to have better security for his family and by this they can all be more comfortable and have a better quality of life.

loans.use: to renovate his home (repair the roof of his house).

loans.name: Ana Maritza

texts.es:
Ana tiene 31 años de edad, solo estudió hasta séptimo grado, comenta que sus padres no pudieron financiarle económicamente para que siguiera estudiando, ella está acompañada y su pareja se dedica a trabajar en la agricultura (siembra de hortalizas) donde obtiene alimento para toda su familia,  tiene 2 hijos de las edades de 8 y 10 años y que actualmente se encuentran estudiando en la escuela y son los únicos que dependen de Ana y su pareja.

Ana tiene un pequeño negocio de una tienda en su casa, tiene aproximadamente 2 años de dedicarse a este trabajo, pues ella ha visto que es una actividad que le genera buenos ingresos económicos  para su familia y que es tan productiva para ella, pues al principio ella empezó a vender  pocas cosas pero con las ganancias de las ventas logró comprar más productos y de esta manera tener más variedad en su tienda para sus clientes, gracias a esto y con el  transcurso de los años las ventas a  aumentado su productividad, su esposo también la apoya en la tienda a vender y ofrecerles un mejor servicio a sus clientes. 

El crédito solicitado lo necesita para invertirlo en el negocio, pues ella ve que necesita muchos productos que en su tienda  no tiene por el momento, pero que con la ayuda del préstamo comprara más y surtirá su tienda y de esta manera ofrecer un mejor servicio a sus clientes.

Sus sueños para un futuro son en primer lugar desea estar en paz con Dios, en segundo desea para su futuro y  su familia tener una mejor casa para vivir cómodamente con su pareja y sus hijos, ampliar más la tienda y tener más productos para la venta.
texts.en:
Ana is 31 years old. She only studied up to Grade 7. She says that her parents could not come up with the money for her to continue her education. She has a partner and they both work in farming (growing vegetables). By this, they can earn the keep for their family. She has two children, who are 8 and 10 years old and go to school. They are the only ones who are dependent on Ana and her partner.

Ana has a small store which is located in her home. She has been doing this for about two years and she has seen that it provides good income for her family and that it is very productive for her. At first, she began with just a few items to sell, but with the earnings she could buy more products and by this have a wider variety of products to offer to her customers. Thanks to this and with the course of time, the sales increased. Her husband also helps her with the store, so that she can sell more and to offer a better service to her clients.

She needs the credit she asks for to invest it in her business, because she realizes that she needs many products in her store which she does not carry at the moment. But with the help of the loan she can buy more and stock her store. By this, she will offer a better service to her clients. 

Her dream for the future is, primarily, to be at peace with God, and then she wants to have a better house for her future and her family. She wants to live comfortably with her partner and her children, and to further grow her store and to have more products to sell.

loans.use: to invest it in her business, because she needs many products for her store which she does not carry at the moment.

loans.name: Abel

texts.es:
Abel es un hombre trabajador, tiene 27 años de edad y vive en La Libertad junto a su esposa y su hija.
Desde hace más de 10 años se dedica a la Agricultura, alquilando un terreno y dedicándose principalmente al cultivo de arroz y maíz que es muy famosa en la zona donde vive. Tiene muchos conocimientos sobre este producto es por ello que comercializa productos de calidad y a un buen precio en el mercado.
Abel está agradecido con los prestamistas Kiva porque con el apoyo que le han brindado él podrá comprar materiales para realizar un mantenimiento de los terrenos durante toda la etapa de siembra hasta la etapa de la cosecha, para que de esta manera pueda ofrecer productos de calidad y genere más ingresos que más adelante podrá utilizarlo para incursionar en la siembra de otros productos.
texts.en:
Abel is a hard-working man, he is 27 years old and lives in La Libertad with his wife and his daughter.

For 10 years, he has worked in agriculture. He has rented a piece of land and mainly plants rice and corn, for which the area where he lives is renowned. He has a lot of knowledge about these products, and therefore he sells them in a high quality and gets a good price in the market.

Abel is very grateful to Kiva lenders. Thanks to their help, he will be able to buy materials he needs for maintaining his land from the sowing to the harvest, and by this to offer high-quality products and generate more income, which he can then invest in the planting of other crops.

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies for maintaining his crops (fertilizers).

loans.name: Alfredo Antonio

texts.es:
Alfredo tiene 34 años de edad, está acompañado, tiene tres hijos de los cuales solo dos estudian y el tercero aún no porque está muy pequeño.

Alfredo se ha dedicado a la agricultura ya que de ello saca lo necesario para satisfacer las necesidades de su familia, él siembra granos básicos como maíz, sorgo, frijol, y ajonjolí. pues desde una edad muy temprana trabaja en la agricultura.

Alfredo necesita el crédito para la siembra de granos básicos, ya que cultivará 4,375 metros cuadrados de maíz y  requiere de un pequeño préstamo para poder darle un buen mantenimiento a su cultivo y así poder sacar la cosecha adelante y obtener sus ingresos para satisfacer las necesidades de el y de su familia.

Para un futuro Alfredo planea darle una buena educación a sus tres hijos para que sean personas de bien en la sociedad y puedan contribuir con lo aprendido  dando un servicio o ayudando a las personas que los necesitan.
texts.en:
Alfredo is 34 years old. He has a partner and three children, of whom only two are at school because the third one is still too small.

Alfredo works in farming, because from this he can get everything his family needs. He plants basic grains like corn, sorghum, beans, and sesame. He has worked in farming since he was very small.

Alfredo needs a loan for the sowing of basic grains, because he wants to plant 4,375 square metres of corn. He also needs a small loan to be able to properly maintain his crop, and by this to get a good harvest and to have the income to fulfill the needs of himself and his family.

For the future, Alfredo wants to provide his three children with a good education, so that they will be good people in society and can use what they learnt and provide services or help people in need.

loans.use: to plant basic grains, because he wants to plant 4,275 square metres of corn.

loans.name: Godula

texts.en:
Godula is married and has six children. She is 67 years old and lives in Maikay,Tudela, Philippines.

Godula is a farmer and grows fruit and vegetable crops to earn a living. She has been doing this for nine years. 

She has requested a loan to buy sacks of fertilizers.

Godula has been a member of PMPC for six years. In the future, Godula hopes to start another business.

loans.use: to buy sacks of fertilizers.

loans.name: Nelia

texts.en:
Nelia has run her sari-sari (general) store business in their village for eight years. She is selling a variety of grocery items such as canned goods, eggs, noodles, and biscuits. To gain extra income, Nelia also sells brooms and fuel. Nelia is managing the business well to assure that she has a gainful source of income.

She has five children and one of them still taking college level education.

Nelia is requesting a loan of PHP 20,000 to buy grocery items and beverages to sell. She hopes to continuously operate the business until her child finishes the college level of education.

loans.use: to buy grocery items and beverages to sell.

loans.name: Sabina

texts.en:
Being a responsible house wife, Sabina engages in making and selling soft brooms to help her husband in generating income. She is 43 years old and is blessed with three children. Despite financial hardship, Sabina and her husband want to continue sending their children to school so that they will become professionals in the future. With this goal, Sabina aims to make more soft brooms to sell in order to earn a higher income.

Having inadequate capital, Sabina wants to ask for a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy soft brooms, plastic, and rattan needed in making soft brooms. Through hard work and strong determination, she believes that she will generate a higher income.

loans.use: to buy soft brooms, plastic, and rattan needed in making soft brooms

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more fish.

loans.name: Veronica Del Pilar

texts.es:
Verónica es una joven con muchas ganas de salir adelante, tiene 35 años de edad, y vive en Lambayeque junto a su  esposo y su hijo.
Desde hace más de un año tiene su bodega en su domicilio ofreciendo diversos productos de primera necesidad. Le va muy bien porque es una mujer emprendedora, amable, responsable y dedicada a su labor.
Verónica está agradecida con los prestamistas Kiva porque con el apoyo que le han brindado ella podrá comprar más mercadería para poder suministrar su negocio y así pueda tener mayores ingresos que irá ahorrando para más adelante poder comprarse un terreno y construir su propia casa.
texts.en:
Verónica, 35, is a young woman who very much wants to get ahead.  She lives in Lambayeque with her husband and son.

She has sold a variety of staple products in a store in her home for more than a year.  It's going very well for her because she's an enterprising, friendly, and responsible woman who is dedicated to her job.

Verónica's grateful to Kiva lenders because with their help she'll be able to buy more merchandise to supply her business.  That way she'll keep on saving money so, in the future, she can buy herself a plot of land and build her own house.

loans.use: to buy merchandise

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en:
Ruth earns a living in Bonifacio, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. For over twenty years, Ruth has been able to help her husband manage his farm that absolutely met the needs of their family. Until now, the farm is still doing well and is providing enough cash inflow to cover the family's day-to-day expenditures. With this generated revenue, Ruth has been able to raise pigs to add her income.

Recently, Ruth took a new loan to purchase feeding supplies. She expects an increase in income and plans to expand their farm and improve the general living conditions of their family.

loans.use: to purchase feeding supplies.

loans.name: Sofia

texts.en:
Sofia is a hardworking woman. Sofia is 18 years old and lives in the town of Gaba in the Kampala south region of Uganda. She is single and has no children. For the past three years, Sofia has been working hard to manage her poultry business, which rears chickens. 

To help expand her business, Sofia has requested a loan of 600,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy poultry feed and more chicks, and it will help Sofia to generate greater profits and pay school fees. Sofia hopes that in the future she will be able to own a big poultry farm. 

Sofia is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: to buy poultry feeds and more chicks.

loans.name: Jawuhara

texts.en:
Jawuhara is a hardworking woman. Jawuhara is 17 years old and lives in the town of Gaba in the Kampala south region of Uganda. She is single and has no children. For the past two years, Jawuhara has been working hard to manage her grocery shop, which sells vegetables and crafts. 

To help expand her business, Jawuhara has requested a loan of 600,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy vegetables and craft materials, and will help Jawuhara to generate greater profits and pay school fees. Jawuhara hopes that in the future, she will be able to join a fashion design course. 

Jawuhara is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: to buy vegetables and craft materials

loans.name: Sharofat

texts.ru:
Эту женщину-скотовод зовут Шарофат. Она уроженка района Вахш. Ей 47 лет. Шарофат выбрала своей профессией животноводство. Она на протяжении более 6 лет занимается откормом и продажей крупнорогатого скота. Она научилась этому бизнесу у своих соседей. В селах и горных районах этот вид деятельности и ратсениеводство является основным источником дохода жителей, поскольку другие отрасли тут не развиты.
Шарофат замужем, имеет четверых сыновей и дочь. Ее муж является мастером по ремонту грузовых машин. Он также помогает жене в ее бизнесе. Шарофат откармливает скотов в течение 30-35 дней и затем выводит их на местный рынок на продажу. Шарофат просит кредит для купли пару бычков. Она хочет расширить деятельность и увеличить ее доходность.
texts.en:
This cattle farmer is called Sharofat. She is 47 and a native of the Vakhsh district. She chose raising livestock as her profession, which she learned from her neighbors. She has over six years of experience fattening and selling cattle. Livestock and crops provide the main source of income for residents of the villages and mountain areas because other industries are not developed there. 

Sharofat is married and has four sons and one daughter. Her husband repairs trucks and helps her with the business. She fattens cattle for 30-35 days and then sells them at the local market. She applied for a loan to buy a pair of bulls. She wants to expand her business and increase her profits.

loans.use: to buy a pair of bulls

loans.name: Shamim

texts.en:
Shamim is a hard working woman. She is 20 years old and lives in the town of Gaba in the Kampala south region of Uganda. She is single and has no children. For the past three years, Shamim has been working hard to manage her restaurant, which sells cooked food and soft drinks. 

To help expand her business, Shamim has requested a loan of 500,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. She will use the loan to buy food items for her restaurant and this will help her generate greater profits and pay school fees. Shamim hopes that in the future she will be able to own a big hotel in the area. 

Shamim is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: to buy food items for her restaurant

loans.name: Rehema

texts.en:
Rehema is a hardworking woman. She is 17 years old and lives in the town of Ggaba in the Kampala south region of Uganda. She is single and has one child who is currently in school. 

For the past two years, Rehema has been working hard to manage her retail shop, which sells salt, sugar, bread, biscuits. 

To help expand her business, Rehema has requested a loan of 600,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy salt, sugar, bread, biscuits, and will help Rehema to generate greater profits and educate her child. Rehema hopes that in the future she will be able to acquire high profits. 

Rehema is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: to buy salt, sugar, bread, biscuits.

loans.name: Rocio Elizabeth

texts.es: Rocio tiene 22 años de edad y habita junto a sus padres. Rocio se gana la vida por medio de la elaboración y venta de tamales de gallina desde hace tres años. Rocio desea terminar de construir un muro perimetral y un baño dado que por falta de recursos económicos no ha logrado terminar. Por lo anterior solicita este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la compra de ladrillo, cemento, arena, lámina y pago de mano de obra para la construcción.
texts.en:
Rocio is 22 years old and lives together with her parents. Rocio has been making a living by making and selling chicken tamales for three years.

Rocio wishes to finish building a perimeter wall and a bathroom as a lack of financial resources has prevented her from finishing. For the above reason, she asks for this loan from FUSAI to invest in the purchase of brick, cement, sand, sheet metal, and to pay for labour for construction.

loans.use: to buy: brick, cement, sand, sheet metal, and to pay for labour for the construction of a bathroom and to finish building the perimeter wall.

loans.name: Walter Omar

texts.es:
El joven Walter es una persona muy trabajadora y responsable vive en  una comunidad al sur de Honduras junto a sus  padres. Su negocio es la   compra  y venta  de ganado desde hace 3 años, los cuales vende desde su casa de habitación.
Walter Necesita el préstamo para la compra de vacas; El espera que el préstamo le ayude mucho ya que no cuenta con el capital necesarios para seguir  trabajando es su negocio, además un aumento en las ventas, y con esto ganar más ingresos que beneficien el estilo de vida de la familia en el hogar.
El espera aumentar su negocio y seguir apoyando a sus hermanos en sus estudios para que tengan mayores oportunidades en la vida.

Choluteca, Honduras – Mayo del  2014
texts.en:
Walter is a very hard-working and responsible young man. He lives with his parents in a community in the south of Honduras. For 3 years he has had a business buying and selling cattle, which he sells from his home.

Walter needs the loan to buy cows. He hopes the loan will help him a lot as he does not have the necessary capital to continue working in his business. He also hopes to increase his sales and thus make more income which will benefit the family's home lifestyle.

He hopes to increase his business and keep supporting his siblings in their education so that they have better opportunities in life.

Choluteca, Honduras – May 2014

loans.use: to buy cows for his business.

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en:
Gloria is married and has three children. She is 57 years old and lives in San Vicente, Sinacaban, Philippines.

Gloria is a farmer who raises pigs to earn a living. She has been doing this for three years. She has requested a loan to buy sack of feeds.

Gloria has been a member of PMPC for five years. In the future, Gloria hopes to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: to buy sacks of feeds.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay the tuition fee for her daughter

loans.name: Justo Pastor

texts.es:
Don Justo una persona emprendedora  honesto  y serio, vive con su esposa y sus 2 hijos y 3 nietos  en el  sur de Honduras. Su negocio es la  compra y venta  de  ganado.
Don Justo el préstamo lo necesita para la compra de vacas.  Con el préstamo el espera que las ventas en su negocio aumenten al tener más animales que ofrecer a los clientes y cubrir las necesidades de los mismos, y con esto mejorar la situación  económica  de su  familia.
Don Justo  espera que  en unos 3 años  su negocio siga  creciendo y  consolidándose  para que se convierta en la más grande y  reconocido de la zona, y seguir  apoyando a su familia, y que sus nietos terminen sus estudios y se conviertan en personas honesta  y con principios y valores.

Choluteca, Honduras –  Mayo   del   2014
texts.en:
Justo is an enterprising, honest, and serious person.  He lives with his wife, his two children, and three grandchildren in the south of Honduras.  His business is buying and selling cattle.

Justo needs the loan to buy two cows.  He expects his sales to increase with the loan because he'll have more animals to sell to his customers.  He also hopes to cover the needs of his customers so he can improve his family's economic situation.

Justo hopes that in about three years his business will keep on growing and getting stronger so it will be the biggest and best known in the area.  He also wants to keep on supporting his family so his grandchildren finish school and become honest people with principles and values.

Choluteca, Honduras–May 2014

loans.use: to buy two cows

loans.name: Nida

texts.en:
Nida is married and has two children. She is 41 years old and lives in Gumbil Tudela, Philippines. Nida sells assorted products to earn a living and has had this business for seven years. Each month, she earns PHP 3,500 doing this type of work. 

Nida has requested a loan of PHP 50,000 to restock her store with basic commodities. She has been a member of PMPC for seven years. In the future, Nida hope to save for future emergencies and to provide for her family's daily needs.

loans.use: to restock her store with basic commodities

loans.name: Leonora

texts.en:
Leonora earns a living by managing a general store, and she has been doing this for more than eight years. She was able to provide for her family and successfully repaid her previous loan, used for her store. 

With her income, she started a swine-fattening business in addition to her store business. Recently, she took a new loan to purchase feeding supplies. She hopes to earn more income and wants to improve her business so that she can have a higher standard of living.

loans.use: to purchase feeding supplies.

loans.name: Vilma

texts.en:
Vilma's main source of income comes from planting and harvesting corn to sell.  She is married and has three children. She is from Lower Usogan, Bonifacio and been farming for more than fifteen years, earning well so that she has been able to buy piglets to raise in addition to farming. 

Vilma successfully repaid her previous loan, which she used for her farm. She took a new loan recently to purchase pig feed.  She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase pig feed

loans.name: Juan Jose

texts.es:
Juan es un hombre emprendedor, tiene 54 años de edad y vive en el Distrito de Guadalupe con sus padres.
Tiene una hija por quien siempre ha luchado para sacarla adelante y brindarle un futuro mejor.
Desde hace más de 8 años se dedica a la comercialización de leña y le va muy bien porque ya conoce el negocio y es una persona muy dedicada a su labor. También tiene una motosierra que con mucho esfuerzo ha comprado y en estos momentos alquila a sus clientes más confiables.
Juan está agradecido con los prestamistas Kiva porque con el apoyo que le han brindado él podrá comprar un instrumento para cortar la leña y de esta forma pueda comercializar en mayor cantidad.
texts.en:
Juan in an enterprising man. He is 54 years old and lives in the District of Guadalupe with his parents. He has a daughter, and he has always fought for her to get ahead and to offer her a better future.

For more than 8 years, he has worked selling wood, and his business goes very well because he knows his trade and heis very dedicated to his work. Also, he has an electric saw. With great effort he was able to buy it and now he rents it out to his most trustworthy clients.

Juan is very grateful to Kiva lenders. Thanks to their help, he will be able to buy an instrument to cut wood and by this he will be able to sell greater amounts of wood.

loans.use: to buy materials to cut wood.

loans.name: Saumu

texts.en:
Saumu is a woman with no children. She lives in her own house that has neither electricity nor piped water.

She has operated a retail shop business for the past 20 years, selling household consumables like wheat flour, maize flour and sugar. 

With the loan she is requesting, she wants to purchase sacks of beans, rice, and green grams for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of beans, rice, and green grams for resale.

loans.name: Maria Isabel

texts.es:
María, tiene una tortillería que atiende de seis de la mañana a doce del mediodía,  ya tiene mucha experiencia desempeñando está actividad, el oficio se lo enseño su mamá; ella es casada, vive con su esposo, el cual es albañil y un hijo, juntos buscan la manera de cubrir las necesidades básica de su hogar.
Comprará maíz, cal, leña y remodelara su puesto de venta, aumentara su productividad y dará una mejor imagen de su negocio, espera seguir contando con la preferencia de sus clientes e incrementar sus ganancias de esta manera tendrá respaldado el pago puntual de su deuda.
Su sueño es tener recursos económicos suficientes para comprar una propiedad en la que construirá su casa.
texts.en:
María has a business making tortillas which she works in from 6am to midday. She already has a lot of experience in doing this work and was taught the skills by her mum. She is married and lives with her husband, who is a bricklayer, and a son. They both look for ways to cover the household's basic needs. 

She plans to buy corn, lime powder and firewood and refurbish her stall. She will increase her productivity and improve her business's image. She hopes to have the continued support of her customers and increase her sales. This will give her the basis for paying off her loan punctually.

Her dream is to have enough money to buy a piece of land where she will build her house.

loans.use: to buy corn, lime powder and firewood and refurbish her stall.

loans.name: Griselda Marisol

texts.es:
Griselda de 37 años de edad,  no tuvo la oportunidad de estudiar, ya que los padres no contaban con las condiciones para enviarla a la escuela,  está acompañada el esposo se dedica a la albañilería, han procreado 2 hijas las cuales una de ellas ya está acompañada y la otra que vive con ella, además vive con la mamá,  la hermana y una sobrina.

Griselda se dedica a los oficios domésticos, pero además de eso trabaja la agricultura desde ya hace 8 años este trabajo el padre se lo enseño y ella lo aprendió hoy que el padre ya falleció, ella se hace cargo de cuidar a la mamá y a la hermana trabajando en la agricultura y llevando el sostén de la casa, este trabajo le queda a una distancia de 5 minutos y viaja a pie, le queda muy cerca el trabajo y lo hace en un horario de las 6:00 am a las 12:00 del medio día

El préstamo que está solicitando es para comprar 9 sacos de abono, 4 1/2 de sulfato,  4 ½  formula ya que la milpa ya está creciendo muy bien y necesita el abono para que el cultivo crezca de mejor manera y les de muy buenas cosechas, ya que es la única fuente de ingreso que tienen a la casa; porque el trabajo que ejerce el esposo es poco y lo ocupan en otros gastos, esto le ayudara mucho porque con los créditos pueden comprar todo de una sola vez y así prepara muy bien los cultivos.

Griselda lo que ella espera es que siempre este alentada,  para seguir cultivando la tierra y poder ayudarle a su madre y a la hermana que salgan adelante,  preparar académicamente a su hija y sobrina.
texts.en:
Griselda is 37 years old. She didn't have the opportunity to go to school, since her parents didn't have the resources to send her. She is married and her husband works in bricklaying. They have 2 daughters. One of them is married and the other lives with them. She also lives with her mother, sister, and a niece. 

Griselda takes care of the household and she also works as a farmer. She has done this since she was 8 years old. Her father taught her and she learned. Now that her father is passed, she takes care of her mother and her sister by working in farming and supporting the home. The work is about 5 minutes away on foot and so she is very close and her schedule is from 6:00 a.m. until 12:00 noon.

The loan she is asking for now is to buy 9 sacks of fertilizer, 4 1/2 of sulphate, and 4 ½  of formula. The corn is growing very well and she needs the fertilizer so the crop will grow better and bring very good harvests. It is the only source of income for the house because her husbands works is scarce and they use his income for other expenses. This will really help them because with the loans they can buy everything they need at once and prepare the crops very well.  

What Griselda hopes is that she is always encouraged to keep working the land and helping her mother and sister get ahead and to give her daughter and her niece an education.

loans.use: to buy 9 sacks of fertilizer, 4 1/2 of sulphate,  and 4 ½ of formula. The corn is growing very well and she needs the fertilizer so the crop will grow better.

loans.name: Shadia

texts.en:
Shadia is a hard-working women. Shadia is 17 years old and lives in the town of Gaba in the Kampala south region of Uganda. She is single and has no children. For the past three years, Shadia has been working hard to manage her shoe business, which sells shoes. 

To help expand her business, Shadia has requested a loan of 600,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more shoes, and will help Shadia to generate greater profits and buy a plot of land. Shadia hopes that in the future she will be able to go back to school. 

Shadia is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities, and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: to buy more shoes

loans.name: Topista

texts.en:
Topista is a hard-working woman. She is 22 years old and lives in the town of Gaba in the Kampala south region of Uganda. She is single and has one child. For the past three years, Topista has been working hard to manage her business selling charcoal. 

To help expand her business, Topista has requested a loan of 500,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more charcoal and will help Topista to generate greater profits and provide for her family. Topista hopes that in the future she will be able to buy land. 

Topista is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: to buy more charcoal

loans.name: Nargiz

texts.en:
Nargiz is a young and hardworking woman. She is the careful mother of two little children, Sabrina and Noziya, who are 4 and 2 years old. Nargiz is divorced. She is the only feed keeper of her children. 

She has worked in Russia for the last eight months. She was a seller in a flower shop where she learned all the details of making bouquets. Now, she is in Tajikistan and she wants to organize her own business. She is going to open a flower shop. 

Nargiz took part in a women's organization course called, "To Get Ahead," and she got a certificate. She is asking for a loan of 7,000 TJS to buy flowers and other facilities for organizing a new business. She awaits your mercy.

loans.use: To buy flowers and other facilities for organizing a new business.

loans.name: Florence

texts.en:
Florence is 22 years old and single with two children who are currently in school. She lives in the town of Gaba in the Kampala South region of Uganda. Florence is a hardworking woman who has managed her hair salon for the past three years. 

Florence is requesting a 500,000 UGX loan from BRAC Uganda to buy weaves and chemicals and to expand her business. Her loan will help her to generate greater profits and be able to educate her children. Florence hopes that in the future she will be able to expand her salon. 

Florence is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: buy hair weaves and chemicals

loans.name: Sharofat

texts.en:
Sharofat is a woman who always wanted to get a higher education. She is married and has two children. Sharofat has been busy selling children's shoes and children's clothes for more than six years. She sells her merchandise in a local market. Her daughter helps with managing the business. Her husband works in a state organization, so her business is the main source of family income.

Now, her son is studying at the university. Sharofat must pay for her son’s education, but she does not have enough money. Sharofat is asking for a loan of 4,000 Somoni to pay for her son’s education. She awaits your mercy.

loans.use: To pay for her son’s education

loans.name: Patricia

texts.en:
Patricia is a hardworking woman. Patricia is 16 years old and lives in the town of Kitintale in the Kampala south region of Uganda. She is single and has no children. For the past two years, Patricia has been working hard to manage her market vending business, which sells charcoal stoves and sugarcane. 

To help expand her business, Patricia has requested a loan of 800,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase more charcoal stoves and sugarcane, and will help Patricia to generate greater profits and improve her family's standards of living. Patricia hopes that in the future, she will be able to gain bigger profits. 

Patricia is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities, and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: to purchase more charcoal stoves and sugarcane

loans.name: Gladys

texts.es:
La señora  GLADYS de 59 años   de edad es soltera, tiene 3  hijos que dependen de ella radica en la comunidad del TULAR, Nacaome, valle al sur de Honduras, tiene casa propia  y se dedica desde hace 10  años  a la venta de ropa usada y abarrotería, sus clientes son los amigos y personas que a diario visitan su negocio, doña Gladys es una mujer trabajadora con deseos de salir adelante, es un ejemplo en la comunidad de trabajo y dedicación a la familia.
Ella está solicitando el préstamo para la  compra de granos básicos Frijoles, arroz, maíz,  lácteos, leche, pan, café, y otros productos de consumo básico, con el apoyo de este préstamo ella pretende mejorar su negocio y atender mejor a sus clientes, está muy contenta de seguir trabajando con PRISMA y KIVA, es su cuarto préstamo que solicita.
Su sueño es mejorar su negocio y su casa.
San Lorenzo, Honduras - Mayo del 2014.
texts.en:
Gladys, 59, is single and has three children who depend on her.  She lives in her own house in the community of Tular, Nacaome, Valle, in the south of Honduras.

She has sold used clothing and groceries for ten years.  Her customers are her friends and people who visit her business on a daily basis.  Gladys is a hardworking woman who wants to get ahead.  She's an example in her community of work and family devotion.  

Gladys is requesting the loan to buy staple products: beans, rice, corn, dairy products, milk, bread, coffee, and other basic food items.  With the support of this loan she plans to improve her business and better serve her customers.  This is the fourth loan she has requested and she's very happy to keep on working with Prisma and Kiva.

Her dream is to improve her business and her house.

San Lorenzo, Honduras, May 2014

loans.use: to buy staple products

loans.name: Marcelina

texts.en:
Marcelina is 58 years old and married with four children. She works making food such as embutido and longanisa to sell. Marcelina’s husband is a farmer who grows rice in their field and raises hogs. Through their respective businesses, she and her husband are able to support their children and are proud to say that they all have finished college.

Marcelina is requesting a 15,000 PHP loan to buy foil, raw ingredients, and meat for her food preparation business. She hopes for the continued growth of her business and wishes to maintain her good health and witness her grandchildren growing up.

loans.use: to buy foil, raw ingredients and meat to prepare food

loans.name: Benita

texts.en: Having inadequate capital, Benita wants to access a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy more tiger grass, plastics and rattan needed in making soft brooms for sale. She is 49 years old and blessed with twelve children. Due to the high cost of commodities and school food, she wants to make more soft brooms to sell in order to earn a higher income. Being a patient and industrious mother, she is hoping that she will make her business more profitable through this financial assistance.

loans.use: to buy more tiger grass, plastics and rattan needed in making soft brooms

loans.name: Rosenda

texts.en:
Rosenda is divorced and has two children. Rosenda is 32 years old and lives in Colambutan Settlement, Tudela, Philippines.

Rosenda sells bananas to earn a living and has had this business for six years. She has requested a loan to provide additional capital to purchase inventories of fruits for retail.

Rosenda has been a member of PMPC for six years. In the future, Rosenda hopes to provide her family's daily needs.

loans.use: to purchase inventories of fruits for retail.

loans.name: Riza

texts.en:
Riza has helped her husband in managing their own farm for seven years, earning well for the family.  She used her generated income for their daily needs and also saved money from this to use for renovating their house.  

Recently, she joined GDMPC and took a new loan to purchase fertilizers. Riza is hoping to yield higher returns from her farm, and wants to sustain and improve it for a stable source of income in the coming years.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers

loans.name: Silveria

texts.en:
