Silveria works hard to support her family. She is married and has a fruit vending business in the Philippines. Silveria has been in this business for 30 years now.

Silveria requested a PHP 14,000 loan through NWTF to buy more fruit to sell to her customers. She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more fruit to sell to her customers

loans.name: Lea Nenet

texts.en:
As a married mother of three children, Lea Nenet works hard to support her family.

She has a general store business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from pig fattening and purified water. Lea Nenet is borrowing 29,500 PHP (Philippines pesos) through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell for her general store business.

Lea Nenet has been sustaining her business activities through her past eight loans from NWTF, and more recently, through Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en:
Victoria is a married woman with five children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Victoria is 60 years old and has one child who is still in school.

Victoria has a curtains selling business in the Philippines. Victoria requested a 13,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) loan amount through NWTF to purchase more curtains to sell to her customers.

Victoria has been in this business for five years. Victoria would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more curtains to sell to her customers

loans.name: Rachel

texts.en:
Rachel is married, and she works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 25,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) loan through NWTF in order to buy more groceries to sell.

Rachel has been in this business for 20 years and has previously received funds through Kiva.

Rachel aspires to save money to expand her business and continue to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Mwanajuma

texts.en:
Mwanajuma is a very hardworking and enterprising woman who says that she has been able to greatly increase her income and help her family, thanks to her hard work.

She is asking for a loan to purchase more sacks of cashew nuts and pay for transportation costs. She is grateful for the financial support she has received.

loans.use: to purchase more sacks of cashew nuts and pay for transportation costs.

loans.name: Alicia Del Carmen

texts.es:
Alicia, vive con su esposo, sus hijos ya son independientes; por la necesidad de aportar ayuda económica para cancelar los diferentes gastos de su hogar hace 35 años que inicio su propio negocio, el cual consiste en la elaboración y venta de flores artificiales, así como también flores naturales dependiendo la temporada, trabaja todos los días en el mercado municipal.
Con el crédito abastecerá su inventario con los materiales básicos para elaborar los diferentes tipos de flores que vende, comprara espelma, alambre, colorantes, papel y plástico, se limitara a comprar lo necesario para trabajar y poder cancelar lo más pronto posible su deuda adquirida.
Su aspiración es tener un buen record crediticio para continuar progresando por medio de préstamos y tener un mejor estilo de vida junto a su esposo.
texts.en:
Alicia lives with her husband. Their children are already on their own. Out of the need to contribute financially to pay for different household expenses, 35 years ago she started her own business. It is making and selling artificial flowers as well as natural flowers, depending on the season. She works every day in the town market. 

With the loan, she will stock up on her inventory of the basic materials she needs to make the different flowers that she sells. She will buy wax, wire, coloring, paper and plastic. She will limit it to buying what she needs to work and be able to pay her acquired debt off as soon as possible. 

Her goal is to have a good credit history to continue progressing through the loans and have a better style of life with her husband.

loans.use: to buy wax, wire, coloring, paper and plastic.

loans.name: Kiutza Karina

texts.es:
El sonido de los utensilios de cocina rechinando sobre la plancha de la estufa, señalan que la comida que comercializa Kiutza ya está por salir. Esta joven de tan solo 25 años, no dejo pasar la oportunidad de empezar su propio negocio desde hace 3 años, no muy lejos de conseguir su título como universitaria. Sus metas siempre ha estado fijadas por superarse primero y hasta después formar su propia familia, es por esto que solo cuenta con el apoyo de sus padres, quienes siempre la ha impulsado a cumplir sus sueños.
Anteriormente Kiutza había sido bendecida con un préstamo del cual se expresa con gran agradecimiento, pues logró comprar granos básicos para ofrecer un mejor servicio, el cual la ayudó a cumplir con las metas que tenía propuesta desde que inició. Ahora, necesita de un nuevo préstamo para comprar salsas, arroz, frijoles y carnes para mejorar su calidad de sus alimentos que comercializa y ofrecer más cantidad. Esto le permitirá mejorar sus condiciones de vida, pues sus clientes aumentaran y por supuesto sus ingresos. Kiutza no se cree por el momento independiente, pero continuará trabajando fuerte junto con MiCrédito-KIVA para seguir cumpliendo sus metas.
texts.en: The sound of kitchen utensils clanking on the griddle signals that the food Kiutza sells is ready to go. This young woman is only 25 years old and didn't miss the opportunity to start her own business three years ago, not far from getting her university degree. Her goals have always been fixed to move ahead and afterwards start her own family. It is because of this that she only depends on the support of her parents who have always pushed her to achieve her dreams. Previously, Kiutza had been blessed with a loan for which she expresses great appreciation. She managed to purchase basic grains to offer better service, and it helped her fulfill her goals that she had since she started. Now, she needs a new loan to buy sauces, rice, beans, and meat to improve the quality of her food that she sells and offer greater quantities. This will allow her to improve her living conditions, her clientele will grow, and of course, her income. Kuitza doesn't believe herself independent right now, but she will continue working hard together with MiCredito-Kiva to be able to achieve her goals.

loans.use: to buy sauces, rice, beans, and meats.

loans.name: Luis Magin

texts.es:
Luis, vive solo con su hermana; para subsistir desempeña las actividades de crianza de ganado y cultivo de granos básicos (frijol, maíz y macillo),  trabaja de seis de la mañana a seis de la tarde lo hace con ayuda de mozos.
El crédito lo invertirá en la compra de ganado y concentrado para alimentarlos, fortalecerá el negocio así también aprovechara el pasto de la época de invierno. Espera aumentar la producción de lácteos para alimentar a su familia y comercializar.
Su sueño es tener una estabilidad en sus ingresos que serán de utilidad para cubrir los pagos de su deuda y tener un estilo de vida más digno.
texts.en:
Luis lives on his own with his sister. In order to survive he raises cattle and grows basic grains (beans, corn and sorghum). He works from 6 in the morning until 6 at night and has help from farmhands.

He will use the loan to buy cattle and concentrated feed for them. This will strengthen his business and also take advantage of the grazing during the summer season. He hopes to increase his production of dairy products to feed his family and to sell. 

His dream is to have a stable income which will enable him to pay off his loan instalments and have a more decent lifestyle.

loans.use: to buy cattle and concentrated feed for them.

loans.name: Isabel

texts.es:
Isabel, vive junto a su familia integrada por su esposa y seis hijos, entre los cuales algunos están estudiando y otros le ayudab en su trabajo; se dedica a la crianza de ganado y cultivo de granos básicos,  trabajar en el campo es una actividad que disfruta al realizarla, lo hace desde hace mucho tiempo, con ello genera alimento para su familia e ingresos que utiliza para cubrir otras necesidades del hogar.
Invertirá en la compra de semilla, abono, plaguicidas, herbicidas e insecticidas, solo adquirirá los materiales básicos para la preparación del terreno y proteger el cultivo, espera tener una cosecha abundante y mejores ganancias.
Su anhelo es aumentar el ganado y poco a poco aumentar el área de siembra, todo con el fin de tener una situación económica más favorable.
texts.en:
Isabel lives with his family, made up of his wife and six children. Some of them are in school and others help him work. He raised cattle and grows basic grains. Working in the fields is an activity he enjoys when he is doing it. He has done it for a very long time. With it, he generates food and income for his family to pay for the rest of the household needs.  

He will invest in buying seeds, fertilizer, pesticide, herbicide and insecticide. He will only acquire basic materials to prepare the land and protect the crop. He hopes to have an abundant harvest and better income. His wish is to increase the amount of cattle little by little and also the area of cultivation in order to have a more favorable financial situation.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizer, pesticide, herbicide and insecticide.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more of livestock to raise and resell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for medical exams and medicine.

loans.name: Brenda

texts.en:
Brenda is a hard-working woman. Brenda is 15 years old and lives in the town of Gaba in the Kampala south region of Uganda. She is single and has no children. For the past 2 years, Brenda has been working hard to manage her little business which sells sugar cane. 

To help expand her business, Brenda has requested a loan of 600,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy sugar cane, and will help Brenda to generate greater profits and pay school fees. Brenda hopes that in the future she will be able to have high profits. 

Brenda is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities, and a forum for life-skills training.


"

loans.use: to buy sugar cane

loans.name: Gloris Grisela

texts.es:
La señora GLORIS de 36  años de edad, vive con su conyugue y tiene 2 hijos que dependen de ella, radica en la comunidad de san Lorenzo, valle al sur de Honduras, tiene casa propia  y se dedica desde hace 11 años  a la venta de abarrotería como ser: café, huevos, granos básicos, carnes y mas, doña GLORIS es una mujer bien trabajadora es un ejemplo en la comunidad de trabajo y dedicación, con los préstamo ella ha mejorado su casa y también su condición económica, ahora tiene carro, vacas y vende también cuajada.
Está solicitando el préstamo para la  compra de más productos para su negocio como pan, huevos, café, azúcar, manteca, frijoles, arroz, queso, leche, mantequilla, papel higiénico, jabón, detergente y cloro ya que desea surtirlo porque la demanda es bastante fuerte para esta época de invierno.  Con el apoyo del préstamo ella mejorara su negocio y por ende su calidad de vida, ella paga muy bien sus créditos.
Su sueño es comprar vacas lecheras para a si vender más cuajada y más leche logrando tener mejores ingresos.
San Lorenzo, Honduras - mayo del 2014.
texts.en:
Gloris is 36 years old and lives with her husband. She has 2 dependent children. She lives in the community of San Lorenzo, a valley in the south of Honduras. She has her own house and for the last 11 years she has made a living selling groceries such as coffee, eggs, basic grains, meat and other items. Gloris is a very hard-working woman and in the community she is an example of hard work and dedication.

With previous loans she has improved her house and also her financial situation. Now she has a car and cows and also sells curd cheese.

She is asking for the loan to buy more products for her business such as bread, eggs, coffee, sugar, lard, beans, rice, cheese, milk, butter, toilet paper, soap, detergent and bleach. She wants to stock up because the demand is quite high during this winter period. With the help of the loan she will improve her business and so improve her quality of life. She pays her loan instalments consistently.

Her dream is to buy dairy cows so she can sell more curd cheese and milk and so increase her income.

San Lorenzo, Honduras - May 2014.

loans.use: to buy bread, eggs, coffee, sugar, lard, beans, rice, cheese, milk, butter, toilet paper, soap, detergent and bleach.

loans.name: Sokha

texts.en:
At the age of 44 years, Sokha works as a stone breaker for one business that is located not so close to her house. Sokha is able to earn USD $5 a day to support her four children. Her husband, Sombat, also works and makes the same profit as she does. So far, it has been about 10 years for Sokha being a stone breaker.

Due to the workplace being a little bit far from home, Sokha would like to request a loan from Kiva to buy a motorbike to ride to her workplace. In fact, Sokha is an old client of HKL because she has already received two loans from HKL, but this time she would like to get a loan from Kiva since it has a lower interest rate than the usual HKL loan.

loans.use: to buy a motorbike to ride to her workplace

loans.name: Jose Ramiro

texts.es:
El  señor José una persona emprendedora  honesta  y seria, vive con su esposa y sus  hijos   en el  sur de Honduras. Su negocio es la  compra y venta  de  ganado.
Don José el préstamo lo necesita para la compra de vacas.  Con el préstamo el espera que las ventas en su negocio aumenten al tener más animales que ofrecer a los clientes y cubrir las necesidades de los mismos, y con esto mejorar la situación  económica  de su  familia.
Don José espera que  en unos 3 años  su negocio siga  creciendo y  consolidándose  para que se convierta en la más grande y  reconocido de la zona, y seguir  apoyando a su familia, y que sus nietos terminen sus estudios y se conviertan en personas honesta  y con principios y valores.

Choluteca, Honduras –  Mayo   del   2014
texts.en:
Señor José, an honest, serious and enterprising person, lives with his wife and their children in the south of Honduras. His business is the buying and selling of cattle.  

Don José needs this loan for the purchase of cows. With the loan he hopes to increase sales in his business upon having more animals to offer to his customers and to meet their needs, this way improving his family's financial situation. 

Don José hopes that in about 3 years his business continues to grow and strengthen in order that it becomes the biggest and most recognized in the area. This way, he hopes to continue supporting his family, and that his grandchildren will finish their studies and become honest people with principles and values.   

Choluteca, Honduras –  May 2014

loans.use: to purchase cows for his business.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en: Elizabeth is a 60-year-old mother who runs a small retail store within her community. She aims to make her business more profitable in order to earn sufficient income and satisfy the necessities of her family. She plans to increase her product offerings and satisfy her customers' demand but she has insufficient capital. For this reason, she wants to access a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy more stocks of canned goods, noodles, frozen foods, snack foods, beverages and vegetables to sell. She is hoping that she will access her loan request in order to make more improvements in her business.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of canned goods, noodles, frozen foods, snack foods, beverages and vegetables to sell

loans.name: Jennifer

texts.en:
Jennifer lives in Tukuran, Zamboanga Del Sur with her family. She owns and operates a retail business to earn a living. She has been in her business for ten years and earns good income that adds to her husband's income from working as a welder. She successfully repaid her previous loan used for the business. She wants to buy more goods to sell but her savings go to their daily expenses. With this in mind, she borrowed a new loan to purchase additional canned goods and bottled products to sell.

 She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional canned goods and bottled products to sell

loans.name: Ligaya

texts.en:
Ligaya lives in Tukuran, Zamboanga del Sur, Philippines with her family. For the past five years, she has been a farmer. Ligaya’s income goes to provide for her family’s daily needs and for her children's education costs. She successfully repaid a previous loan that she used for farming.

Ligaya is requesting a loan to purchase seeds and fertilizer to improve her farm. She hopes to increase her farm’s production today and in the future to produce more and gain more income.

loans.use: to purchase seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en:
Ruth lives in Sto. Niño, Tukuran, with her family. Ruth has provided for the needs of her three children by selling Tupperware products over the years; this adds to the income earned by her husband. 

Her previous loan used for the business was successfully repaid. She took a new loan recently to buy additional Tupperware items to sell in order to cater to orders from her customers.

Ruth wants to expand her business to help improve her general living situation in the future.

loans.use: to buy additional Tupperware items to sell.

location.town: Sto. Niño, Tukuran, Zamboanga del Sur

loans.name: Delia

texts.en:
Delia is 57 years old and a widow with six children. For the past seven years, she has sold rice in the Philippines. Delia is a very hardworking entrepreneur.

Delia is requesting a 9.000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy more stocks of rice to sell. In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy rice to sell

loans.name: Divina

texts.en:
As a married mother of six children, Divina works hard to support her family. She has an upholstery business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from raising pigs. Divina is borrowing PHP 24,000 through NWTF in order to buy materials and other equipment for her upholstery business.

Divina has been sustaining her business activities through her past eleven loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to buy materials and other equipment for her upholstery.

loans.name: Asha

texts.en:
This is Asha. Her previous loan was a big help in her business.  She has been in this business for years now, and it keeps on growing. 

She is requesting a loan to purchase hair oil, shampoos, braids, and hair chemicals for her business. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

loans.use: to purchase hair oil, shampoos, braids, and hair chemicals for her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase and run two Fresh Life toilets

loans.name: Phiona's Group

texts.en:
Phiona's group is comprised of hardworking women. Phiona is 18 years old and lives in the town of Kitintale in the Kampala south region of Uganda. She is single and has no children who are currently in school. For the past two years, Phiona has been working hard to manage her timber business, which sells wood/timber. 

To help expand her business, Phiona has requested a loan of 300,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy timber, and will help Phiona to generate greater profits and pay her school fees. Phiona hopes that in the future, she will be able to expand the business. 

Phiona is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities, and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: to buy timber

loans.name: Benkadi 4 Group

texts.fr:
Les 7 membres du groupe BENKADI 4 sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 38 ans, ont en moyenne 2 enfants et vivant la plupart dans des familles traditionnelles à N'GOLOKOUNA un village dans le cercle de SIKASSO 3ème région administrative du MALI.
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur cinquième prêt de campagne ( PC ) avec l’institution de microfinance soroyiriwaso, les prêts antérieurs ont été bien remboursés.
La spéculation cultivée est l’arachide avec madame HABY assise au milieu sur la photo dans ce groupe de femme BENKADI 4. 
Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter 1 sac de 50 kg d’engrais, 1 bidon d’herbicide, payer les frais de labour pour entretenir  0,5 hectare. 
Après la récolte la production est vendue au niveau du village, à SIKASSO  à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes au comptant et à crédit.
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 73 000 francs CFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.
texts.en:
The seven members of this group Benkadi 4 are married women with an average age of 38, have on average two children, and mostly live in traditional families in N'Golokouna, a village in the Sikasso circle, third administrative region of Mali.  They collaborate with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso in order to succeed with their agricultural activities during the rainy season. 

They are on their fifth seasonal loan (PC) with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso, with earlier loans having been correctly reimbursed. The crop grown is peanuts in the case of Madame Haby, seated in the middle of the photo in this women's group called Benkadi 4. With her loan Mme Haby intends to buy one sack of 50 kg of fertilizer, 1 tin of herbicide, and pay the labor fees to maintain .5 hectares of land. 

After the harvest, the produce is sold in the village and in Sikasso to a clientele composed of men and women for cash or credit. Mme Haby expects to make an average profit of 73,000 CFA per season. This profit will allow her to repay her loan and also to help her husband with day-to-day expenses.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, herbicide, and pay labor expenses

loans.name: Lutfy

texts.en:
Lutfy is 47 years old. She is married and has two adult children. Lutfy is a very kind and ambitious woman. She is an entrepreneur. Lutfy has been busy with selling and processing for more than 20 years. She sells milk products to local people. Lutfy likes her job and earns a living in this way. 

She is going to expand her business now. She wants to produce and sell ice cream, so she needs freezer equipment. She is going to produce ice cream and sell it to the local people. She is asking for a loan of 7,000 Somoni to buy freezer equipment. She awaits your mercy.

loans.use: To buy freezer equipment for producing ice cream

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy fabric, thread and buttons for her business.

loans.name: Benkadi 3 Group

texts.fr:
Les 7 membres du groupe BENKADI 3 sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 34 ans, ont en moyenne 2 enfants et vivant la plupart dans des familles traditionnelles à N'GOLOKOUNA un village dans le cercle de SIKASSO 3ème région administrative du MALI.
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur cinquième prêt de campagne avec l’institution de microfinance soroyiriwaso, les prêts antérieurs ont été bien remboursés.
La spéculation cultivée est l’arachide avec madame  KOROTOUMOU assise au milieu sur la photo dans ce groupe de femme BENKADI 3. 
Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter 1 sac de 50 kg d’engrais, 1 bidon d’herbicide, payer les frais de labour pour entretenir  0,5 hectare. 
Après la récolte la production est vendue au niveau du village, à SIKASSO  à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes au comptant et à crédit.
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 73 000 francs CFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.
texts.en:
The seven members of the group BENKADI 3 are married women, who average 34 years of age and two children each. Most of the women live in traditional families in N'GOLOKOUNA, a village in Cercle de SIKASSO (3rd administrative region of the Republic of Mali). 

The women are collaborating with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso to carry out their farm work during the rainy season. They are on their fifth farm loan with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso. The previous loans were indeed paid back. 

The crop grown is peanuts, as is the case with Ms. KOROTOUMOU, who is sitting in the middle in the photo of this women’s group BENKADI 3. With this loan, she intends to purchase a 50-kg sack of fertilizer and container of herbicide and to cover the cost of plowing for maintaining 0.5 hectare.

After the harvest, the produce is sold to a customer base composed of men and women paying with cash or credit in the village and in SIKASSO. She plans on making an average profit of 73,000 francs CFA per planting. This profit will enable her in part to pay back the loan, as well as to help out her husband in meeting day-to-day expenses.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and herbicides and to cover the cost of plowing

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy construction materials

loans.name: David

texts.en:
David has been selling boiled eggs in Nakuru town. He has been blessed with seven children who are still in school. His business is doing well, and he successfully paid his previous loan.

He has applied for his second loan of 26,500 Kenyan shillings to buy more stock of eggs wholesale to sell to his customers at retail prices.

David hopes to grow his business and be able to give his children the best education.

loans.use: To buy more stocks of eggs to sell to his customers.

loans.name: Celnape

texts.en: Celnape runs a general store to make an income in addition to her husband's earning from their lumber business. For more than seven years, she has been able to sustain the business and successfully repaid her previous loans used for their business. To add inventory capital, she took a new loan to  purchase additional grocery goods to sell. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the loan to save as a reserve for future emergencies.

loans.use: to purchase additional grocery goods to sell

loans.name: Nuria Fiorella

texts.es:
Nuria es una joven emprendedora, tiene 23 años de edad, es soltera, no tiene hijos y vive en la Ciudad de Calleria junto a su familia.
Desde hace más de 1 año trabaja en la Municipalidad de la zona donde vive, también estudia en un Instituto. Es una persona muy independiente, tiene muchas ganas de salir adelante y mejorar su calidad de vida y el de su familia.
Nuria está muy agradecida con los prestamistas Kiva porque con el apoyo que le han brindado ella podrá comprarse un juego de dormitorio para que así pueda descansar mejor y vaya a trabajar con el mismo esfuerzo y dedicación con el que siempre lo hace. También comprará una refrigeradora para su domicilio para que pueda guardar los alimentos perecibles y sean más duraderos.
texts.en: Nuria is a 23 year old entrepreneur who is single. She has no children and lives with her family in the city of Calleria. For more then 1 year she has been working for the Municipality where she resides and also studies in an institute. She is a very independent person who has much desire to get ahead and improve the quality of living for herself and her family. Nuria is very grateful to the lenders at Kiva as thanks to the support they provide she can buy bedroom furniture so that she can rest better and go to work with her usual effort and dedication. She will also buy a refrigerator for the house to keep perishable foods so they last longer.

loans.use: to buy bedroom furniture and a fridge.

loans.name: Estefania

texts.es: La señora Estefanía vive con su esposo el señor Florencio y su pequeño hijo que depende de sus ingresos, ambos se dedican a la actividad agrícola en su parcela propia, donde cultivan piña, arroz, yuca, y otros cultivos tropicales desde hace 24 años, la producción la comercializan a los vendedores intermediarios de fruta en el mismo lugar de cosecha solo una pequeña parte lo trasladan hasta el mercado de entre ríos, debido a su larga experiencia obtienen buenas cosechas, con el pasar del tiempo las fuerzas para trabajar fueron disminuyendo es por ello que en la actualidad no cultivan en superficies grandes pero de esas pequeñas parcelas generan buenos ingresos con los cuales iniciaron la construcción de una casa pero les falto dinero por ello solicitan un crédito para concluirla, así podrán darle a su pequeño hijo mejores condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
Estefanía lives with her husband Florencio and their young son who is dependent on their income. They both work as farmers on their own piece of land, where they have been growing pineapple, rice, cassava and other tropical crops for 24 years. They sell their produce to fruit sales agents at the point of harvest and take just a small part of the harvest to the market in Entre Rios. Thanks to their years of experience they get good harvests. 

Over the years their strength for working has decreased and so they no longer grow crops on large areas of land. However, they make a good income from these small plots and have used this income to start to build a house. They need more money and so are asking for a loan so they can finish building, and as a result they will be able to give their young son better living conditions.

loans.use: to build a house.

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma greatly appreciates Kiva lenders for supporting her financially in her business. Besides the retail shop business, Fatuma also operates a clothes selling business.

She is requesting a loan to purchase more bales of clothes for her business. She joined Yehu to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase more bales of clothes for her business

loans.name: Fausto

texts.es:
Fausto, se decidió por un nuevo crédito, ya que con el crédito anterior tuvo buenas ganancias y desea continuar trabajando, lo invertirá en la compra de abono, plaguicidas, herbicidas, semilla, sodas, jugos, golosinas, arroz, pan entre otros, así como también comprara discos, grasa y fajas para el molino nixtamal, podrá sembrar sin problemas, surtirá la tienda y seguirá dando un buen servicio a sus clientes.
Con el capital que se le otorgo antes fortaleció sus diferentes actividades económicas, cuenta con un negocio más popular, mejores ingresos económicos con los que da mejores condiciones de vida a su familia y mantiene su buen record crediticio.
texts.en: Fausto decided to ask for another loan because the previous loan had good earnings, and he wants to continue working. He will invest it in the purchase of compost, insecticides, herbicides, seeds, sodas, juices, sweets, rice, and bread, among other things. He will also purchase discs, grease, and belts for the mill. He will be able to plant without problems, stock his store, and continue giving his customers good service. With the capital that he was awarded before, he strengthened his different economic activities and counts on a more popular business, and better economic earnings with which he gives his family better living conditions and maintains his good credit record.

loans.use: to buy compost, insecticides, herbicides, seeds, sodas, juices, sweets, rice, and bread, among other things

loans.name: Walter

texts.es:
Walter es un hombre de 33 años, soñador, trabajador y muy simpático. Trabaja en una barbería que monto hace más de tres años en la ciudad de Medellín.
Pero todo no ha sido fácil para este barranquillero de buen temple y trabajo duro, hubo un tiempo en el cual las cosas parecían no salirle bien, tanto así que se vio obligado a abandonar su natal barranquilla para irse a vivir a Medellín y buscar mejores oportunidades de trabajo. El es padre de un hijo menor y siempre hace todo lo posible por brindarle una buena educación.
El solicita un préstamo para capitalizar su negocio comprando algunas herramientas como una máquina de motilar nueva para reemplazar la que tiene en mal estado, adicionalmente necesita comprar insumos como cuchillas, lociones refrescantes, entre otros.
El préstamo le dará la oportunidad de prestar un mejor servicio y satisfacer las exigencias de sus clientes que en general son hombres jóvenes (Ver Foto). Se siente aliviado al saber que existen entidades que apoyan los proyectos y generan oportunidades de progreso.
texts.en:
Walter is a 33 year old man who is a dreamer. a hard-worker and very friendly. He works in a barber shop that he opened more than 3 years ago in the city of Medellín. Not everything has been easy for this good tempered, industrious man from Barranquilla. There was a time when it seemed things would not go well and he was forced to leave his native Barranquilla to live in Medellín and look for better employment. He is the father of a young son and he does everything possible to provide him with a good education.

He is requesting a loan to capitalize his business buying some tools like a new hair cutting machine to replace the one he has which is in poor condition. Also he needs to buy some supplies like razor blades, after shave lotion, amongst others.

The loan will give him the opportunity to offer better service and satisfy the needs of his customers who in general are young men ( see photo). He feels relieved that there are entities that support these projects and generate opportunities to progress.

loans.use: to buy a hair cutting machine and supplies for his work.

loans.name: Carlos Manuel

texts.es:
Carlos es un joven emprendedor, tiene 24 años de edad, vive en el Distrito de Calleria junto a su esposa y su hijo quien es su mayor orgullo y por quien lucha cada día para brindarle un mejor futuro.

Actualmente trabaja en una empresa maderera y le va muy bien porque es una persona puntual, responsable,  y muy amable. Desde muy joven tuvo que salir a trabajar porque su familia es de bajos recursos y él como buen hijo empezó a trabajar para poder brindar una ayuda económica.
Carlos está agradecido con los prestamistas kiva porque con el apoyo que le han brindado él podrá construir un negocio de abarrotes en su domicilio para así poder obtener un ingreso adicional y apoyar a sus padres y mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Carlos is a hard-working young man of 24 years who lives in the District of Callería together with his wife and his son who is his greatest pride and for whom he struggles each day in order to give him a better future.  

Currently he works in a construction business and things are going well because he is a punctual, responsible and very nice person.  From the time he was very young he had to go to work because his family had limited resources and he, like a good son, began to work to be able to offer economic assistance.  Carlos is thankful for the Kiva lenders because due to their assistance he will be able to build a grocery store in his home in order to thus obtain additional income and support his parents and improve his quality of life.

loans.use: To build a small grocery store in his home.

loans.name: Kim

texts.en:
Kim is 58 years old and lives in the Prey Chhor district of Kampong Cham Province, Cambodia. For the past 30 years, she has been a farmer. Kim works very hard on a small rice field behind her house. Together with her husband, she earns a daily profit of 3 USD each day. 

Kim is requesting a Kiva loan to buy a motorbike for her children to ride to their workplaces. This will be her second loan. Kim thanks lenders for their financial support via HKL, which provides her with a much lower interest rate than general loan products.

loans.use: to buy a motorbike

loans.name: Benkadi A Group

texts.fr:
Les 10 membres du groupe BENKADI A sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 42 ans, ont en moyenne 2 enfants et vivant la plupart dans des familles traditionnelles à N'GOLOKOUNA un village dans le cercle de SIKASSO 3ème région administrative du MALI.
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur quatrième prêt de campagne  avec l’institution de microfinance soroyiriwaso, les prêts antérieurs ont été bien remboursés.
La spéculation cultivée est l’arachide avec madame  MAMINATA débout à la première position de la gauche vers la droite sur la photo dans ce groupe de femme BENKADI A. 
Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter 25 kg d’engrais, 1 bidon d’herbicide, payer les frais de labour pour entretenir  0,25 hectare. 
Après la récolte la production est vendue au niveau du village, à SIKASSO  à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes au comptant et à crédit.
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 37 000 francs CFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.
texts.en:
The ten members of the Benkadi A group are married women averaging 42 years of age, with two children. They live mainly in traditional families in N’Golokouna, a village in the district of Sikasso, the third administrative region of Mali.
They collaborate with the Soro Yiriwaso microfinance institution in order to better manage their agricultural activities during the rainy season.
They are on their fourth agricultural loan with Soro Yiriwaso, having duly repaid their prior loans.
They grow peanuts, which is what Mrs. Maminata does, for example. She is the first one standing from left to right in the group photo. With her loan, she plans to buy 25 kg [55 lbs] of fertilizers, one jug of herbicide and pay the cost of labor to work 0.25 ha [0.6 acres] of land.
After harvesting, she sells her produce at the village an in Sikasso, to a mixed clientele, for cash and on credit. She plans to earn an average monthly revenue of 37,000 West African francs per agricultural season. This revenue will allow her to pay off her loan and also help her husband with everyday household expenses.

loans.use: to buy fertilzers and herbicides and pay the cost of labor.

loans.name: Roselita

texts.en:
Roselita is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a general store business in the Philippines. She has run her business for the past 15 years and also earns additional income from pig fattening. Roselita has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of loans from NWTF.

Roselita is requesting a 29,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy more groceries to sell. She dreams of saving enough money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to buy groceries to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to repair her home.

loans.name: Benkadi 1 Group

texts.fr:
Les 10 membres du groupe BENKADI 1 sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 40 ans, ont en moyenne 3 enfants et vivant la plupart dans des familles traditionnelles à N'GOLOKOUNA un village dans le cercle de SIKASSO 3ème région administrative du MALI.
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur cinquième prêt de campagne  avec l’institution de microfinance soroyiriwaso, les prêts antérieurs ont été bien remboursés.
La spéculation cultivée est l’arachide avec madame ALIMATA débout à la deuxième position de la gauche vers la droite sur la photo dans ce groupe de femme BENKADI 1. 
Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter 1 sac de 50 kg d’engrais, 1 bidon d’herbicide, payer les frais de labour pour entretenir  0,5 hectare. 
Après la récolte la production est vendue au niveau du village, à SIKASSO  à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes au comptant et à crédit.
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 73 000 francs CFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.
texts.en:
The ten members of the group BENKADI 1 are married women, who average 40 years of age and three children each. Most of the women live in traditional families in N'GOLOKOUNA, a village in Cercle de SIKASSO (3rd administrative region of the Republic of Mali). 

The women are collaborating with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso to carry out their farm work during the rainy season. They are on their fifth farm loan with Soro Yiriwaso. The previous loans were indeed paid back. 

The crop grown is peanuts, as is the case with Ms. ALIMATA, who is standing second from the left in the photo of this women’s group BENKADI 1. With this loan, she intends to purchase a 50-kg sack of fertilizer and a container of herbicide and to cover the cost of plowing for maintaining 0.5 hectare.

After the harvest, the produce is sold to a customer base composed of men and women paying with cash or credit in the village and in SIKASSO. She plans on making an average profit of 73,000 francs CFA per planting. This profit will enable her to pay back the loan, as well as to help out her husband in meeting day-to-day expenses.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and herbicides and to cover the cost of plowing

loans.name: Krowor Ladies 2 Group

texts.en:
Comfort runs a grocery store. She is the leader of a loan group made up of five members who work selling slippers, underwear, groceries, and the provision of hairdressing.  Comfort started her business with the support of her mother, who also had a grocery store, and she decided to start out on her own after many years. She joined ID-Ghana a year and a half ago at the invitation of a sister-in-law who is a member of the institution. When asked what she likes about ID-Ghana, Comfort responds that she likes the training that the institution offers her.

Comfort will use her portion of the loan to purchase wholesale groceries to sell at her store. The group loan will benefit small micro-businesses like hers. Comfort’s loan will allow her to generate resources to maintain her family, since she is single and has a son.

loans.use: to purchase wholesale groceries to sell

loans.name: Mukaddas

texts.en:
Mukaddas is 36 years old and married with two children. She lives with her family in south Tajikistan. Mukaddas is an educated person who works teaching biology in a local school. Her husband works in a factory. Mukaddas has a special pedagogical education. She is studying in absentia at the Pedagogical University and wants to earn a higher level of education to improve her knowledge.

Mukaddas is requesting a 3,300 TJS loan to pay for her tuition. She awaits your mercy.

loans.use: to pay for her tuition

loans.name: Benkadi 2 Group

texts.fr:
Les 10 membres du groupe BENKADI 2 sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 43 ans, ont en moyenne 2 enfants et vivant la plupart dans des familles traditionnelles à N'GOLOKOUNA un village dans le cercle de SIKASSO 3ème région administrative du MALI.
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur cinquième prêt de campagne  avec l’institution de microfinance soroyiriwaso, les prêts antérieurs ont été bien remboursés.
La spéculation cultivée est l’arachide avec madame NADINATA débout au milieu sur la photo dans ce groupe de femme BENKADI 2. 
Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter 1 sac de 50 kg d’engrais, 1 bidon d’herbicide, payer les frais de labour pour entretenir  0,5 hectare. 
Après la récolte la production est vendue au niveau du village, à SIKASSO  à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes au comptant et à crédit.
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 73 000 francs CFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.
texts.en:
The ten members of the group BENKADI 2 are married women, who average 43 years of age and two children each. Most of the women live in traditional families in N'GOLOKOUNA, a village in Cercle de SIKASSO (3rd administrative region of the Republic of Mali). 

The women are collaborating with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso to carry out their farm work during the rainy season. They are on their fifth farm loan with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso. The previous loans were indeed paid back. 

The crop grown is peanuts, as is the case with Ms. NADINATA, who is standing in the middle in the photo of this women’s group BENKADI 2. With this loan, she intends to purchase a 50-kg sack of fertilizer and a container of herbicide and to cover the cost of plowing for maintaining 0.5 hectare.

After the harvest, the produce is sold to a customer base composed of men and women paying with cash or credit in the village and in SIKASSO. She plans on making an average profit of 73,000 francs CFA per planting. This profit will enable her to pay back the loan, as well as to help out her husband in meeting day-to-day expenses.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and herbicides and to cover the cost of plowing

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase livestock to raise and sell

loans.name: Aguibou

texts.fr:
Monsieur AGUIBOU est né en Janvier 1967 à OUELENI-FIEBALA C/KADIOLO, marié et père de 5 enfants  il réside avec son épouse dans une famille traditionnelle à KAI un village de cercle de KADIOLO  dans la région de SIKASSO 3ième région administrative de la république du MALI. 
Monsieur AGUIBOU mène des activités d’achat et de vente de céréales  il ya plus de 15 ans, il s’approvisionne à KAI , à LOULOUNI et dans les villages environnants de KAI.
Il est à son neuvième prêt  individuel  avec l’Institution de Micro Finance Soro Yiriwaso dans le souci de mieux satisfaire sa clientèle de plus en plus croissant. Le prêt précédant a été correctement remboursé.  
Ce prêt lui permettra de faire l’achat de 25 sacs de 100 kg de céréales ( maïs, mil ) après l’achat il les stocke durant un moment dans son magasin à domicile avant la revente. La vente s’effectue en détail au marché  à une clientèle composée d’homme et de femme au comptant et à crédit.
 Il envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 70 000 francs CFA par mois. Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer le prêt et son intérêt et investir le reste dans son activité.
texts.en:
Mr. AGUIBOU was born in January 1967 in OUELENI-FIEBALA C/KADIOLO. He is a married father of five. He resides with his wife in a traditional family in KAI, a village in Cercle de KADIOLO, in Région de SIKASSO (3rd administrative region of the Republic of Mali). Mr. AGUIBOU has had a business buying and selling grains for over fifteen years. He gets his supplies in KAI, LOULOUNI, and the villages surrounding KAI.

He is on his ninth individual loan with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso in order to satisfy further his burgeoning customer base. The previous loan was correctly paid back. 

This loan will enable him to purchase 25 sacks of grains (corn, millet) weighing 100 kg each. Next he stocks the grain for a while in his store at home before reselling it. His sales are made at the retail level to a customer base composed of men and women paying with cash or credit at the market. He envisions making an average monthly profit of 70,000. This profit will allow him to pay back the loan with interest and to invest the rest in his business.

loans.use: to purchase grains

loans.name: Badeyakadi 5 Group

texts.fr:
Les 6 membres du groupe BADEYAKADI 5 sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 31 ans, ont en moyenne 3 enfants et vivant la plupart dans des familles traditionnelles à SANIENA un village dans la commune de FINKOLO dans le cercle de SIKASSO 3ème région administrative du MALI.
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur huitième prêt de campagne  avec l’institution de microfinance soroyiriwaso, les prêts antérieurs ont été bien remboursés.
La spéculation cultivée est l’arachide avec madame MARIAM assise à la première position de la droite vers la gauche sur la photo dans ce groupe de femme BADEYAKADI 5. 
Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter 2 sacs de 50 kg d’engrais, 2 bidons d’herbicide, payer les frais de labour pour entretenir  1 hectare. 
Après la récolte la production est vendue au niveau du village, à SIKASSO  à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes au comptant et à crédit.
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 160 000 francs CFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.
texts.en:
The six members of the group BADEYAKADI 5 are married women, who average 31 years of age and three children each. Most of the women live in traditional families in SANIENA, a village in Commune de FINKOLO, Cercle de SIKASSO (3rd administrative region of the Republic of Mali). 

The women are collaborating with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso to carry out their farm work during the rainy season. They are on their eighth farm loan with Soro Yiriwaso. The previous loans were indeed paid back. 

The crop grown is peanuts, as is the case with Ms. MARIAM, who is sitting first at the right in the photo of this women’s group BADEYAKADI 5. With this loan, she intends to purchase two 50-kg sacks of fertilizer and two containers of herbicide and to cover the cost of plowing for maintaining 1 hectare.

After the harvest, the produce is sold to a customer base composed of men and women paying with cash or credit in the village and in SIKASSO. She plans on making an average profit of 160,000 francs CFA per planting. This profit will enable her to pay back the loan, as well as to help out her husband in meeting day-to-day expenses.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and herbicides and to cover the cost of plowing

loans.name: Milly

texts.en:
Milly lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married with four children and all her children go to school. She takes care of two additional family members (old parents). 

She makes school uniforms and sweaters. She operates her business from a shop that she rents. She has been in this business for the last eight years. She works seven days a week. She has requested a loan of 2,400,000 from MCDT – SACCO to buy material for making uniforms and sweaters. Her major business challenge includes seasonality and electricity. 

Her goal and aspiration is to buy a better sewing machine for making sweaters and also to buy a plot of land so as to build rental houses. She lives in her own house and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her major monthly expense includes school fess, paying for utility bills and food.

loans.use: To buy more material for making uniforms.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to improve the house where she lives

loans.name: Stepan

texts.en:
Stepan liked his first partnership with Kiva. He developed his shoe production business, which he still runs. 

Stepan lives in the village of Verin  Ptghni, in the Kotayk region. He has some new plans connected with farming. Stepan cultivates vegetables for his family’s needs but he wants to start cattle breeding. He thinks that it may be really profitable to keep bulls, which he can sell as meat at New Year’s period with a  possible profit for his family. Stepan says that in the district of the village where he lives, there are lots of green rich pastures for farm cattle, so his plan may really be profitable. 

Stepan requested a loan, which he will use to buy two bulls and starts cattle breeding.

loans.use: to purchase two bulls and starts cattle breeding

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma appreciates her previous loan that improved her living standards. Her previous loan enabled her to expand her business and earn a higher income.

She would like to apply for a loan to buy cashew nuts and pay for transportation costs to her place of operation. She thanks Yehu Microfinance Trust for their financial support.

loans.use: to buy cashew nuts and pay for transportation costs to her place of operation.

loans.name: Saja

texts.en:
Saja is an 18-year-old married woman from Jenin city. She lives with her husband and one small son in a very simple house. Her husband is an employee in the public sector where he gets a low income. This is the only source of income for the family. Saja would like to improve the family living conditions and buy everything they need. 

Saja took a USD Murabaha loan from FATEN. This loan will help her to buy a solar system for heating water and a tank for her home. By taking this loan, Saja will be able to improve their living conditions and provide hot water without using electricity.

Saja appears in the photo.

loans.use: to buy a solar system for heating water and a tank for her home

loans.name: Noupagagnon 1 Group

texts.fr:
Les 10 membres du groupe  NOUPAGAGNON 1 sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 39 ans, ont en moyenne 2 enfants et vivant la plupart dans des familles traditionnelles à MISSIRIKORO une commune dans le cercle de SIKASSO 3ème région administrative du MALI.
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur troisième prêt de campagne  avec l’institution de microfinance soroyiriwaso, les prêts antérieurs ont été bien remboursés.
La spéculation cultivée est l’arachide avec madame ALIMA débout à la deuxième position de la gauche vers la droite sur la photo dans ce groupe de femme  NOUPAGAGNON 1. 
Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter 1 sac de 50 kg d’engrais, 1 bidon d’herbicide, payer les frais de labour pour entretenir  0,5 hectare. 
Après la récolte la production est vendue au niveau du village, à SIKASSO  à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes au comptant et à crédit.
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 73 000 francs CFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.
texts.en:
The ten members of the group NOUPAGAGNON 1 are married women who average 39 years of age and 2 children each. Most of them live in traditional families in MISSIRIKORO, a commune of the Sikasso circle (3rd administrative region of Mali). 

They joined the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso to sustain their farming activities during the rainy season and this is their 3rd time partnering with the MFI. All past loans were correctly repaid.  

Mrs. ALIMA grows groundnuts. She is the member standing 2nd from the left in the group photo. She will use her loan to buy one 50-kg sack of fertilizer and one jug of herbicide, and to pay for the plowing needed to maintain 0.5 hectare of farmland. 

After the harvest, the crops will be sold in the village in Sikasso, cash or credit, to a clientele consisting of both men and women. 

Mrs. Alima expects to earn an average profit of 73,000 FCFA per campaign, which she will use to repay her loan and to help her husband with dayi-to-day expenses.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and herbicides, and to cover the cost of plowing.

loans.name: Navy Zain

texts.es:
Navy es una persona muy emprendedora, tiene 42 años de edad y vive en Calleria junto a su familia.
Tiene dos maravillosos hijos por quienes día a día trabaja para poder brindarles un futuro mejor.
Actualmente trabaja como encargada de limpieza en un Instituto. Es una persona muy responsable, entusiasta, siempre dedicada a su labor. Tiene muchas ganas de salir adelante y con mucho esfuerzo y dedicación lo logrará.

Navy está agradecida con los prestamistas Kiva porque con el apoyo que le han brindado ella podrá comprar muebles para su vivienda como un juego de sala y comedor y dormitorio, de esta manera mejorará su calidad de vida y el de su familia y seguirá esforzándose para llegar a cumplir su más grande sueño: “Tener su propio negocio”.
texts.en:
Navy is a very enterprising person. She is 42 years old and lives in Calleria with her family.  She has two wonderful children and, day after day, she works to give them a better future.  Currently, she works as a janitor in an institute. She is a very responsible and enthusiastic person who is always focused on her work. She has a the drive to move up in life and, with much effort and persistence, she with succeed. 

Navy is grateful for the small Kiva loans because, with the support they have given her, she will be able to buy furniture for her home, including a game room, dining room and bedroom. In this way, she will improve her quality of life and continue pushing to reach and fulfill her biggest dream: "To have her own business."

loans.use: to buy a furniture for a game room, dining room and bedroom.

loans.name: Gladys Oneyda

texts.es:
La  Señora Gladys  es una persona  muy  emprendedora vive con  sus   hijos  y su  esposo en una comunidad al sur de Honduras. Su negocio es  la compra y venta  de ganado  desde hace más de 6  años.
Doña Gladys el préstamo lo necesita para la compra  de dos vacas. Con el crédito  ella espera  el aumento de sus ventas debido a que contara con más capital fresco y  que ofrecer a los clientes que la visitan,  y así cubrir sus necesidades, así mismo espera que mejore su situación económica y que se vea reflejado con esta inversión. En unos años ella espera que su negocio  este posicionado con sus clientes y  conocidos de la zona de  donde vive y poder seguir apoyando a  su familia  a que se convierta en personas de bien  para la sociedad.

Choluteca, Honduras –  Mayo   del 2014
texts.en:
Gladys is a very enterprising person.  She lives with her children and her husband in a community in the south of Honduras.  Her business has been buying and selling cattle for more than six years.

Gladys needs the loan to buy two cows.  She hopes to increase her sales with the loan because she'll have more fresh capital and products to offer the customers, so she'll cover her needs.  She also expects to improve her economic situation with this investment.

She hopes that in three years her business will be positioned with her customers and well known in her area so she can keep on supporting her family to become respectable people in society.

Choluteca, Honduras, May 2014

loans.use: to buy two cows

loans.name: Yakob

texts.en:
Yakob is a 29-year-old, single man from Qalqilia City. He lives with his family in a very simple house in the city. His oldest brother is a worker with a low and unstable income. 

Yakob works in a barber shop he has owned for the past two years. It is a good business and the income is high.

Yakob took a USD loan from Palestine for Credit & Development (FATEN). This loan will help him to buy new tools for his barber shop. By taking this loan, he will be able to improve his business and attract more clients.

Yakob appears in the photo.

loans.use: to buy new tools for his barber shop.

loans.name: Srey

texts.en:
Srey, the 41-year-old mother of three school children, lives in a rural area of Prey Chhor District, Kampong Cham Province, Cambodia. Srey has been working as a farmer in a small rice field near her house for more than twenty years. In total, Srey can make USD 3 per day from her farming.

Srey is borrowing a loan from HKL to build a hygienic latrine for the sake of her family members.  Srey hopes that this loan will help her to promote her healthy living conditions. Srey thanks lenders for the financial support via HKL, which provides her with a much lower interest rate than its general loan product.

loans.use: to build a hygienic latrine

loans.name: Felina

texts.en:
As a widowed mother of eight children, Felina works hard to support her family.

She has a dried fish business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from pig fattening. Felina is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF in order to buy more dried fish to sell to customers.

Felina has been sustaining her business activities through her past ten loans from NWTF and more recently, through Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to buy more dried fish to sell.

loans.name: Zaruhi

texts.en:
Zaruhi is 36 years old and she lives with her nice family in Vanadzor city in Lori region. She has two pretty school-aged children.  Zaruhi graduated from Vanadzor State Medical College, faculty of nursing. Now she works at the Vanadzor Medical Center as a nurse. She is a very clever and kind woman and when her friends and relatives need her help and medical advice she is always ready and she is always on time. 

Zaruhi has a great wish that her two children will appreciate the importance of education so she hopes that both of them will have higher education with useful professions. 

Zaruhi needs this loan since with the end of the academic year the school-organized excursions for the children and Zaruhi wants some support in order to cope with these expenses.

loans.use: to cope with expenses connected with school-organized excursions for her children

loans.name: Vahe

texts.en:
This young man of 28 years, named Vahe, lives in the village Ddmashen in the Gegharkunik region. He used to live with his brother, but now the brother is away and temporally lives and works in the Russian Federation. So now Vahe lives alone. 

He used to work at different constructional companies but now he works at the Military Police as a contractual serviceman and at the same time runs a farm. In his farm he has two cows, two piglets, and twenty chickens. On his plot of land he cultivates potatoes, which is the most typical vegetable for his region. 

Since Vahe lives alone he has much time after his work to be more seriously engaged in farming and he especially wants to develop his poultry. So he requests this loan in the amount of 200,000 AMD (Armenian drams) to buy a lot of chickens, which will allow him to sell more eggs and chickens than he does now.

loans.use: to buy a lot of chickens, which will allow him to sell more eggs and chickens than he does now

loans.name: Fabian David

texts.es: Fabian de 32 años, habita con su esposa y su hijo de 7 años en un municipio área metropolitana de la ciudad de Barranquilla.Desde hace 4 años emprendió un negocio, despues de haber sido empleado durante mucho tiempo y acudiendo a un amigo comerciante,con el cual fortaleció en  inició su emprendimiento, vendiendo articulos escolares, accesorios productos de belleza directamente al consumidor mediante crédito, mientra los compra de contado en almacenes del centro dela ciudad. Su meta es mejorar la imagen de su negocio y aumentar su calidad de vida, aunque su mayor desafio es lograr fuentes de finaciación para avanzar en sus propósitos. En la actualidad está aplicando a un credikiva, mediante el cual comprará accesorios, útiles de papelería entre otras mercancias requerídas para aumentar sus inventarios y vender mucho mas.
texts.en:
Fabian is 32 years old and lives with his wife and 7-year-old child in a metropolitan municipal area of the city of Barranquilla. It has been four years since his business took off, after being employed for a long time, thanks to a business partner who strengthened the enterprise in the beginning.  He sells school supplies, accessories and beauty products directly to the consumer through credit after he buys them in person in stores in the city center.

His goal is to improve the image of his business and improve his quality of life, but his greatest challenge is access to financial resources to advance his goals.  At this time, he is applying for a loan through Kiva, with which he will buy accessories and stationery supplies among other needed merchandise in order to expand his inventory and increase sales.

loans.use: to buy accessories and stationery supplies among other merchandise.

loans.name: Mariam

texts.en:
Mariam is 29 years old, married, and has two children who attend school. She lives in Kheltubani. Her husband receives a disabled pension from the local government. The family lives under the poverty level, as they have no significant and stable income. The only source of income for family is seasonal. Mariam works hard on family-owned agricultural land, where she harvests seasonal fruits and sells them at the local market. The work is hard for her, as she leads the family alone and her husband can not help her for agricultural activities. 

To make her work more productive, Mariam requested a loan from Credo, which she will use to purchase a special hand tractor. Her application was approved with the joint initiative between Kiva and Credo. The start-up program gives people a chance to start or re-start businesses. This loan will enable Mariam to cultivate more area and seed various kinds of fruits. Her income will significantly increase with the help of the tractor and can improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase a tractor

loans.name: Neema

texts.en:
Neema is a married woman with seven children, four of whom attend school. She owns a house that has electricity but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees. 

For the past three years, she has operated a shop kiosk business, selling to her neighbours and passersby.  She dreams of establishing a wholesale shop in the future.

With the loan, she wants to purchase sweets, biscuits, bread, milk, soft drinks, rice, beans, and cooking  oil. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business

loans.use: to purchase sweets, biscuits, bread, milk, soft drinks, rice, beans, and cooking  oil.

loans.name: Jose Angel

texts.es: José tiene 37 años de edad y habita en casa propia junto a su esposa y su hija de 12 años y su hijo de 15 años de edad. José trabaja en una panadería desde hace 10 años y de esta forma se gana la vida y mantiene la economía de su hogar. Con el deseo de mejorar sus condiciones de vida solicita este crédito a FUSAI para invertir  en la construcción de un muro en su vivienda y para encementar el piso de la misma. Con el monto solicitado comprará cemento, arena, ladrillo, hierro, etc.
texts.en: Jose is 37 years old and lives in his own house with his wife, 12-year-old daughter and his 15-year-old son. Jose has worked at a bread store for 10 years and this is how he makes a living and manages the finances of his home. With the desire to improve his living conditions, he has requested this loan from FUSAI to invest in the construction of a wall on his house and to cement the floor. With this requested amount, he will buy cement, sand, bricks, iron, etc.

loans.use: to buy: cement, sand, brick, iron, etc. to cement the floor and build a wall on his house.

loans.name: Noupagagnon 2 Group

texts.fr:
Les 10 membres du groupe  NOUPAGAGNON 2 sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 34 ans, ont en moyenne 2 enfants et vivant la plupart dans des familles traditionnelles à MISSIRIKORO  une commune dans le cercle de SIKASSO 3ème région administrative du MALI.
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur troisième prêt de campagne ( PC ) avec l’institution de microfinance soroyiriwaso, les prêts antérieurs ont été bien remboursés.
La spéculation cultivée est l’arachide avec madame FATOUMATA débout au milieu sur la photo dans ce groupe de femme  NOUPAGAGNON 2. 
Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter 1 sac de 50 kg d’engrais, 1 bidon d’herbicide, payer les frais de labour pour entretenir  0,5 hectare. 
Après la récolte la production est vendue au niveau du village, à SIKASSO  à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes au comptant et à crédit.
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 73 000 francs CFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.
texts.en:
The 10 members of the group Noupagagnon 2 are married women with an average age of 34, have on average two children, and live mostly in traditional families in Missirikoro, a township in the Sikasso circle, third administrative region of Mali. 

They collaborate with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso so as to succeed in their agricultural activities during the rainy season. They are on their third seasonal loan (PC) with the institution, and their prior loans have been correctly reimbursed. 

The crop cultivated is peanuts in the case of Madame Fatoumata, standing in the middle in the photo of this women's group Noupaganon 2. With her loan she intends to buy one sack of 50 kg of fertilizer, one tin of herbicide, and to pay labor expenses to maintain .5 hectares of land. 

After the harvest, produce is sold right in the village and in Sikasso, to a clientele composed of men and women, for cash or credit. Mme. Fatoumata expects to make an average profit of 73,000 CFA per season. This profit will allow her to repay her loan and help her husband with day-to-day expenses.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and herbicides, and pay labor expenses

loans.name: Quarter B Group

texts.en:
This is Quarter B group consisting of 11 members. In mid 2014, these hard-working tribal women came together as a group to help one another to empower themselves and improve their earning capacity. They belong to Churachandpur in Manipur state, which is in the northeastern part of India. Hatnu, who is raising her hand in the photo, is one of the group members. She is 45 years old and lives with her four sons, one daughter and her husband. Her husband is 50 years old. He works in a municipal department (town cleaning). Her husband's income alone cannot support the family, so the family is dependent on Hatnu's business.

Hatnu bought a handloom (a simple machine for weaving) to increase her production. She weaves traditional shawls and wrap-around skirts. Hatnu owns three handloom machines; she employs people to run the two machines while she uses the other one to weave. She hopes to get a good business turnover by selling the finished products in bulk to the retailers and distributors. The products are in high demand during the wedding and festive seasons like Christmas. She wants to double her production. Therefore, she wishes to access a solar home lighting system to be installed in her handloom house in order to extend her business hours into the evening and night. The irregularity of lighting in the town is a hurdle for income-generating people. Hatnu believes that the solar lighting will be a great help because it reduces maintenance of alternative lighting devices and can save electricity bills with a longer back up lighting system at zero cost. 

With the income she gets from the business, Hatnu pays for her children’s school expenditures and with the little savings she has, Hatnu manages the family affairs. Like her the rest of the group members need a loan for their income-generating activities and for their household use. The members' activities are weaving, variety store, garment shop etc.

Hatnu is happy and wishes good fortune to all the lenders around the world so that they may continue their kindness to helpless people like her. She extends her warm greetings on behalf of the group.

loans.use: To own a 45-watt solar home lighting system to install in her handloom house.

loans.name: Melanya

texts.en:
Melanya is 54 years old and she lives in Vanadzor city in Lori region. She graduated from Vanadzor State Pedagogical Institute, faculty of Biology. This nice lady has 20 years of pedagogical experience and already several generations whom she taught at the school very often visit her, remember, and respect her very much. Melanya now works at school as a teacher of biology and she also gives private courses in biology and prepares pupils for entrance examinations.

 Melanya is a mother of three perfect and intelligent children, who are already grown up; each of them is employed and engaged in his favorite work.  

 Melanya needs this loan since she greatly wants to buy a computer and some professional literature that she needs during her training courses with pupils.

loans.use: to buy a computer and some professional literature that she needs during her training courses with pupils

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to repair her home.

loans.name: Borix

texts.es: Borix  se dedica al cultivo de productos agricolas en combinacion con la cria de animales o explotacion mixta Borix tiene ingresos semanales por la venta de sus productos y necesita un credito para la compra de semilla mejorada Borix es una persona confiable y se esfuerza mucho en su actividad por lo que se recomienda otorgarle un prestamo Borix vive en Palomar
texts.en:
Borix engages in the cultivation of agricultural products along with raising animals, which is also known as mixed farming. He earns a weekly income from the sale of his products, so he needs a loan so that he can buy improved seeds.

Borix is a trustworthy person who puts a great deal of effort into his business. For this reason, he is being recommended for a loan. Borix lives in Palomar.

loans.use: to buy improved seeds for cultivation.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married with five children who all go to school. She takes take of additional family members as well. She sells charcoal on both a wholesale and a retail basis. She has been in this business for the last 10 years. She works seven days a week. 

Grace has requested a loan of 2,900,000 UGX from MCDT SACCO to buy bags of charcoal. Her major business challenges include seasonality and electricity. Her goal and aspiration is to build rental houses. She would like to buy a plot of land. She lives in her own house and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her major monthly expenses include school fees and food.

loans.use: To buy bags of charcoal

loans.name: Susana

texts.es:
La señora Susana  de 47  años  de edad, vive con su conyugue, tiene 3  hijos que dependen de ella radica en la comunidad del TULAR, Nacaome, valle al sur de Honduras, tiene casa propia  y se dedica desde hace 10 años  a la elaboración y venta de queso y cuajada, ella le vende los quesos y la cuajada a las pulpería, y a las personas que tiene comedores, y los que se dedican a la elaboración de baleadas, y rosquillas, su venta es en su casa y los clientes llegan atraer el queso a su casa, tiene dos personas que le ayudan en el proceso de la elaboración de los quesos, doña  Susana es una mujer trabajadora y emprendedora.
Ella esta solicitando el préstamo para la  compra de  leche para cuajar y también para venderla en líquido, tiene deseo comprarse una vaca parida porque ella también tiene una pequeña hacienda, con el apoyo de este préstamo ella  pretende mejorar sus ingresos y también su condición de vida, está muy contenta  de seguir trabajando con Prisma y Kiva  su deseo es seguir luchando para darle un mejor futuro a su familia, este es su cuarto préstamo que solicita es una mujer que paga bien sus créditos y con créditos ha ido creciendo en su negocio.
Su sueño es mejorar su casa.
San Lorenzo, Honduras - Mayo del 2014.
texts.en:
Susana is 47 years old. She lives with her spouse and has 3 children who are dependent on her. She comes from the community of El Tular, Nacaome, Valle, in southern Honduras. She has her own house, and for 10 years she has dedicated herself to making and selling cheese and milk curds. She sells her cheeses and curds to neighborhood stores, to people who have small restaurants, and to those who work making baleadas [filled tortillas] and rosquillas [fried dough rings]. She sells her products from her home, and her cheeses attract customers to visit her there. She has two people who help her with the cheese-making process. Susana is a hard-working and enterprising woman. 

She is requesting the loan to buy milk to make curds, and also to sell it in liquid form. She would like to buy herself a pregnant cow, because she also has a small ranch. With the help of this loan, she intends to improve her income and also her standard of living. She is very happy to continue working with Prisma and Kiva. Her desire is to keep working hard to give her family a better future. This is the fourth loan she has requested. She is a woman who pays off her loans reliably, and with the loans her business has been growing. 

Her dream is to improve her house. 

San Lorenzo, Honduras - May 2014.

loans.use: to buy milk for her business.

loans.name: Mwanamwinyi

texts.en:
Mwanamwinyi is a hardworking and enterprising woman who greatly appreciates Kiva lenders for their financial support.

She is requesting a loan to purchase wheat flour, beans, rice, and maize flour for her business. She joined Yehu to get financial support.

loans.use: to purchase wheat flour, beans, rice, and maize flour for her business

loans.name: Patrick

texts.en:
Patrick is 30 years old, married, and blessed with two children aged six and two and half years old. He has been in the motorcycle transport business for the last five years and earns an income  of KES 25,000.

He has applied for his second loan to buy spare parts and repair the motorcycle for it to be in a good condition and serve his customers well. He repaid his previous loan successfully.

He hopes to grow his business and use the anticipated income to buy a plot of land and build a house for the family.

loans.use: to buy  spare parts and repair the motorcycle

loans.name: Nancy

texts.en:
Hello Kiva Lenders! Meet Nancy, a mother of two who lives on a small piece of land in Nandi Hills Location. For the last ten years, she has been growing tea and vegetables and keeping dairy cows and poultry. Predictably, she makes a income selling milk, eggs, tea leaves, and greens. 

Nancy is here seeking a loan to purchase rabbits for cuniculture. In Kenya, rabbit meat is not typically a dietary staple for many consumers. For this reason, many farmers do not get into rabbit farming because marketing rabbit is a considerable challenge. However, there is an organization formed in Kenya that provides training to farmers, rabbits for rearing, and a market for farmers. 

With your loan, Nancy will be able to seize this lifetime opportunity. Using your money, she will acquire rabbits to rear. Rabbits' gestation period is just one month. A rabbit bears six times in a year. It delivers three to ten offspring at once which can be sold after 100 days. 

Income from a rabbit farm will meet her skyrocketing business-related expenses. This will in turn benefit Nancy's family due to increase in income.

loans.use: to purchase rabbits

loans.name: Nazi

texts.en:
Nazi is a 59-year-old hardworking woman, from the village of Saprasia. She lives with her daughter, who gets social assistance from the local government, as the family lives under the poverty level. 

Nazi works on family-owned agricultural land, where she grows nuts and sells them locally during the season.
