She always has high quality products, but the income is insignificant, and Nazi can't satisfy her family's even basic needs. She has a great desire to expand her activity and start dairy farming.

That's why she requested a loan, and was approved for 1,500 GEL. Nazi plans to purchase a milk cow, and produce yogurt and cheese and sell it locally. This activity will help her cover daily expenses and live in better conditions. 

Nazi awaits your support, and will be thankful to all the lenders for helping her maintain her farming business.

loans.use: To purchase a milk cow

loans.name: God Is Able Group

texts.en:
These ladies are part of the group called God is Able and are on the seventh loan cycle. They have their own businesses and want to continue investing so they can grow and make progress in life. They are doing the survey to determine each one's situation so they can work accordingly. They are into grocery, cloth, slippers, ear rings, fish, corn, cassava dough, and waakye (cooked rice and beans). 

Diana is one of the members and she works in business; that is, she has a grocery store in her house. She works there every day from very early in the morning. 

She will use the loan to buy more grocery stocks for her store, such as rice, sugar, Milo (maltd milk), milk, eggs, drinks, meat, tinned goods and other items. Her husband is also working as a driver. She is 39 years old with three children who are of school-going age.

The group need a total amount of GHS 5,900 to expand businesses so that they can serve customers better.

loans.use: To buy more grocery stocks to her store, such as rice, sugar, Milo, milk, eggs, drinks, meat, tinned goods, and other items.

loans.name: Danaya Group

texts.fr:
Les quatre membres du groupe DANAYA sont des femmes mariées avec une moyenne d’âge de 35 ans, et ont en moyenne 2 enfants. Elles vivent la plupart dans des familles traditionnelle à  OUAYERMA I un des quartiers populaire de la ville de SIKASSO  3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles sont à leurs neuvièmes prêts solidaires avec l’institution de micro finance Soro Yiriwaso afin de satisfaire le besoin de leur clientèle. Les prêts antérieurs ont été correctement remboursés.
Madame DOUSSOU  fait la vente de bazin dans ce groupe de femme DANAYA. Elle se tient à l’extrême droite sur la photo.
 Elle compte acheter avec son prêt 8 pièces de bazin au grand marché,  elle est beaucoup sollicitée de sa clientèle par la qualité de ses marchandises.
Elle les revend à OUAYERMA I à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femme au comptant et à crédit. 
 Elle  envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 35 000 francs CFA dont une partie est  utilisée  pour payer le prêt et son interêt et l’autre pour son épargne.
texts.en:
The four members of the group called Danaya are married women with an average age of 35, and they have on average two children. They mostly live in traditional families in Ouayerma I, one of the populous neighborhoods of the town of Sikasso, third administrative region of Mali. They are on their ninth solidarity loan with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso so as to satisfy the needs of their clientele. Their prior loans have been correctly reimbursed. 

Among this women's group called Danaya, Madame Doussou sells lengths of locally dyed cloth called bazin.  She is standing on the far right in the photo. She intends to use her loan portion to buy eight lengths of bazin at the Grand Market. She is much sought-after among her clientele for the quality of her merchandise. She resells the cloth in Ouayerma I to a clientele composed of men and women, for cash or credit. She expects to make an average monthly profit of 35,000 CFA of which part will be utilized to repay the loan and interest and the rest put aside as savings.

loans.use: to buy lengths of cloth (bazin)

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more chicks and feed for his chicken farm.

loans.name: Noupagagnon 3 Group

texts.fr:
Les 10 membres du groupe  NOUPAGAGNON 3 sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 35 ans, ont en moyenne 2 enfants et vivant la plupart dans des familles traditionnelles à MISSIRIKORO une commune dans le cercle de SIKASSO 3ème région administrative du MALI.
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur troisième prêt de campagne  avec l’institution de microfinance soroyiriwaso, les prêts antérieurs ont été bien remboursés.
La spéculation cultivée est l’arachide avec madame ASSANA assise au milieu sur la photo dans ce groupe de femme  NOUPAGAGNON 3. 
Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter 1 sac de 50 kg d’engrais, 1 bidon d’herbicide, payer les frais de labour pour entretenir  0,5 hectare. 
Après la récolte la production est vendue au niveau du village, à SIKASSO  à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes au comptant et à crédit.
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 93 000 francs CFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.
texts.en:
The ten members of the group NOUPAGAGNON 3 are married women who average 35 years of age and 2 children each. Most of them live in traditional families in MISSIRIKORO, a commune of the Sikasso circle (3rd administrative region of Mali). 

They joined the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso to sustain their farming activities during the rainy season, and this is their 3rd time partnering with the MFI. All past loans were correctly repaid.  

Mrs. ASSANA grows groundnuts. She is the member sitting in the center in the group photo. She plans to buy one 50-kg sack of fertilizer and one jug of herbicide, and to pay for the plowing needed to maintain 0.5 hectare of farmland. 

After the harvest, the crops will be sold in the village in Sikasso, cash or credit, to a clientele consisting of both men and women. 

Mrs. Assana expects to earn an average profit of 93,000 FCFA per campaign, which she will use to repay her loan and to help her husband with the family’s day-to-day expenses.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and herbicides, and to cover the cost of plowing.

loans.name: Asha

texts.en: Asha appreciates her previous loan, which improved her living standards. Her previous loan enabled her to expand her business and earn a higher income. She would like to apply for a loan to buy more sacks of cashew nuts for her business. She thanks Yehu for their financial support.

loans.use: to buy more sacks of cashew nuts for her business

loans.name: Regina

texts.en:
Regina lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is single with two children, one of whom goes to school. She takes take of two additional family members. She lives in a rented house, and the family has access to electricity but does not have access to piped water. Her major monthly expenses include school fees and rent. 

She is a tailor; she operates her business from a shop that she rents. She operates on retail basis. She has been in this business for the last 10 years, working six days a week. 

Regina has requested a loan of 2,200,000 from MCDT SACCO to buy materials for clothes. 

Her major business challenges includes seasonality and transportation. Her goal and aspiration is to buy an electric sewing machine, and also make a fashion school.

loans.use: To buy materials for making clothes

loans.name: Sasun

texts.en:
Sasun is 39 years old. He lives with his nice family in Kadjaran city, which is in Syunik region. Sasun has no higher education, but his vocational education and profession of constructor allow him to provide his family with normal living conditions. Sasun’s wife does not work; she takes care of their three children. They have two sons and a daughter. Sasun is a very solicitous and devoted father. Since he is the only bread winner in his family, he works at the Kadjaran copper-molybdenum mine and does different construction works by order. 

Now Sasun and his wife are very anxious and worried about their smallest son. Sasun asks for this loan and greatly hopes to get it since his smaller son feels weak and unhealthy because of an illness. This loan will help a one-year-old child to receive treatment. When he recovers, he will surely return to his cheerful and active way of life. Sasun and his family will be unbelievably, enormously happy and thankful to have this loan as fast as possible.

loans.use: to get medical treatment for his one-year-old child

loans.name: Jeremiah

texts.en:
Hello, world! Meet Jeremiah, a father of one who has been involved in mixed farming for the last four years. He has a small piece of land in Nandi Hills, Kenya.  On the land, he grows tea and keeps dairy cattle and poultry. He sells milk and eggs produced at a local market where the demand is high.

Jeremiah is seeking a loan to venture into rabbit farming (cuniculture).  In Kenya, rabbit farming is not recognized as a "traditional" or "mainstream" livestock production system. To most farmers, it is considered a "marginal" or alternative form of agriculture. But to Jeremiah, rabbit farming requires modest investment as it needs only simple facilities and small land area. “It provides income from small investment in a short period.” 

With your loan, Jeremiah will be able to purchase rabbits for farming. There is a ready market for rabbit meat that Jeremiah is sure to sell into. Income generated from rabbit farming will relieve the heavy business-related expenses he is currently dealing with. He said, “I will invest in rabbits which will boost my income and raise my family’s living standard.”

loans.use: To pay for rabbits

loans.name: Fausta

texts.en:
Fausta lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is single with five children, two of whom go to school. She takes take of two additional family members. She lives in her own house, and the family has access to electricity but does not have access to piped water. Her major monthly expenses include school fees and rent. 

She is a tailor; she operates her business from a shop that she rents. She operates on retail basis. She has been in this business for the last 10 years, and works six days a week. 

She has requested a loan of 1,500,000 from MCDT SACCO to buy material for clothes and a bale of second-hand clothes. 

Her major business challenges include seasonality and transportation. Her goal and aspiration is to buy an electric sewing machine and also to build rental houses.

loans.use: To buy a bale of second-hand clothes and material for clothes

loans.name: Gohar

texts.en:
Gohar is a pedagogue with 15 years of experience and she lives and works in Vanadzor city in Lori region. She graduated from Vanadzor State Pedagogical Institute, faculty of Physics and Mathematics. Now she works at a village school as a teacher of mathematics. As she says, she likes her profession and does her best to educate and to teach this important subject in a way that it can be clear and intelligible for each pupil in her class. Gohar says that the school where she works is a village school and there exists great lack of information; using information only from the school books is unattractive and not interesting, even boring for this generation.

Gohar is married and she has a daughter who is married already and a son who now is in the army. Her husband temporarily works in the Russian Federation and from there transfers money for his family’s needs.
 
She is asking for this loan since she wants to teach and work with new methods, make her lessons more informative, and for this reason, she wants to buy a computer and some professional literature. She is sure she will succeed and the pupils will be happy about such a great change.

loans.use: to buy a computer and some professional literature

loans.name: Henry

texts.en: Henry is a repeat client who operates a bar as his major source of income, but he also carries out agriculture production as an additional income. He is applying for a loan of 1.000.000 UGH, to add capital through buying stocks of sodas and beer for his business. He will also buy mulch for his banana plantation. He hails from a village in masya parish, Nyakagyeme sub- County; Rukungiri district. He has operated his business for 15 years, however; he has been faced with limited capital and competition to compete favorably in the market. He hopes with this loan from UGAFODE he expects to expand his business and increase his income base. Henry is hard working and honest and thanks Kiva lenders for the good job they are doing to support his business.

loans.use: To buy cattle for rearing

loans.name: Tunu

texts.en:
Tunu is a married woman with four children, all of whom attend school. She lives in her own house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees. 

For the past four years she has operated a retail shop business, selling to her neighbours and passersby. 

With the loan, Tunu wants to purchase wheat flour, maize flour, sugar, salt, bread, milk, beans, and cooking  oil for her business. 

She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase wheat flour, maize flour, sugar, salt, bread, milk, beans, and cooking  oil for her business

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma is married with three children, two of whom are in school, and one is an adult. They live at their own house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

Fatuma has operated a fruit and vegetable stall business for the past two years. She sells from home to her neighbors. She dreams of establishing a mini-green grocer in the future.

With the loan, she wants to purchase bales of green vegetables, onions, potatoes, and tomatoes to sell. 

She decided to join Yehu to get financial support.

loans.use: to purchase bales of green vegetables, onions, potatoes, and tomatoes to sell.

loans.name: Muhabbat

texts.en:
Muhabbat is 53 years old and she is a hardworking woman with a great desire to progress in life. Her lifetime partner’s name is Mirzosaid, and they have four children. They live together in the capital of Tajikistan. For more than eight years she has been busy with selling women's and children's clothes. She sells her goods in a local market. She knows all aspects of her business very well. Her experiences and skills help her to develop her business and in this way improve their living conditions. 

This is the fifth loan she is requesting from IMON and she feels deeply grateful for the economic support she has received to achieve her goals. She is asking for a loan of 7,500 somoni to buy children's and women's shoes. She awaits your mercy.

loans.use: To buy children's and women's shoes for the new season

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Buy construction material to repair her house

loans.name: Sunavar

texts.ru:
Сунавар продавщица на местном рынке своего района Вахш. Она 50-летняя вдова с двумя сыновьями и тремя дочерьми. Восемь лет назад Сунавар начала свой маленький бизнес по продаже таджикских лепешек. Она у местных пекарей оптом покупает лепешки и затем по розничной цене продает в своей торговой точке. Ее товар всегда в спросе, так как лепешка главное кушанье на столе у таджиков. Благодаря своему бизнесу Сунавар поддерживает и обеспечивает семью. 
Сейчас Сунавар обратилась за кредитом, чтобы увеличить товарооборот, а на остальную часть кредита провести в доме долгожданный ремонт. Этот кредит очень важен для нее. Она надеется на вашу отзывчивость.
texts.en:
Sunavar is a seller at a local market of her district of Vakhsh. She is a 50-year-old widow with two sons and three daughters. Sunavar started her small business of selling Tajik flatbread eight years ago. She buys flatbread wholesale from local bakers and then resells it at a retail price at her retail outlet. Her product is always in demand because flatbread is the main staple on the Tajik table. Thanks to her business, Sunavar is able to support and provide for her family.

Sunavar is now requesting a loan to increase her product turnover and use the remaining amount of the loan to make long-awaited repairs at home. This loan is very important to her. She hopes for your empathy.

loans.use: to resell flatbread and partially to repair her house in order to improve living conditions

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy a stock of ingredients for preparing food to sell

loans.name: Cesar Agusto

texts.es:
Si hay un cumpleaños familiar todos se dirigen donde Cesar, cuyo negocio es el alquiler de videoroconolas, lo que propicia un ambiente alegre y dinámico en todas las fiesta. Tiene 59 años de edad, está casado y tiene cinco hijos todos mayores e independientes. Desde los 17 años se vio en la necesidad de buscar un medio para subsistir, razón por la que fue ayudante en el negocio de su tío, el mismo al que hoy se dedica. Al obtener capital suficiente es cuando inició a trabajar de manera independiente.  
Cesar solicita el crédito para el mantenimiento de las videoroconolas, requiere comprar repuestos, así como parlantes, pantallas y pintura para retoques de imagen. Él deposita su confianza en el financiamiento para aumentar la demanda de su producto, puesto que anhela obtener mejores ingresos para brindarle a su familia mejores condiciones de vida. Es un hombre emprendedor y con grandes metas, una de ellas es ser reconocido más allá de su comunidad.
texts.en:
If there is a birthday in the family, people go to Cesar's, whose business is renting arcade machines which create a happy and dynamic atmosphere for any party. 

Cesar is 59 years old, married, and has five children who are all independent adults. At the age of 17, he realized that he needed to find a way to make a living, which is why he started helping in his uncle's business, the same business he runs today. Upon getting enough capital, Cesar began working independently. 

Cesar is requesting this loan to maintain the arcade machines. He needs to buy spare parts, as well as speakers, screens, and paint for improving the business' image. He is confident that this financing will help to increase demand for his business, and he dreams of having higher income so that he can provide his family with better living conditions. Cesar is an enterprising man and has big goals, one of which is to be well-known outside his community.

loans.use: to buy spare parts, as well as speakers, screens, and paint for improving the business' image.

loans.name: Karlen

texts.en:
Karlen lives in the village Lernadzor in the Syunik region. Karlen is divorced and he now lives alone. For several years, Karlen worked as a storekeeper at the factory. Now he combines two jobs: he works as a Television station chief and at the same time he has a farm that is not small. 

On his farm, Karlen has cows, calves, chickens, bees and a plot of land. Karlen sells meat, milk, eggs and honey from his farm, and he says he finds special pleasure and joy in his beekeeping activities. Karlen’s farm is very cute and everything there is always in order. Since living alone, he spend all his free time outdoors, and he does his best to have a nice farm.

Karlens is requesting a loan of 500,000 Armenian drams (AMD) with the great desire of making his farm richer with animals. He wants to buy a cow and chickens, as well as frames and wax papers for his beehives.

loans.use: to buy a cow and chickens, as well as frames and wax papers for his beehives

loans.name: Suyen Damaris

texts.es: Es una mujer sociable, originaria de Puerto Cabezas, tiene 27 años de edad, casada, tiene 1 hijo de 3 años de edad. Desde hace aproximadamente 10 años habita en una pequeña casita de tambo de madera. Con el objetivo tener su vivienda de concreto, solicita financiamiento, para comprar materiales de construcción: cemento, bloque, hierro, zinc, clavos arena fina, arena gruesa y cubrir los costos de mano de obra. Su sueño es tener una vivienda segura que le brinde las condiciones necesarias.
texts.en: Suyen is a friendly woman and a native of Puerto Cabezas. She is 27 years old, married, and has a three-year old son. For approximately ten years she has lived in a small house made of wood. Now she wishes to have a concrete house so she is seeking a loan to buy construction materials: cement, cement blocks, steel rods, zinc sheeting, nails, fine sand, coarse sand, and hire laborers to do the work. Her dream is to have safe house in which to live a decent life.

loans.use: buy cement, cement blocks, steel rods, zinc sheeting, nails, fine sand, coarse sand, and hire laborers

loans.name: Alvaro Jose

texts.es: El Sr. Alvaro Jose trabaja para una escuela publica en el municipio desde hace 8 años como Vigilate, actualmente agradece a ceprodel por haberle facilitado este credito para realizar mejoras en su casa de habitacion con la compra de materiales para construccion como cemento,ladrillos y mano de obra
texts.en: Alvaro Jose has worked for eight years as a security guard in a public school in his municipality. He is grateful to CEPRODEL for having provided him this loan to make some repairs to his home. He will use the loan to buy construction materials such as cement and bricks and to pay for the labor.

loans.use: to buy construction materials such as cement and bricks and to pay for the labor to repair his home.

loans.name: Jiguiya Group

texts.fr:
Les cinq membres du groupe  JIGUIYA  sont  des femmes mariées avec une moyenne d’âge de 34 ans, et ont en moyenne 3 enfants. Elles vivent la plupart dans des familles traditionnelle à  FAMA  un des quartiers populaire de la ville de SIKASSO  3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles sont à leur quatrième prêt solidaire avec l’institution de micro finance Soro Yiriwaso afin de satisfaire le besoin de leur clientèle. Les prêts antérieurs ont été correctement remboursés.
Madame MAMOU  fait le commerce des  pagnes wax réal  dans ce groupe de femme JIGUIYA. Elle se tient à l’extrême gauche sur la photo.
 Elle compte acheter avec son prêt  8 pièces de pagne wax réal au grand marché d’où elle est beaucoup sollicitée de sa clientèle par la qualité de ses produits. 
Sa vente se fait en détail en espèce et à crédit à Fama  à une clientèle composée d’homme et de femme au comptant et à crédit. 
 Elle  envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 43 000 francs CFA dont une partie est  utilisée  pour payer le prêt et son interêt et l’autre pour son épargne.
.
texts.en:
The five members of the group  Jiguiya  are married women with an average age of 34 and have on average three children each. They mostly live in traditional families in Fama, one of the populous neighborhoods of the town of Sikasso, third administrative region of Mali. They are on their fourth solidarity loan with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso so as to satisfy the demand of their clientele. Their prior loans have been correctly reimbursed. 

Among the women of this Jiguiya group, Madame Mamou sells lengths of Réal brand African print cloth. She is on the far right in the photo. She intends to use her loan portion to buy eight lengths of cloth at the Grand Market; she is much sought-after by her clientele for the quality of her merchandise. She sells her goods by the piece, for cash or credit, in Fama to a clientele composed of men and women. She expects to make an average monthly profit of 43,000 CFA of which part will be used to repay the loan and interest and the rest put aside as savings.

loans.use: to buy lengths of Réal brand African print cloth (pagnes)

loans.name: Iris Ivette

texts.es: Iris tiene 28 años de edad y habita en casa propia junto a su esposo y sus dos hijos de 8 años y 4 años de edad. Iris es pequeña comerciante quien cuenta con con un negocio con variedad de productos artesanales como: almohadas decoradas, pequeñas tejas decoradas, adornos a base de foamy los cuales comercializa en su hogar de habitación y de forma ambulante. De esta forma se gana el sustento  y da a su familia mejores condiciones de vida. Iris desea ampliar y mejorar el negocio dado que desea mejorar sus ingresos y así dar mejores condiciones de vida a su familia. Por lo anterior solicita este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la compra de insumos como: foamy, pegamento, pintura, tejas, perforadores, etc. Espera poder contar con este crédito y de esta forma hacer la inversión que desea.
texts.en:
Iris is 28 years old, and lives in her own home with her husband and two children, who are 8 and 4 years old. Iris is the owner of a small business that sells a variety of arts and crafts items, such as decorative pillows, decorative tiles, and small adornments made from foam that she sells from her home and on the street. This business allows her to earn a living and provide her family with a better quality of life. 

Iris would like to expand and improve her business in order to improve her income and provide her family with better living conditions. Therefore, she is requesting this loan from FUSAI to invest in the purchase of supplies such as foam, glue, paint, tiles, hole punches, etc. She hopes that she will receive this loan and be able to make this investment.

loans.use: to buy foam, glue, paint, tiles, hole punches, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a new air-conditioner for the house.

loans.name: Marcelino

texts.es:
Marcelino es un joven emprendedor, tiene 21 años de edad, vive en Manantay junto a su esposa y su hijo.
Desde hace varios años trabaja como vigilante en una Entidad Financiera y le va muy bien porque es una persona muy responsable, trabajadora y porque su mayor motivación es su familia y quiere sacarlos adelante y brindarles un futuro mejor.
Marcelino está agradecido con los prestamistas Kiva porque con el apoyo que le han brindado él podrá comprar mercadería para la próxima apertura de su puesto de comida, para así obtener un ingreso adicional y mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Marcelino is a young entrepreneur. He is 21 years old, and lives in Manantay with his wife and son. For several years, he has been working as a security guard in a financial institution, and he is doing well since is a responsible and hardworking person. His family is his biggest motivation, and he wants to help them get ahead and provide them with a better future. 

Marcelino is grateful to Kiva lenders, as with the help they provide, he will be able to buy merchandise for the opening of his food stand in the near future, and this will allow him to obtain additional income and improve his quality of life.

loans.use: to buy merchandise to open a food stall.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy bundles of different cloth for the summer season.

loans.name: Shallot

texts.en:
Shallot is a very hard-working lady who lives in Buyanja, Rukungiri District. She is 39 years old and married with five children. Shallot is applying for a loan of UGX 1,000,000. She deals in agriculture in a very rural area. The purpose of this loan is to buy more agricultural inputs in the form of seeds. She has managed to pay tuition for her children and also has managed to develop her business tremendously.
Shallot is honest and hard-working but is limited by a lack of capital. Her dream is to turn her agricultural business into a modern farm. She hopes that with a further financial boost, her business and income will change for the better.
Pictured is Shallot with her husband Frank, who is supportive of her business ventures.

loans.use: To buy agricultural inputs

loans.name: Teodocia

texts.es:
La socia Teodocia pertenece al banco comunal VIRGEN DEL CARMEM, el banco está ubicado en el distrito de Maranura, provincia de La Convención y departamento de Cusco.
La socia tiene 53 años de edad es conviviente y tiene 02 hijos, la socia alterna sus actividades diarias dedicándose a la agricultura, la socia lleva buen tiempo con su negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando  a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de abono entre otros.
La socia se siente agradecida por el crédito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.
texts.en:
Teodocia is a member of the communal bank VIRGEN DEL CARMEN, located in the district of Maranura, province of La Convención, department of Cusco.
She is 53 years old, lives with her partner and has two children.  Part of Teodocia's day is her work at farming.  She has worked at this business a long time and it's going well for her thanks to the hard work she puts into it every day. 

Todocia wants to continue working in this way to help her family.  She is asking for a loan to purchase manure and other things.  She is grateful for the loan and promises to make her payments on time.

loans.use: to buy manure and other things

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy drinks to sell.

loans.name: Farhat

texts.en: Farhat is a 49-year-old married woman and the mother of seven. She is a hard-working mother who is helping her family by providing tailoring services in her community. She has been doing this for the past two years. She knows very well the techniques of stitching. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community.  She earns enough to lead a decent life. To help her continue operation of her business, she requested a loan of 30,000 PKR to buy  thread in different colors along with packs of zippers, buttons and laces to meet the increasing demand. In addition to repaying the loan, she will use part of the revenues to deal with personal expenses.

loans.use: to buy thread in different colors along with packs of zippers, buttons and laces.

loans.name: Eiler Yayo

texts.es:
Eiler vive en Lima junto a sus padres y hermana mayor, su padre es chofer de carga pesada y casi nunca lo ve, su madre es ama de casa y su hermana mayor acaba de titularse en enfermería, para lo cual tuvieron que solicitar prestamos bancarios para pagar y actualmente se encuentran muy endeudados, motivo por el cual Eiler tendría que dejar sus estudios para laborar a tiempo completo y ayudar en la economía familiar de no contar con el apoyo de los prestamistas de Kiva.
Eiler actualmente se encuentra realizando practicas pre-profesionales por su carrera en electricidad automotriz y lo poco que recibe lo destina para apoyar en su hogar, sin embargo esto ya no es suficiente.
El desea culminar sus estudios y poder trabajar en una buena empresa que le permita desarrollarse profesionalmente y a su vez ahorrar, ya que su sueño es tener su taller propio y dar trabajo a jóvenes como el que necesitan de apoyo. Es por todo esto que Eiler se encuentra muy feliz y agradece profundamente todo el apoyo que le brindan los prestamistas de Kiva.
texts.en:
Eiler lives in Lima with his parents and older sister. His father is a heavy duty truck driver and he rarely sees him, his mother is a housewife and his older sister just graduated from nursing. This is why they had to request bank loans and now they are finding themselves in a lot of debt. For this reason, Eiler would have to drop out of school to work full-time and help his family financially if he did not have the support of Kiva lenders.

Eiler is currently doing pre-employment practicals for his career as an automotive electrician and what little he makes, he gives to support the household, however this is not enough.

He hopes to finish school and be able to work at a good company that allows him to develop professionally and save money at the same time. Since his dream is to have his own repair shop and hire adolescents, like himself, who need support. Eiler feels very happy and greatly appreciates all the support the Kiva lenders are giving him.

loans.use: to pay for his technical studies in automotive electrical systems.

loans.name: Ana Rebeca

texts.es: Tiene 32 años de edad, es madre soltera de 2 adolescentes: el de 13 años estudia su  primer año de secundaria y el menor de 10 años cursa su quinto grado de primaria.  Con el objetivo de tener su propia fuente de ingreso, desde hace aproximadamente 8 años, estableció un pequeño negocio. Con las ganancias percibidas y créditos anteriores otorgados PANA PANA, le han permitido comprar madera para la reparación de su casa. Solicita financiamiento para concluir la mejora de su vivienda de tambo de madera. Su sueño es tener una vivienda segura que le brinde las condiciones necesarias.
texts.en:
Ana is 32 years old, and a single mother of two teenage boys: the 13-year old is in his first year of secondary school, and the 10-year old is in the fifth grade. Approximately 8 years ago, Ana started a small business with the goal of having her own source of income. With her earnings and previous loans given by PANA PANA, she has been able to buy wood to make repairs to her house. 

Ana is requesting a loan to finish up the improvements to her house, which is a wooden home on stilts. Her dream is to have a safe home that has the things she needs to live.

loans.use: to finish up the improvements to her wooden house on stilts.

loans.name: Musarat

texts.en:
Musarat is a 37-year-old married woman and a motivated mother of four children.

She has been doing business manufacturing footballs for the past 6 years. She makes balls in different sizes and sells them in her community and in the local market. She has become famous in her town for providing good quality footballs. She earns enough to cover the expenses of her family members. She contributes a lot to the family income as her husband’s income alone is not sufficient to fulfill the demands of the family. She is able to provide them with good quality food, education and clothing. 

For the improvement of her business, she has applied for a loan of 40,000 PKR. The amount will be used to purchase rubber bladders, leather covers and spools of thread in large quantity to cater to more customers without delay. She is hopeful of getting an increase in her sales, which ultimately will help in generating more cash. 

She is in her 5th loan cycle with good credit history.

loans.use: to purchase rubber bladders, leather covers and spools of thread in large quantity.

loans.name: Hameedan

texts.en: Hameedan is 43 years old and married. She has run a small general store in her community for many years. She offers a variety of grocery items at reasonable prices and has retained many customers who regularly shop at her store. She makes enough to provide for her family. To fully stock her store, she requested a loan of 40,000 PKR, which she will use to buy rice, sugar, and flour from the market at lower rates. This will help her to meet the increasing demand for these products. Hameedan wishes to utilize part of her revenues to increase her business capital.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, and flour for resale.

loans.name: Riaz

texts.en: Riaz is 43-year-old vigorous lady who has been stitching clothes for many years. She stitches for the people of her community and uses the income to support her entire family. However, due to a lack of funds, she is unable to meet the daily demands of her customers. For this reason, she requested a loan of 40,000 PKR from Kashf Foundation. She intends to use this loan to buy more spools of thread in different colors along with packs of laces, zippers and buttons. This will help create increased revenue so she may able to generate a healthier source of income. She is on her fourth loan and has a good credit history.

loans.use: to buy more spools of thread in different colors along with packs of laces, zippers and buttons.

loans.name: Gulzaran

texts.en: Gulzaran is a 54-year-old married woman who works as a tailor. She has been in this line of work for 10 years now and is proud to be contributing to her household income. Her family was going through a severe financial crisis that compelled her to use her stitching skills in a productive manner. Her husband had been the sole bread winner of the family. Gulzaran felt it obligatory to change her family’s living standard and started working from home. In time, she  retained many customers. Now, she has requested for a loan of 35,000 PKR to purchase more spools of thread, and packs of buttons and laces. In this way, she will be able to meet the increasing demand. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community.

loans.use: to purchase more spools of thread, and packs of buttons and laces.

loans.name: Iqbal

texts.en: Iqbal is a 57-year-old married woman. Two years ago, with the support of her husband, she started a business selling livestock to meet their household expenses. In time, she has become famous in her town for meeting the demands of her customers on time. She has applied for a loan of 35,000 PKR through Kashf Foundation. With this loan, she will be able to purchase more cattle. She wishes to spend part of her profits on providing a better standard of living for her family members.

loans.use: to purchase more cattle.

loans.name: Fatima

texts.en: Fatima, age 52, is a married woman who is in the business of selling livestock. She buys animals (baby goats and calves) at low prices, raises them, and then sells them in the market at a profit. She has been running this business for the past 10 years and earns a good amount of income to cover her household expenses. She needs to improve her business so she contacted Kashf Foundation and applied a loan of PKR 30,000 to purchase more livestock. She hopes to have a good experience with this new loan.

loans.use: to purchase more livestock.

loans.name: Dembagnouma Group

texts.fr:
Les quatre membres du groupe DEMBAGNOUMA  sont  des femmes mariées avec une moyenne d’âge de 33 ans, et ont en moyenne 2 enfants. Elles vivent la plupart dans des familles traditionnelle à  FAMA  un des quartiers populaire de la ville de SIKASSO  3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles sont à leur troisième prêt solidaire avec l’institution de micro finance Soro Yiriwaso afin de satisfaire le besoin de leur clientèle. Les prêts antérieurs ont été correctement remboursés.
Madame  ALIMATA  fait le commerce de fruit dans ce groupe de femme DEMBAGNOUMA. Elle se tient à l’extrême gauche sur la photo.
 Elle compte acheter avec son prêt un panier de fruit au grand marché où elle est beaucoup sollicitée de sa clientèle pour la qualité de ses produits. 
Sa vente se fait en détail en espèce et à crédit à Fama  à une clientèle composée d’homme et de femme au comptant et à crédit. 
 Elle  envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 30 000 francs CFA dont une partie est  utilisée  pour payer le prêt et son interêt et l’autre pour son épargne.
.
texts.en:
The four members of the DEMBAGNOUMA group are married women who average 33 years of age and two children each. Most of them live in traditional families in FAMA, a working-class district of the city of Sikasso, 3rd administrative region of Mali.

They are partnering with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso for the third time to meet the needs of their customers. Both past loans were correctly repaid.

Mrs. ALIMATA sells fruits. She is the member seen at the far left in the group photo. 

She plans to use her loan to buy a basket of fruits at the big market where she is in high demand due to the quality of her merchandise. She retails her stock in Fama, cash or credit, to a clientele consisting of both men and women. 

She expects to earn an average monthly profit of 30,000 francs CFA, part of which will be used to repay this loan and the interest while the remainder will bolster her savings.

loans.use: to buy fruits to sell.

loans.name: Jimmy

texts.en:
Jimmy is 31 years old. He lives in the town of Kalerwe in the Kampala East region of Uganda. He is married and has eight children, seven of whom attend school. For the past five years, Jimmy has been working hard to manage his boutique, which sells clothes. 

To help expand his business, Jimmy has requested a loan of 4,000,000 UGX from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy different types of clothes, and will help Jimmy to generate greater profits and pay school fees for his children. Jimmy hopes that in the future he will be able to buy another plot of land. 

Jimmy is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP). The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Jimmy who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy clothes for resale

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en: Joyce lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married with five children, two in school. She supports two additional family members. She operates a beauty salon and has been in business for the last seven years. She works six days a week. She has requested a loan of 1,000,000 UGX from MCDT – SACCO to buy braids, weaves, hair treatments, and relaxers. Her major business challenge includes seasonality and transportation. Her goal and aspiration is to build a fashion school. She lives in a rented house and the family has access to electricity but does not have access to piped water. Her major monthly expense includes school fess and rent.

loans.use: To buy weaves, braids, hair treatments, and relaxers.

loans.name: Mercyline

texts.en:
Mercyline is a 26-year-old lady from Kisumu city, which is located in the western part of Kenya. She is married to Domnick, who also provides income for the family. She has one child who is five years old and she supports three people in her family.

She operates a money transfer service in a shop where she also sells new clothes. She has applied for her third loan with VisionFund Kenya, which she will use to increase her working capital for money transfer services and to buy new clothes to sell. She will use the anticipated income to plow back into the business.

Her dream is to expand her business.

loans.use: to increase her working capital for money transfer services and to buy clothes to sell

loans.name: Irma Deysi

texts.es: Irma de 43 años de edad se dedica a la venta de tortillas en su casa desde hace varios años trabaja de lunes a domingo, tiene mucha clientela pues es una persona muy trabajadora y amable, con las ganancias que obtiene y la ayuda de su esposo logran solventar los gastos de us hogar. vive en casa propia con sus dos hijos y su esposo. Irma solicita un credito para comprar maíz por quintales para seguir elaborando las tortillas y asi obtener mejores ganancias para tener una mejor estabilidad economica con su familia.
texts.en:
Irma, 43, has been earning a living by selling tortillas from her home for several years. She works from Monday to Sunday. She has many customers as she is a hard-working and friendly person. With her earnings and her husband's income, the couple is able to cover their household expenses. Irma lives in her own home with her two children and her husband. 

Irma is requesting a loan to buy corn in bulk in order to continue making tortillas, which will allow her to increase her earnings and provide her family with greater financial stability.

loans.use: to buy corn in bulk.

loans.name: Vicentina

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “VIRGEN DEL CARMEN”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Maranura, perteneciente a la provincia de La Convencion y departamento de Cusco.

La socia Vicentina  se dedica al negocio de agricultura, ella tiene un terreno donde cultiva cacao y café, la socia trabaja desde las 6:00 a.m hasta las 5:00 p.m,la socia ya tiene varios años en este negocio y le va muy bien, el sueño de la socia es ampliar su terreno de cultivo. La socia solicita le crédito para comprar semillas y fertilizantes.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
The partner belongs to the Virgen del Carmen communal bank. The bank is located in the Maranura district, which belongs to the La Convencion province and the Cusco department. 

The partner Vicentina works in the business of agriculture. She has land where she farms cocoa and coffee. The partner works from 6am to 5pm, and she has been in this business for several years now. And she is doing very well. 

The partner's dream is to extend her crop land. The partner requests the loan to buy seeds and fertilizer. The partner is happy with the loan and promises to comply with her loan payments.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizer.

loans.name: Celso

texts.es:
El socio Celso pertenece al banco comunal VIRGEN DEL CARMEM, el banco está ubicado en el distrito de Maranura, provincia de La Convención y departamento de Cusco.

El socio tiene 38 años de edad y es soltero, él socio alterna sus actividades diarias trabajando en construcción civil, el socio lleva buen tiempo con su negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su trabajo, el socio trabaja en las distintas obras que solicitan sus servicios, él socio desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir adelante.

El socio solicita el crédito para la compra de herramientas como martillo entre otros.

El socio se siente agradecida por el crédito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.
texts.en:
The member named Celso belongs to the communal bank "Virgen del Carmen", which is located in the Maranura district, in the province of La Convención and the department of Cusco.

This member is 38 years old and he is single. He alternates jobs each day working in civil construction. The business he has had for some time now is going well for him thanks to his determination every day at work. He works at distinct sites that request his services, and he hopes to be able to continue working so he can get ahead in life. 

This member is requesting the loan to buy tools such as a hammer and other things.

He is thankful for the loan that he was given and he promises to make the scheduled payments.

loans.use: to buy tools such as a hammer and other things.

loans.name: Exilda Veronica

texts.es:
Exilda es una joven trabajadora, tiene 22 años de edad y vive en el Dsitrito de Chepen junto a su familia. Desde hace más de 2 años trabaja en una cadena de farmacias en la ciudad donde reside, le va muy bien porque es una persona con muchas ganas de salir adelante, muy colaboradora, dedicada a su labor. Su mayor motivación en esta vida es su familia es por ellos que está luchando para poder brindarles un futuro mejor.
Exilda está agradecida con los prestamistas Kiva porque con el apoyo que le han brindado podrá comprar un televisor y un equipo de sonido para su casa, de esta manera mejorará su nivel de vida y su familia se sentirá más cómoda y contenta.
texts.en:
Exilda is a hard-working young woman. She is 22 years old and she lives in the Chepen district with her family. For more than two years she has worked in a series of pharmacies in the city where she lives. 

Things are going well for her because she is the type of person who wants to be successful. She is diligent, and dedicated to her work. Her biggest motivation in life is her family. It is because of them that she is working hard to be able to give them a better future.

Exilda is grateful for the Kiva lenders, because with the support they have given her, she will be able to buy a television and sound equipment for her home. This will improve her standard of living and her family will feel happier and more comfortable.

loans.use: to buy electrical appliances (television and sound equipment).

loans.name: Moonyeen

texts.en:
Moonyeen is 28 years old and married with two children.

She earns a living by raising ducks in the Philippines. Moonyeen is borrowing PHP 7,000 through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her ducks.

Moonyeen has been raising ducks for three years and also earns additional income from fish vending.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream of saving enough money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her ducks.

loans.name: Febe

texts.en:
Febe is 31 years old and married, with two children who are both in school. She works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 19,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy more groceries to sell. She has been in this business for two years and sells a variety of items such as soap, snack foods, and other groceries. 

In the future, Febe would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Deborah Group

texts.fr: Madame Muhigirwa  est présidente du groupe de credit Deborah.  Mariée  à un Pasteur de la place, elle est âgée de 55 ans et mère de 10 enfants  dont  tous  scolarisés.  Vendeuse depuis 1994 au marché central de la ville, elle sollicite ce nouveau prêt pour acheter  3 sacs de 20kg de clous. Son objectif est de rehabiliter sa maison et toujours payer  les frais scolaires de ses enfants. Enfin, elle remercie Hekima  pour son soutien.
texts.en: Ms. Muhigirwa is the president of the loan group “Deborah”. She is 55 years old, married to a local pastor, and is the mother of ten children, all provided with schooling. A vendor since 1994 at the town’s central market, she is requesting this new loan to purchase three 20-kg bags of nails. Her goal is to renovate her home and continue to cover her children’s schooling costs. In conclusion, she thanks Hekima for its support.

loans.use: to purchase three 20-kg bags of nails

loans.name: Irene

texts.en:
The challenge of addressing labour constraints among smallholder farmers has become even more urgent in Kenya. Among the barriers facing smallholder farmers is a low level of awareness of the importance of improved agricultural tools.  

One of the farmers using traditional tools is Irene. Irene is a mother of three who resides on a small piece of land in Nandi Hills location. For seven years, she has kept dairy cattle and poultry. During this period, she has also been growing maize, tea, and vegetables. The produce from her mixed farm, including milk, eggs, tea, maize grains, and greens, is sold in the local market. She stated that she enjoys harvesting maize. However, she said weeding was her biggest challenge. 

Irene is seeking a loan from Kiva lenders via Juhudi Kilimo to purchase modern farm implements that will significantly reduce labour-intensive workloads. With your funding, Irene will quit the use of poorly manufactured tools and adapt improved tools and implements that ease the labour-intensive tasks. 

Proceeds from this new adaptation will be channelled to satisfying her family's needs.

loans.use: to purchase farm implements

loans.name: Rhuyubake Group

texts.fr: La cliente Tabiya, présidente du groupe Ruyubake  est  âgée de 39 ans, mariée à un homme sans profession  et mère de 8 enfants tous scolarisés. Expérimentée dans  la  vente des divers produits vivriers  il ya 22 ans; elle sollicite ce nouveau prêt pour acheter  100kg de haricots, 50kg de riz et 100kg de pomme de terre. Son vouloir est  d’acheter une parcelle. Au finish, elle remercie Hekima  de soutenir les femmes exclues du système bancaire classique.
texts.en: This client, Tabiya, is the president of the group Ruyubake. She is 39 years old, married to a man without a trade, and is the mother of eight children, all provided with education. Experienced at selling a diversity of staple foods for 22 years, she is requesting a new loan to purchase 100 kg of beans, 50 kg of rice, and 100 kg of potatoes. Her wish is to purchase a parcel of land. In conclusions, she thanks Hekima for supporting women excluded from the traditional banking system.

loans.use: to purchase beans, rice, and potatoes

loans.name: Amka Group

texts.fr: Madame Nankafu, présidente  du groupe de credit  Amka  est âgée de 46 ans, mariée à un chômeur et mère de 7 enfants qui vont tous à l’école. Femme forte et ambitieuse, elle sollicite ce nouveau credit pour acheter les matières  pour la fabrication des savons (acide à soude caustique, les misses, etc.). Son rêve est de réhabiliter sa maison et agrandir son entreprise. Ainsi, elle remercie Hekima pour lui avoir donné un coup de main.
texts.en: Ms. Nankafu, the president of the loan group “Amka” is 46 years old, married to an unemployed man, and is the mother of seven children, who all go to school. A strong ambitious woman, she is requesting a new loan to purchase the ingredients for making soaps (such as caustic soda). Her dream is to renovate her house and expand her enterprise. Thus, she thanks Hekima for having lent a hand.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients for making soaps

loans.name: Maendeleo Group

texts.fr: Madame Cibalonza, occupe la fonction de présidente au sein du groupe de credit Maendeleo. Agée de 36 ans, est mère de 3 enfants  qui  vont à l’école et mariée à un homme sans travail. Commerçante depuis 1998,  elle sollicite un nouveau prêt pour acheter 4 ballots de souliers usagés. Son objectif  est d’acheter une parcelle pour sa famille.  Pour cela, elle remercie Hekima pour avoir soutenu  les  femmes à faible revenu.
texts.en: Ms. Cibalonza fills the office of president in her loan group “Maendeleo”. She is 36 years old, a mother of three children in school, and married to a man who is unemployed. A merchant since 1998, she is requesting a new loan to purchase 4 bales of used shoes. Her goal is to purchase a parcel of land for her family. So she thanks Hekima for supporting low-income women.

loans.use: to purchase 4 bales of used shoes

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy pig-feet, rice, fish, and chicken-feet.

loans.name: Asia

texts.en:
Asia is a 39-year-old married woman. 

She has been successfully running a small general store with her husband at the corner of her house. She has 5 years of experience in this field. Her husband also assists her by purchasing stock of goods from the market, as he has built up many contacts over the years.

She wants to grow her business so she has requested a loan of PKR 40,000 to buy packs of salt, biscuits and beverages to meet with the increasing demand at her store. She is expecting a boost in her earnings and dreams of expanding her business in the future.

She is the mother of five children and is motivated to provide her family with good quality food, clothing and health.

loans.use: to buy packs of salt, biscuits and beverages.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a power generator for the house to get good light.

loans.name: Ivania De Las Nieves

texts.es: Es madre soltera de un hijo de 18 años de edad que cursa su cuarto año de secundaria, tiene 35 años de edad. Cuenta con una experiencia de más de 2 décadas como cocinera, trabaja en el hospital del municipio de Puerto Cabezas. Habita en una vivienda pequeña de tambo de madera. Solicita  financiamiento, para ampliar poco a poco su vivienda, comprar materiales de construcción: madera, clavos y para cubrir costos de mano de obra. Su sueño es terminar con la construcción de su vivienda y tener una casa segura con las condiciones necesarias.
texts.en:
She is a single mother to an 18-year-old son who is in his fourth year of secondary school. She is 35 years old. She has more than 2 decades of experience as a cook. She works in the Puerto Cabezas municipal hospital.

She lives in a small wooden-stilt home. She requests financing to expand her home little by little, to buy construction materials (wood, nails), and to cover labor costs.

Her dream is to finish construction on her home and have a safe house with the necessary conditions.

loans.use: to expand her home little by little.

loans.name: Ramzan

texts.en: Ramzan, age 43, is a married woman and mother of four.  She deals in the business of selling livestock. She buys animals (baby goats and calves) at low prices, raises them, and then sells them in the market for a profit. Ramzan earns a good income to cover her household expenses. She needs to improve her business so she contacted Kashf Foundation and applied a loan of PKR 45,000 to purchase more livestock. She is very experienced and has good contacts in the market. With this loan, she will definitely expand her business and income level. She is on her eighth loan and has established a good credit history.

loans.use: to purchase more livestock.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase building supplies.

loans.name: Mary Luz

texts.es:
Mary es una joven emprendedora, tiene 26 años de edad y vive en Yarinacocha junto a su familia.
Desde hace más de 1 años trabaja en la Municipalidad de la zona donde vive en el área de limpieza y jardines, le va muy bien porque es muy ersponsable, dedicada a su trabajo, respetuosa, amable y porque tiene muchas ganas de salir adelante .
Su mayor motivación es su familia, por ello lucha incansablemente para poder mejorar su calidad de vida.
Mary está agradecida con los prestamistas Kiva porque con su poyo ella podrá comprar algunos muebles para su hogar como un juego de comedor, cama y colchón para ella y su hijo, también una nueva cocina para mayor seguridad, de esta manera podrá elevar su nivel de vida y vivir más cómoda.
texts.en:
Mary, 26, is an enterprising young woman.  She lives in Yarinacocha with her family.

She has worked for a year for the town in the area where she lives.  She does cleaning and gardening.  It's going very well for her because she's very responsible, devoted to her job, respectful, and friendly, and because she wants to get ahead.

Her greatest motivation is her family, so she strives tirelessly to be able to improve their quality of life.

Mary's grateful to the Kiva lenders because with their help she'll be able to buy some furniture for her home, such as a dining room set, a bed and mattress for herself and her son, and a new stove for better safety.  That way she'll be able to raise her standard of living and live more comfortably.

loans.use: to buy a stove, dining room set, bed, and mattress

loans.name: Martha

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “VIRGEN DEL CARMEN”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Maranura, perteneciente a la provincia de La Convencion y departamento de Cusco.

La socia Martha se dedica al negocio de venta de ropa, la socia vende pantalones, blusas y polos, la socia ya tiene varios años en este negocio y le va muy bien, el sueño de la socia es tener un bazar. La socia solicita le crédito para comprar zapatos, polos, chompas, polos y blusas.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Martha belongs to the communal bank "VIRGEN DEL CARMEN", which is located in Maranura District, in La Convención Province in the department of Cusco. She has worked for several years selling clothing, including pants, blouses and T-shirts. Her business is going well for her, and she dreams of having her own store.

Martha is requesting this loan to buy shoes, T-shirts, sweaters and blouses. She is happy for the loan and promises to make her loan payments.

loans.use: to buy shoes, T-shirts, sweaters and blouses.

loans.name: Elena

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “VIRGEN DEL CARMEN”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Maranura, perteneciente a la provincia de La Convencion y departamento de Cusco.

La socia Elena se dedica al negocio de venta de ropa, la socia vende pantalones, blusas y polos, la socia ya tiene varios años en este negocio y le va muy bien, el sueño de la socia es ampliar el negocio de venta de ropa. La socia solicita le crédito para comprar zapatos, polos, chompas, polos y blusas.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
The partner belongs to the Virgen del Carmen communal bank. The bank is located in the Maranura district, which is in the La Convencion province and the Cusco department. 

The partner Elena works in the clothing sales business. The partner sells pants, blouses, and t-shirts. The partner has been in this business for several years now and she is doing very well. 

This partner's dream is to expand the clothing sales business. The partner requests the loan to buy shoes, t-shirts, sweaters, t-shirts, and blouses. 

The partner is happy with the loan and promises to comply with her loan payments.

loans.use: to buy shoes, t-shirts, sweaters, t-shirts, and blouses.

loans.name: Carmen

texts.es:
La socia Carmen pertenece al banco comunal VIRGEN DEL CARMEM, el banco está ubicado en el distrito de Maranura, provincia de La Convención y departamento de Cusco.
La socia tiene 64 años de edad es viuda y tiene 06 hijos, la socia alterna sus actividades diarias dedicándose a la agricultura, la socia lleva buen tiempo con su negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando  a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de abono y fertilizantes.
La socia se siente agradecida por el crédito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.
texts.en:
Carmen belongs to the Virgen Del Carmen communal bank.  The bank is located in the Maranura district in the La Convención province, Cusco department.

Carmen, age 64, is a widow and has six children.  She alternates her daily activities with her agricultural work.  She has been in her business for a good amount of time.  It is going well for her thanks to the effort that she puts into her business every day.  She wishes to be able to continue working in order to continue helping her family in this way.

She is requesting the loan to buy compost and fertilizers.  She is grateful for the loan that was provided, and she pledges to make her payments according to the established time frame.

loans.use: to buy compost and fertilizers.

loans.name: Gloria Raquel

texts.es: Gloria tiene 27 años de edad y habita en casa propia junto a su esposo, su hija de 7 años y su hijo de un año de edad. Gloria se dedica a la venta de ropa desde hace 7 años. Este negocio es muy importante dado que con los ingresos del esposo no logra cubrir los gastos del hogar. Gloria solicita este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la compra de variedad de prendas de vestir como: faldas, ropa interior, blusas, pantalones, etc. para el negocio y así poder mejorar sus ventas y sus ingresos.
texts.en:
Gloria is 27 years old and lives in her own home with her husband, her 7-year-old daughter, and her one-year-old son. Gloria has worked in clothing sales for 7 years. This business is very important because she is not able to cover household expenses with her husband's income.

Gloria requests this loan from FUSAI in order to invest in the purchase of a variety of pieces of clothing for the business, like skirts, undergarments, blouses, pants, etc. And in this way she will be able to improve her sales and her income.

loans.use: to buy skirts, undergarments, blouses, pants, etc.

loans.name: Jose Alberto

texts.es:
Jose es un joven trabajador, tiene 53 años de edad y vive en Yarinacocha junto a su familia.

Desde hace más de 1 año trabaja en la Municipalidad de la zona donde vive, le va muy bien porque es una persona con muchas ganas de salir adelante y siempre le pone entusiasmo y empeño a todo lo que hace.
Su mayor motivación es su familia, es por eso que lucha constantemente para poder mejorar su calidad de vida.

Jose está agradecido con los prestamistas kiva porque con el apoyo que le han brindado él podrá hacer algunos arreglos a su domicilio como pintar las paredes, arreglar el techo y el piso, de esta manera su familia sentirá mayor comodidad y mejorarán su calidad de vida, así seguirá luchando para más adelante poder cumplir su más grande sueño: “Tener su propio negocio”
texts.en:
Jose is a young worker. He is 53 years old and lives in Yarinacocha with his family. He has been working for more than a year in the municipality where he lives. It’s going very well because he is a person who has a drive to get ahead and he always puts effort and enthusiasm into everything he does. His biggest motivation is his family and that is why he constantly strives to improve his quality of life.

Jose is grateful to Kiva lenders because with their help he is able to make some repairs to his house such as paint the walls, and fix the roof and floors so his family can feel more comfortable and improve their quality of life. He will continue striving to get ahead and fulfill his biggest dream: “To have his own business.”

loans.use: to renovate his house (pain the walls, and fix the roof and floors).

loans.name: Fikiri Group

texts.fr: Madame Manyumba  occupe le poste de presidente dans le groupe de credit Fikiri. Agée de 52 ans, mariée à un homme sans travail ;  est mère de 6 enfants tous scolarisés. Elle est vendeuse des poissons depuis 1989 au marché central de la ville. Elle sollicite ce credit pour acheter 70 poissons salés qu’elle revendra. Son objectif est  de scolariser ses enfants, garantir leur alimentation et agrandir son entreprise. Ainsi, elle remercie Hekima pour le soutien qu’elle apporte aux femmes.
texts.en: Ms. Manyumba fills the position of president in the loan group “Fikiri”. She is 52 years old, married to a man without employment, and is the mother of six children, who are all provide with schooling. She has been a fish vendor since 1989 at the city’s central market. She is requesting this loan to purchase 70 salted fish, which she will resell. Her goal is to provide education to her children, guarantee they are fed, and expand her enterprise. Thus, she thanks Hekima for the support it provides to women.

loans.use: to purchase 70 salted fish

loans.name: Confiance Group

texts.fr: Madame  Riziki  est  membre du groupe de credit  Confiance. Elle est âgée de 50 ans, mariée à un homme sans emploi  et  ensemble ils  ont  9 enfants  qui étudient  tous. Le nouveau  prêt sollicité va acheter  10 bidons de lait, 15 casiers de fanta et 2 cartons de pain pour la cafétéria.  Elle souhaite agrandir son entreprise, couvrir les frais scolaires de ses enfants et bien les nourrir. Ainsi, elle remercie et encourage Hekima dans son initiative de booster les activités commerciales des femmes à faible revenu.
texts.en: Ms. Riziki is a member of the loan group Confiance. She is 50 years old and married to an unemployed man. Together they have nine children, who are all students. The new loan she is requesting will go toward purchasing 10 containers of milk, 15 cases of Fanta, and 2 boxes of bread for her cafeteria. She would like to expand her enterprise, cover her children’s schooling costs, and keep her children well-fed. Thus, she thanks Hekima and encourages it in its initiative to boost the businesses of low-income women.

loans.use: to purchase milk, Fanta, and bread for her cafeteria

loans.name: Gilrose

texts.en:
Gilrose is 44 years old, married with three children who are all in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Gilrose has a general store business in the Philippines. Gilrose requested a PHP 12000 loan amount through NWTF in order to purchase more items like sardines, snack foods, noodles and other groceries.

Gilrose has been in this business for 15 years. In the future, Gilrose would like to build and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more items like sardines, snack foods, noodles and other groceries.

loans.name: Mama Utuliye Group

texts.fr: Madame Chiruza  est  présidente dans l’association de credit Mama Utuliye. Femme expérimentée dans la vente du Yaourt depuis 1989 ; est mariée à un homme sans profession. Elle sollicite un credit pour l’achat de 10 bidons de 20litres de Yaourt. La mévente est le seul obstacle que rencontre son activité. Son souci est d’assurer une bonne alimentation à ses enfants et couvrir en permanence les frais d’étude. Ainsi, elle remercie Hekima.
texts.en: Ms. Chiruza is the president of the loan association “Mama Utuliye”. A woman experienced in selling yogurt since 1989, she is married to a man without a trade. She is requesting a loan to purchase ten 20-liter containers of yogurt. The only obstacle she encounters in her business is a drop in sales. Her concern is to ensure her children are well-fed and to continue to cover their schooling costs. Thus, she thanks Hekima.

loans.use: to purchase ten 20-liter containers of yogurt

loans.name: Karorero Group

texts.fr:
Daniel  fait partie du groupe Karorero et  habite à Gitega. Il a  57 ans et est marié  à  Paul,  un  commerçant. Ensemble ils ont 8 enfants âgés de 17 à 33 ans.

Il  fait le commerce des chèvres  depuis  21 ans. 

Il  est à son cinquième  crédit à Turame. Avec le crédit KIVA qu’il obtient, il  va  augmenter son capital et acheter beaucoup de chèvres  à revendre, pour gagner plus.
texts.en:
Daniel is part of the group Karorero and lives in Gitega. She is 57 years old and married to Paul, a merchant. Together they have eight children, from 17 to 33 years old.  

She has been doing commerce in goats for 21 years. 

She is on her fifth Turame loan. With the KIVA loan she is obtaining, she is going to increase her capital and purchase many goats to resell, so as to earn more.

loans.use: to purchase many goats to resell, so as to earn more

loans.name: Tusikilizane Group

texts.fr: Madame Vumilia est membre de l’association de crédit Tusikilizane. Mariée à un homme d’affaire, elle est  mère de 11 enfants qui vont tous à l’école. Elle effectue les activités de commerce depuis 1995. Agée de 55ans, elle sollicite un crédit pour acheter  60 poissons frais. Elle projette réhabiliter sa maison  et assurer la scolarité de ses enfants. Au final, elle rend grâce à Dieu et bénie Hekima de soutenir les femmes  à bas revenu.
texts.en:
Mrs. Vumilia, age 55, is a member of the group Tusikilizane. She is married to a businessman and a mother to 11 children who all go to school. 

Mrs. Vumilia has been conducting commercial activities since 1995. She is seeking a loan to buy 60 fresh fish. Her plans are to renovate her home and to support her children’s education. 

She thanks God and blesses Hekima for helping low-income women.

loans.use: to buy 60 fresh fish.

loans.name: Luzmila

texts.es:
Luzmila es una mujer de mil batallas vividas, esta veterana de 59 años tiene el coraje y valor de levantarse todos los días en busca de un sustento diario para su nieto.
Ella se dedica a la venta de pasteles, empanadas y fritos, tiene su negocio ubicado al frente de la cárcel de Bello, Antioquia; pero últimamente ha visto su negocio muy afectado por la restricción que tienen sobre los visitantes de la cárcel.
Ella desea darle una orientación nueva al negocio surtiéndolo con mekatos, gaseosas, helados y otros alimentos; de este modo podrá atraer otro tipo de clientes y aumentara sus ventas significativamente.
A pesar de las dificultades, esta mujer trabajadora a podido sortear cada una de ella h nunca le ha fallado a su nieto, un joven menor de edad que tiene a su cargo porque su madre falleció hace algunos meses.
Su principal dificultad es el golpe económico tan fuerte que ha recibido pero tiene plena fe en entidades como esta para obtener los recursos necesarios y así volver a revivir su negocio con éxito.
Su mayor sueño es brindarle bienestar y buena educación a su nieto y mejorar su propio estilo de vida a través de su trabajo.
texts.en:
Luzmila is a woman who has fought a thousand battles throughout her life. This 59 year old veteran has the courage and valor to get up every day in search of daily sustenance for her grandson. 

She makes a living selling pastries, empanadas and fries. Her business is located in front of the jail of Bello, Antioquia. Lately she has seen her business very affected by the restrictions on visitors to the jail. 

She wants to give her business a new direction restocking it with Mekatos, soft drinks, ice cream and other foods. In this way she will be able to attract another type of customer and significantly increase her sales. 

In spite of difficulties this hard working woman has been able to sort through each one and has never failed her grandson. She has had this under age youth under her care since his mother passed away a few months ago. 

Her main difficulty is the very powerful financial blow she has received. However, she has complete faith in entities such as this one to obtain the necessary resources and to successfully revive her business. 

Her biggest dream is to provide for her grandsons well being and a good education and to improve her own standard of living through her work.

loans.use: to restock Mekatos, soft drinks, ice cream and other foods for her business.

loans.name: Mishi

texts.en:
Mishi is married and has three school going children. She lives in her own house that has neither electricity nor piped water.

She has operated a coconut selling business for the past three years, selling from home to her neighbours and passersby.

With the loan she is requesting she wants to purchase two sacks of coconuts for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase two sacks of coconuts for resale

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma is a married woman with three school going children. She lives in a rental house that has electricity, but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are school fees and food.

For the past year she has operated a business of selling leso ( women's wrap) cloth. She dreams of expanding to become a big supplier of clothes in the future.

With the loan, she wants to purchase 40 pieces of Leso’s ( women wrap)  for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase 40 pieces of Leso’s ( women wrap)  for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more palm oil

loans.name: Gulniso

texts.en:
Gulniso is the careful mother of three children. Her children are Malohat, Aziza, and Shukrona. Gulniso is 29 years old. She is divorced. 

She sews national women's dresses. She has her own workshop where she serves her clients. Gulniso has been busy with this business more than 12 years. She is going to increase her working capital. Gulniso is asking for a loan of 2,500 TJS to buy two sewing machines. She awaits your support.

loans.use: To buy sewing machines for increasing working capital

loans.name: Lilian Del Rocio

texts.es:
En el sitio la pila del cantón Montecristi se reúne cada quince días el Grupo De Crédito  Para el Futuro De la Mujer. Este lugar es muy conocido en la provincia y en el país por su rica cultura tradicional, aquí se puede encontrar una gran variedad de  artesanía que son elaboradas por sus habitantes siguiendo las costumbres tradicionales.
En este lugar vive la señora Lilian, tiene 47 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen dos hijos todos mayores de edad, uno de ellos aun vive en su casa. Su esposo es comerciante.
Doña Lilian es una mujer que le gusta trabajar, ella  se dedica a la compra y venta de  de adornos y cerámicas,  tiene un  local en la vía principal lugar por donde pasan muchas personas y por lo general pasan comprando algo todos los días, allí vende todo tipo de artesanía, trabaja todos los días desde las 8h00 hasta las 17h00. Lleva más de 20 años que se dedica a esta actividad y  le ha ido muy bien. Sus productos los compran a artesanos de la zona pero semi terminados y luego ella les da el acabado necesario para que estén listos para la venta.
Este crédito es para comprar artesanía de todas las formas y modelos  y pinturas para darles un buen acabado a sus obras. Lleva más de 6 años en el Grupo De Crédito  y le gusta porque los créditos son muy necesarios para ella. Sus sueños son seguir adelante.
texts.en: Every fifteen days, the  credit group "el Futuro de la Mujer" meets in La Pila in the Montecristi canton. This location is well-known in the province and in the country for its rich cultural tradition. Here one can find a large variety of handicrafts that are made by the locals following traditional customs. This is where Lilian lives, who is 47 years old and married, and has two adult children from that relationship, one of whom lives at home. Her husband is a businessman, Lilian is a woman who like to work and she works in the purchase and sale of decorations and pottery. She has a shop on the main street where many people pass by, and generally, they buy something every day. There she sells all types of handicrafts, and she works every day from 8 to 5. She has more than 20 years doing this work, and it's gone very well for her. Her products are bought semi finished from the artisan, and then she does the necessary finishing touches so they're ready to sell. This loan is to purchase handicrafts in all forms and kinds, and paints to give her work a good finish. She has been in the Grupo de Credito for more than 6 years, and she likes it because the loan are very necessary for her. Her dreams are to continue forward.

loans.use: to buy handicrafts and paints.

loans.name: Bertha

texts.es:
Bertha tiene 53 años de edad, vive en casa de material rustico, es madre soltera cuenta con tres hijos de 22, 21, 17 años de edad, vive en el distrito de Pucará, su población se dedica a la agricultura, especialmente al cultivo de frutales, café y arroz, comercio y ganadería, ubicada en la Provincia de Jaén que pertenece a la Región Cajamarca, sierra norte del Perú.

El se dedica a la venta de refrescos, raspadillas entre otros, desde hace 10 años de experiencia en el rubro, cuenta con clientela de la zona y los transportistas de zonas aledañas, ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 1 500 nuevos soles para la compra de bebidas gaseosas y arreglos a local, con ello le generara mayores ingresos y así poder mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Bertha, 53, lives in a house made of rudimentary materials.  She is a single mother with 3 children aged 22, 21, and 17.  She lives in the Pucara district.  Here the residents are engaged in farming (especially fruits, coffee and rice), commerce and animal husbandry.  This place is in Jaen province, in the Cajamarca region of the northern highlands of Peru.

Bertha has a business selling drinks, shaved ice, and other items.  She has 10 years of experience in this line of work.  Her customers are from the neighborhood, and she also takes her products to sell in the surrounding areas.  She has requested a loan from Edpyme Alternativa for 1,500 Peruvian soles to buy soft drinks and to fix up her shop.  This way, she can generate more income and thereby improve her quality of life.

loans.use: to buy soft drinks and fix up her shop

loans.name: Juana Mercedes

texts.es:
El Grupo De Crédito San Andrés se reúne cada quince días en la parroquia Picoaza de la ciudad de Portoviejo. Lugar conocido por ser una zona muy comercial, por sus fiestas tradicionales de San Pedro y San Pablo y por la alegría de su gente.
En este lugar vive la señora Juana, tiene 58 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene 5 hijos mayores de edad, una de ellos aun vive en su casa. El marido es agricultor.
