Doña Juana es una mujer que le gusta trabajar y con su esfuerzo salir adelante, ella tiene una tienda de víveres en su casa, allí vende todo tipo de productos como arroz, azúcar, aceites, detergentes, legumbres, verduras, frutas,  artículos de bazar entre otras cosas, a ella le gusta tener su tienda bien surtida y así brindarles la mejor atención a sus clientes que siempre le compran ya que allí ellos encuentran todo lo que necesitan, trabaja todos los días desde las 6h00 hasta las 20h00 y a veces hasta más tarde, su  marido le ayuda cuando él puede,  tiene más de 15 años su tienda con la cual sale adelante.
Este crédito lo va a emplear en surtir mas su tienda, va a comprar arroz, azúcar, aceite, entre otros productos de primera necesidad y artículos de bazar. Está en el Grupo De Crédito desde el inicio y le gusta por la ayuda que les brinda la institución. Sus sueños son aumentar su tienda.
texts.en:
The San Andrés communal bank meets every fifteen days in Picoaza parish in the city of Portoviejo. This is a place known for having lots of commerce, for its traditional San Pedro and San Pablo festivals, and for the cheerfulness of its people. 

This is also the home of Juana, who is 58 years old. She has a common-law husband, with whom she has 5 adult children, one of whom still lives in her home. Her husband is a farmer. 
 
Juana is a woman who likes to work and get ahead through her own efforts. She has a grocery store in her home where she sells all types of products, such as rice, sugar, oils, detergents, beans, vegetables, fruits, and general store items, among other things. She likes to have her store well-stocked and thus provide better service to her customers. They always buy from her because they find everything they need in her store. She works every day from 6 a.m. to 8 p.m., and sometimes even later. Her husband helps her when he can. She has operated her store for more than 15 years, and it has helped her get ahead. 

She will use the funds from this loan to stock her store with more products. She will buy rice, sugar, and oil, among other staple foods, and also general store items. She has been in the communal bank from the beginning, and she likes it because of the help provided to the members by the institution. Her dream is to expand her store.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, other staple foods and general store items to sell.

loans.name: Charlene Marie

texts.en:
Charlene Marie is 29 years old and married, with one child who is in school. Charlene Marie works very hard to provide for them.

Charlene Marie runs a general store in the Philippines and she has requested a PHP 7,000 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) in order to purchase more goods to sell in her store.

Charlene Marie has been in this business for two years and she sells a variety of items, such as noodles, snack foods, spices, and other groceries. 

In the future, she would like to build and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more goods to sell in her store.

loans.name: Tusimame Imara Group

texts.fr: La cliente Mwayuma  femme à grande vision, est  présidente de l’association d’affaire Tusimame Imara.  Mère de 3 enfants qui n’ont pas encore atteint l’âge de scolarité,  elle est mariée à un homme sans travail. Vendeuse au marché public depuis 2006, elle sollicite ce nouveau credit pour acheter 1 ballot  de friperie. Son objectif  est de devenir une grande commerçante. Ainsi, elle remercie Hekima de tout cœur.
texts.en: This client, Mwayuma, is a woman with a grand vision. She is the president of the business association “Tusimame Imara”. A mother of three children, who are not yet school-aged, she is married to a man without employment. A vendor at the public market since 2006, she is requesting this new loan to purchase a bale of secondhand clothing. Her goal is to become a major merchant. So, she thanks Hekima with all her heart.

loans.use: to purchase a bale of used clothing

loans.name: Yadira Del Carmen

texts.es: Yadira desde hace 30 años tiene experiencia en elaborar alimetos , pues fue empleada de un negocio donde preparaban y vendian hayacas y pasteles y los propietarios de esta empresa la impulsaron a que fuera independiente. Fue así como nació su emprendimiento y hoy no ha cesado. Sus clientes hacen los pedidos y ella los vende de contado directamente sin intermediarios. Para ello cocina, maíz, pollo y cerdo e inicia la molienda y sasona todos los ingredientes, se envuelven en hoja de bijao y se amarran para auqmentar el buen sabor a las verduras mezclados con los cárnicos. Su negocio lo realiza en compañia de su sobrina y tiene 2 colaboradoras que son muy buen apoyo. Sus pasteles y hayacas son vendidos al pormayor y al detal, semanalmente en un número de 2000. Yadira todos los sabados, domingos y feriados desde las 3 de la mañana hasta las 11 prepara sus pasteles, para que finalmente lleguen a ser consumidos por la familias mas cercanas y vendidos en tiendas y refresquerías. En la actualidad está aplicando a un credikiva, mediante el cual comprará materias primas para elaborar pasteles, una estufa y una olla industrial. Porque dice que su eta es crecer, crecer y crecer para ayudar a sus hijos comprandoles una casa
texts.en:
Yadira has 30 years of experience making food. She was an employee of a business where they prepared and sold tamales and pastries. The owners of this business inspired her to become independent. This is how she started her business venture and continues today. Her clients place orders and she sells to them directly without a middleman. 

For cooking; corn, chicken, and pork, she starts grinding and seasoning all the ingredients, she wraps it in a bijao leaf and she ties it to increase the good flavour of the vegetables mixed with the  meat. Her niece and 2 colleagues work with her and they are very good help. Her pastries and tamales are sold wholesale and retail weekly in quantities of 2000. Every Saturday, Sunday and holidays from 3 am until 11 am, Yadira prepares her pastries so that they arrive to be consumed by the closest families and sold in the shops and snack stands. 

Now she is applying for a loan with Kiva. She will use the loan to purchase raw materials to make pastries, a stove and an industrial pot. She says her goal is to grow and grow and grow in order to help her children buy a house.

loans.use: to purchase raw material to make her pastries, a stove and an industrial pot.

loans.name: Hrachik

texts.en:
Hrachik is 55 years old and he lives in Vanadzor city in Lori region. Hrachik is a perfect cook and a master of making delicious food. He has a professional degree and already 30 years of work experience. Now he works at the social food center as a chief cook and as his customers say, once you have tasted Hrachik’s delicious, juicy and flavorful barbecue you will never forget it. That is why Harchik has no lack of orders and customers from the whole region, since he cooks his dishes with refined taste, care, and his work place as well as the food is always fresh and clean. 
Hrachik is married and he has a son, who is a constructor and a daughter, who works at the school as a teacher.
Hrachik asks this loan in order to buy a new refrigerator, a bigger one than his current one, and he also  wants to take part in training courses organized for cooks, so as to develop his cooking skills and to find new secrets and details of cooking, which with time there are more and more.

loans.use: to buy a new refrigerator, a bigger one than his current one, and he also wants to take part in training courses organized for cooks

loans.name: Abdul Qayum

texts.en: Abdul Qayum is a 33-year-old, married father of three children. He is living happily with his family in the area of Lahore, Pakistan.  He has been doing embroidery work with a machine at a shop for the last fourteen years to support his family. He has become an expert in embroidery by machine, but a few days ago his machine became out of order due to continuous work. Now he wants to repair the embroidery machine to continue his business. He uses sequins, pearls, threads, precious stones, silk, needles and wooden frames for embroidery. The embroidery material for bridal dresses is very expensive, but its turnover is very high. He deals with monotonous tone, which is impressive, and he easily wins the trust of his customers. Due to his behavior and tone, he has built up very good relations with his customers. His embroidery shop is very famous in the town, and that is the reason his business is running well. Due to good relations his sales have increased a lot, but he does not have sufficient stock to cope with the demand. Therefore, he requested a loan to buy more materials such as sequins, pearls, threads, precious stones, silk, needles and wooden frames for embroidery and to repair his embroidery machine so that he would be able to enhance his embroidery business.  Abdul Qayum is very thankful to Kiva and field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to repair his embroidery machine and buy materials for embroidary work.

loans.name: Mutsinda Group

texts.fr:
Déo  fait partie du groupe Mutsinda et  habite à Bubanza. Il a 31 ans et est marié à  Fidès,  une  cultivatrice. Ensemble ils ont 3 enfants, âgés de 2 à 6 ans.

Il  fait le commerce de  boutique (riz, huile de palme. Limonade,…)  depuis  14 ans. 

Il  est à son deuxième  crédit à Turame. Avec le crédit KIVA qu’il obtient, il  va  augmenter son capital et acheter une grande quantité  d’articles de sa boutique (riz, huile de palme. Limonade,…)  à revendre, pour gagner plus. 

Dans les années prochaines, il voudrait faire de l’agriculture et voir ses enfants étudier.
texts.en:
Déo is part of the group Mutsinda and lives in Bubanza. He is 31 years old and married to Fidès, a farmer. Together they have three children, from 2 to 6 years old.  

Déo has been a shopkeeper (rice, palm oil, Limonade, …) for 14 years. 

He is on his second Turame loan. With the KIVA loan he is obtaining, he is going to increase his capital and purchase a large quantity of shop goods (rice, palm oil, Limonade,…) to resell, so as to earn more.

In the coming years, he would like to work in farming and to see his children educated.

loans.use: to purchase many shop goods (rice, palm oil, Limonade,…) to resell, so as to earn more

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: by buying more goods like cream, soap, etc.

loans.name: Halima

texts.en:
Halima is a married woman with four school going children. She owns a house that neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family. 

For the past year she has operated a shop kiosk business, selling to her neighbours and passersby. She mentioned price fluctuation as her major challenge. She dreams of establishing a wholesale shop in the future.

With the loan she wants to purchase wheat flour, beans, rice, and cooking oil for resale. She decided to join Yehu to get financial support.

loans.use: to purchase wheat flour, beans, rice, and cooking oil for resale.

loans.name: Karina Alba

texts.es: Es originaria de Puerto Cabezas, tiene 36 años de edad. Con el objetivo de tener fuente de ingreso, desde hace aproximadamente 7 años, estableció en su vivienda  una mini pulpería. Solicita su segundo financiamiento para comprar mercadería: granas básicas, chiverías, pan, huevo, entre otros productos. Su sueño es ampliar su vivienda, para establecer una tienda de ropa nueva.
texts.en:
She is from Puerto Cabezas, and she is 36 years old.  In order to have a source of income, she established a mini grocery store approximately seven years ago.

She is requesting her second loan to buy merchandise like basic grains, snacks, bread, and eggs, among other products.  

Her dream is to expand her house in order to set up a store selling new clothes.

loans.use: to buy merchandise like basic grains, snacks, bread, and eggs, among other products.

loans.name: Urpis De Pucyura Group

texts.es:
Este banco comunal "Urpis de Pucyura" de esta conformado por vecinos y amigos que viven en el distrito de Vilcabamba de la provincia de La Convención.
 
La socia Martha se dedica a la venta de comida en su pequeño restaurante, ella es una es una mujer emprendedora pues saca adelante a sus hijos, ella en esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar mas insumos como por ejemplo sacos arroz, sacos de azúcar y entre otros. 

Todos socios están agradecidos por la oportunidad y se sienten contentos por el préstamo pues se compromete a pagar con mucha responsabilidad. (Los socios adjuntos que aparecen en la fotografía llegaron tarde a la reunión)
texts.en:
The communal bank "Urpis de Pucyura" is made up of neighbors and friends who live in the Vilcabamba district of the province of La Convencion.

Martha has a business selling food from her small restaurant.  She is an enterprising woman who provides for her children.  At this time, she needs a loan to buy more supplies such as sacks of rice, sacks of sugar, and other items.

All of the members of this group are grateful for this opportunity, and they feel content to be getting this loan.  They promise to make their payments with a lot of responsibility.  (The members in the attached photos arrived late to the meeting).

loans.use: to buy supplies for her restaurant

loans.name: Brenda

texts.en:
Brenda is married with one children and her child goes to school. She also takes care of additional family members (sister). She resides in the family house and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees and feeding the family.

She has a business of selling charcoal and has applied for a loan of 1,000,000 UGX from MCDTSACCO to buy more bags of charcoal. She has been in this business for three years. She generates additional income selling piped water. She works from home six days out of every week and sells on a retail basis. Her major business challenges include transportation and seasonality. 

She aspires to become a wholesaler and also to buy a delivery van to ease in transportation and also to buy a plot  of land and build rental rooms.

loans.use: To buy more  bags of charcoal

loans.name: Racheal

texts.en:
Racheal is 22 years old and lives in the town of Wobulezi in the Luwero region of Uganda. For the past two years, she has been working hard to manage her food stall, which sells raw food. 

To help expand her business, Racheal has requested a loan of 300,000 UGX from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase more food to sell, and will help her to generate greater profits and pay for her university tuition. She hopes that in the future she will be able to start up a whole sale shop. 

Racheal is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities, and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: to purchase more food to sell

loans.name: Suleyma Yasmin

texts.es: Suleyma tiene 27 años de edad y habita en casa propia junto a su compañero de vida. Ella se dedica a la venta de detergente, jabón y sandalias de forma ambulante. Tiene 7 años de contar con este negocio y es así como logra ganarse el sustento y junto a su compañero de vida mantienen la economía del hogar. Suleyma solicita este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en su negocio en la compra de mayor cantidad de productos (jabón, detergente y variedad de sandalias) para aumentar sus ventas e ingresos.
texts.en:
Suleyma is 27 years old and lives in her own house with her life partner. She works selling detergent, soap and sandals from place to place. She has had this business for seven years. She earns her living with this business, and along with her life partner, this is how they maintain their household finances.

Suleyma is requesting this loan from FUSAI to invest in her business by buying larger quantities of products (soap, detergent and a variety of sandals). She hopes to increase her sales and income.

loans.use: to buy larger quantities of soap, detergent and a variety of sandals for her business.

loans.name: Ana Minda

texts.en:
Ana Minda is 45 years old, married, and has six children. Three of her children are in school. She is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines.

Ana Minda requested a PHP 6,000 loan through NWTF. She will use this loan to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs. She has been raising pigs for four years now, and has borrowed one time in the past from NWTF, to sustain her business.

In the future, Ana Minda would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Carmen Narciza

texts.es:
El Grupo De Crédito San Andrés se reúne cada quince días en la parroquia Picoaza de la ciudad de Portoviejo. Lugar conocido por ser una zona muy comercial, por sus fiestas tradicionales de San Pedro y San Pablo y por la alegría de su gente.
En este lugar vive la señora Carmen, tiene 51 años de edad, está separada hace varios años pero de esa relación tienen 9 hijos, 8 mayores de edad y uno de 11 años que estudia en escuela, dos de sus hijos aun viven con ella.
Doña Carmen es una mujer que le gusta trabajar y con su esfuerzo salir adelante, ella prepara cocada (dulce de coco) que mucha aceptación por sus clientes que a diario le compran, todos los días prepara estos productos los mismos que luego su hijo se encarga de entregar por la localidad a sus clientes. Ella también trabaja en un restaurante en la ciudad por lo cual recibe un sueldo mensual, es así como gana el sustento diario para ella y su hijo pequeño.
Este crédito lo va a emplear en comprar cocos, azúcar y leche para elaborar sus dulces. Lleva 7 años  en el Grupo De Crédito. Sus sueños son darle lo mejor a su hijo.
texts.en:
The San Andrés communal bank meets every 15 days in the Picoaza parish in the city of Portoviejo.  This place is known for being a very commercial area, for its traditional San Pedro and San Pablo celebrations, and for the joyousness of its people.

This is where Carmen, age 51 lives.  She has been separated for several years, but she has nine children from this relationship.  Eight of them are adults, and one is 11 years old and goes to school.  Two of her children still live with her.

Carmen is a woman who loves to work and to get ahead through her efforts,  She make ‘cocada’ (a coconut sweet) that is very well-received by her customers who buy it daily.  She prepares this product every day, and then her son delivers it to her customers in the area.

She also works at a restaurant in the city and receives a monthly salary.  That is how she earns the daily sustenance for herself and her young son.

She will use the loan to buy coconuts, sugar, and milk to make the sweets.  She has been in the communal bank for seven years.  Her dream is to give her son the best.

loans.use: to buy coconuts, sugar, and milk.

loans.name: Hasmik

texts.en:
Hasmik has been trading cosmetic goods for over three years. She lives in Kapan town, with her husband and two school-aged children. The requested loan is highly important, for Hasmik to be able to purchase a new stock of cosmetic goods and resell it to her customers. Hasmik's spouse is engaged in the delivery of chocolate. He is the main breadwinner of the family, but the income that Hasmik gathers is also very helpful for covering the daily costs of the family.

She has been approved for a loan, within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF International. The start-up loan program provides business start-up loans, with soft conditions, to informal businesses that do not have access to credit products. Your support is very important for Hasmik and her small business, and she hopes for your good will and support.

loans.use: to pay for a new stock of cosmetic goods

loans.name: Anahit

texts.en:
Anahit lives in Vanadzor town with her two children. Her husband is a migrant worker in a neighboring country and their son is a policeman working at a local police station. 

Anahit herself has been providing lessons to local students in Vanadzor town. She conducts individual courses from her house and has been involved in teaching for 15 years. 

The requested loan is very important for Anahit to purchase a computer and a printer needed for organizing her classes more efficiently. She has been approved for a loan within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF International. The start-up loan program provides business start-up loans, with soft conditions, to informal businesses that do not have access to credit products. Your support is very important for Anahit and her teaching.

loans.use: to pay for a computer and a printer needed for providing lessons to her students

loans.name: Nushik

texts.en:
Nushik lives in Kapan town with her parents and brother. She is 19 years old and it has already been two years that she has been involved in հairdressing. As a young hairdresser, Nushik is talented enough to have loyal clients, who prefer to use only her service. 

Nushik has applied for this loan to be able to purchase tools and materials to provide her hairdressing service. She has been approved for a loan within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF International. The start-up loan program provides business start-up loans, with soft conditions, to informal businesses that do not have access to credit products. 

Your support is very important to Nushik and her small business and she hopes for your support.

loans.use: to pay for tools and materials to provide her hairdressing service.

loans.name: Tulishane Group

texts.fr: La cliente Wasukimbi est  une femme entrepreneur, présidente de l’association de crédit Tulishane. Elle est âgée de 60 ans, mère de 9 enfants et mariée à un homme sans travail. Elle sollicite ce nouveau crédit pour acheter  25 sacs de braises. Elle souhaite  construire  une très belle maison et scolariser ses enfants. Elle remercie Hekima de faciliter l’accès au crédit  aux femmes à faible revenu.
texts.en:
Wasukimbi, age 60, is an entrepreneur and the president of the group Tulishane. She is married with 9 children. Her husband is unemployed. 

Wasukimbi is seeking a loan to buy 25 sacks of charcoal. Her goals are to build a beautiful house and to give her children an education. 

She thanks Hekima for helping low-income women to gain access to credit.

loans.use: to buy 25 sacks of charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Jose Alexander

texts.es:
La pasión por los números y la buena administración de sus cuentas, son las principales características de Alexander, quien desde pequeño se vio atraído por las matemáticas. Estudia quinto año de Contaduría Pública, además de estudiar, trabaja mitad de tiempo en una empresa, donde desarrolla sus habilidades y pone en práctica todo lo aprendido en clases. Asegura que sin el apoyo de sus padres no hubiese sido capaz de alcanzar las metas que ha logrado.
Alexander solicita el crédito para pagar la cancelación de los cursos universitarios, él deposita su confianza en el financiamiento para obtener su título universitario, lo que se será un soporte en el ámbito laboral. Es un joven inteligente y emprendedor, ama su carrera universitaria y anhela seguir adquiriendo conocimientos que le propicien un futuro exitoso. Una de sus metas es establecer su propia empresa, brindar una excelente atención para obtener buenos ingresos.
texts.en:
Alexander‘s main skills are his passion for numbers and the good administration of his accounts. He liked Math since he was little. He is in his fifth year of  Public Accounting school, besides studying, he works part time for a company where he develops his skills and practices everything learned in class.
He assures without his parents support he wouldn’t have been able to reach his goals.

Alexander is requesting the loan to pay off the debt from his college classes. He puts his trust in the funding to obtain his University degree, which will help him in the job market.
He is a smart and enterprising young man. He loves his career and he hopes to get more knowledge to help him have a successful future. One of his goals is to open his own company, and offer excellent customer services to get a good income.

loans.use: to pay off his college classes.

loans.name: Zarine

texts.en:
Zarine is from Kapan town where she lives with her husband and little one-year-old son. 

She has been involved in cosmetics sales for over two years. She sells a large variety of cosmetics goods from her house and gets an income which helps her to cover some of the family's costs. 

The requested loan is very important for her to be able to purchase a new stock of cosmetics to meet her clients' demands. She has been approved for a loan within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF International. The start-up loan program provides business start-up loans, with soft conditions, to informal businesses that do not have access to credit products. 

Your support is very important for Zarine and her small business, and she hopes for support.

loans.use: to pay for a new stock of cosmetics

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy sugar, scratch cards, oil, rice, onions, biscuits, etc.

loans.name: Neyda

texts.es: Neyda se dedica al cultivo de productos agricolas en combinacion con la cria de animales o explotacion mixta Al igual que otras mujeres en esta actividad Neyda percibe ingresos semanales por la venta de sus productos Neyda necesita un prestamo para comprar semilla mejorada, de esa manera podra incrementar su produccion y sus ingresos semanales Neyda  tiene buena salud y experiencia en este campo por lo que es muy recomendable que le ayuden Neyda vive en Palomar
texts.en:
Neyda engages in the cultivation of agricultural products along with raising animals, which is also known as mixed farming. Like other women who are in this line of work, Neyda earns a weekly income from the sale of her products. She needs a loan so that she can buy improved seeds in order to increase her production and her weekly earnings.

Neyda is in good health and is experienced in this type of work. For this reason, she is highly recommended for assistance. Neyda lives in Palomar.

loans.use: to buy improved seeds for cultivation.

loans.name: Pauline's Group

texts.en:
Pauline's group is comprised of two hard working women. Pauline is 16 years old and lives in the town of Wobulezi in the Luwero region of Uganda. For the past two years, she has been working hard to manage her retail shop, which sells essential commodities. 

To help expand her business, Pauline has requested a loan of 700,000 UGX from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase more beer and sodas for the bar with other food items for the retail shop, and will help her to generate greater profits and add more to the business, and also pay for her medical bills. Pauline hopes that in the future she will be able to start a poultry farm. 

Pauline is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities, and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: to purchase more beer and sodas for the bar and other food items for the retail shop

loans.name: Reyner

texts.es:
El socio Celso pertenece al banco comunal VIRGEN DEL CARMEM, el banco está ubicado en el distrito de Maranura, provincia de La Convención y departamento de Cusco.
El socio tiene 34 años de edad y es soltero, él socio alterna sus actividades diarias trabajando en construcción civil, el socio lleva buen tiempo con su negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su trabajo, el socio trabaja en las distintas obras que solicitan sus servicios, él socio desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir adelante.
El socio solicita el crédito para la compra de herramientas como martillo entre otros.
El socio se siente agradecida por el crédito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.
texts.en:
Celso is a member of the communal bank VIRGEN DEL CARMEN. The bank is located in the district of Maranura, in the municipality of La Convencion, province of Cusco.

This member is 34 years old and single. This member alternates his daily activities working in civil construction. This member has been running his business for awhile. It is going well thanks to the effort he puts every day in his job. This member works in the different construction sites that require his services. This member wishes to be able to keep working to move forward.

He is requesting the loan to buy tools such as a hammer, among others. This member is thankful for the loan granted and he is committed to make the payments.

loans.use: to buy tools, such as a hammer, among others.

loans.name: Jeneveb

texts.en:
Jeneveb is 38 years old, married, and has one child who is in school. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. She has a general store business in the Philippines. She has been doing this work for three years.

Jeneveb requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF. She will use this amount in order to purchase more items to sell, like snack foods, sugar, noodles and other groceries.

In the future, Jeneveb would like to build and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more items to sell, like snack foods, noodles, and other groceries

loans.name: Tubemaso Group

texts.fr:
Adèle  fait partie du groupe Tubemaso et  habite à Bubanza. Elle a 32  ans et est mariée à  Noé,  un commerçant. Ensemble ils ont 5 enfants âgés de 8  à 16 ans dont 4 étudient.

Elle  fait le commerce de l’huile de palme  depuis  12 ans. 

Elle est à son deuxième  crédit à Turame. Avec le crédit KIVA qu’elle obtient, elle  va  augmenter son capital et acheter une grande  quantité  d’huile de palme à revendre, pour gagner plus. 

Dans les années  prochaines, elle voudrait être capable de satisfaire tous les besoins familiaux(logement,soins de santé alimentation,...)   et voir ses enfants étudier.
texts.en:
Adèle, age 32, is a member of the group Tubemaso and she lives in Bubanza. She is married to a merchant named Noé, and they have five children ages 8 to 16 years old, four of whom go to school. 

Adèle has been selling palm oil for 12 years. She is seeking a second loan from Turame to strengthen her working capital. She plans to stock up on palm oil to bolster her sales and revenue.

In the coming years, she would like to be able to support the family’s needs (lodging, healthcare, food, etc.) and for her children to pursue their education.

loans.use: to strengthen her working capital and stock up on palm oil to bolster her sales and revenue.

loans.name: Fred

texts.en:
Livestock play an important role in most small-scale farming systems, throughout Kenya. They provide power to cultivate fields, manure to maintain crop productivity, and nutritious food products for human consumption and income-generation. Despite the importance of livestock, inadequate livestock nutrition is a common problem in rural villages such as Kisii. Mr. Fred, a mixed farmer, is one of the farmers who desperately need to do major improvements on their farms.

Fred lives in a village in Kisii on a small piece of land, together with his family. He is a husband and the father of one child. For the last eight years, he has been making income through selling eggs, tea, and other crops that come from his farm. He is also involved in other personal business, for extra money.

Fred is seeking a loan from KIVA lenders via Juhudi Kilimo, to purchase a chaff cutter. With your financing, the chaff cutter will play a significant role in improving the animal feed and feeding practices in Fred’s farm. This will set a bar for his neighbours and, who knows, it may play a major role in the long-term alleviation of rural poverty in Kisii. Improved animal nutrition has specific benefits to the rural poor, such as increased livestock productivity, household food security, and income.

Additional income from this asset will go to Fred’s child’s education. “Education is the foundation of having an improved living standard in the future,” he said.

loans.use: To purchase a chaff cutter

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy coal and dry fish.

loans.name: Milena

texts.en:
Milena is from Kapan town. She lives alone as her parents migrated to a neighboring country last year, with the hope of finding a job and sustaining their living. Milena's only sister is married and lives separately with her family. So, Milena, to be able cover her living costs, started a retail business. Specifically, she sells cosmetics and receives orders from locals in Kapan town.
 
The requested loan is highly important for Milena to be able to purchase cosmetics and cover her customers' orders. She has been approved for a loan within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF International. The start-up loan program provides business start-up loans, with soft conditions, to informal businesses that do not have access to credit products. Your support is very important for Milena and her small business, and she hopes for your support.

loans.use: to pay for cosmetics to cover her customers' orders

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy solar lanterns for resale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy solar lanterns for resale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more livestock and enlarge his business.

loans.name: Mohammad

texts.en:
Mohammad is a 24-year-old single man from Qabatiya, a small village near Jenin city. For the past two years Mohammad has been working in selling fruits and vegetables in the local market. He buys his products from local farmers. 

Mohammad would like to improve his business and also his living conditions so he took a loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy more products for his business to resell. By taking this loan, Mohammad will be able to increase his sales and also his income. 

Mohammad appears in the photo while he was working.

loans.use: to buy more products for his business.

loans.name: Chuhrigul

texts.ru: Чухригул 48-летняя местная жительница района А.Джоми. Около 10 лет она занимается откормом и продажей крупнорогатого скота. Чухригул разводит скотов на местном пастбище. За счет прибыли с деятельности она обеспечивает семью. Ее муж как многие мужчины ее района уехал на заработки в Россию, чтобы хорошо заработать и улучшить уровень жизни. Поэтому сейчас все заботы о семье лежит на Чухригул. Она ответственная и трудолюбивая женщина. Чухригул хочет увеличить поголовье своих скотов. Для этой цели она запрашивает кредит, так как собственных средств не хватает. Она всецело надеется на вашу поддержку.
texts.en: Chuhrigul is a 48-year-old resident of the A. Jomi district. She has been fattening and selling cattle for about ten years. She keeps the cattle in a local pasture. She is able to take care of her family with the profits from the cattle. Like many men in her district, her husband went to work in Russia in order to earn well and improve their lives. Now all of the family worries lie on Chuhrigul. She is a responsible and hard-working woman. She wants to buy more cattle but has to take out a loan because she does not have enough money. She relies on your support.

loans.use: to purchase cattle and expand her business

loans.name: Guzelya

texts.ru:
Гузеля имеет высшее педагогическое образование. Она в течение 4 лет работает в учебном центре в качестве преподавателя русского языка. Ей нравится обучать людей и передавать им свои знания.
Гузеля не замужем, ей 34 года. Она живет с матерью в городе Кургантюбе в маленькой двухкомнатной квартире. Гузеля хочет улучшить условия быта в их квартире, но чтобы провести ремонт в квартире у них не хватает собственных средств. Поэтому Гузеля обратилась за кредитом. Она очень надеется на финансовую поддержку.
texts.en:
Guzelya has a degree in teaching and has taught Russian language at the educational center for four years. She likes to teach and share her knowledge.

Guzelya is 34 and is not married. She lives with her mother in the city of Qurgan-Tube in a small, two-room apartment. She wants to improve the living conditions in the apartment but does not have enough money to take care of the repairs. She is requesting a loan for this reason and hopes for financial support.

loans.use: to repair her home and improve living conditions

loans.name: Sylivia

texts.en:
Sylivia is 17 years old and lives in the town of Wobulezi in the Luwero region of Uganda. For the past two years, Sylivia has been working hard to manage her beauty salon where she does hairdressing. 

To help expand her business, Sylivia has requested a loan of 300,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more hair relaxers for the beauty salon and will help her generate greater profits and pay school fees for herself and her young brother. She hopes that in the future, she will be able to own a bigger beauty salon. 

Sylivia is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: to buy more hair relaxers for her beauty salon

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane is 17 years old and lives in the town of Wobulezi in the Luwero region of Uganda. For the past two years, Jane has been working hard to manage her livestock business, selling cows and goats. 

To help expand her business, Jane has requested a loan of 800,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more cows,  goats and vaccines for the animals. This will help Jane to generate greater profits and build residential houses. Jane hopes that in the future, she will be able to study a nursing course. 

Jane is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities, and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: to buy more cows, goats and vaccines for the animals

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther is 20 years old and lives in the town of Wobulezi in the Luwero region of Uganda. For the past two years, Esther has been working hard to manage her wholesale business selling essential commodities. 

To help expand her business, Esther has requested a loan of 900,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase more food items such as sugar and rice for sale, and will help Esther to generate greater profits and pay school fees for her young brothers and sisters. Esther hopes that in the future, she will be able to expand business and open another branch. 

Esther is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities, and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: to purchase more food items such as sugar and rice

loans.name: Gwendolyne Diana

texts.es:
Gwendolyne es una joven muy emprendedora y trabajadora, tiene 22 años de edad, es soltera y vive en Nazca en la casa de sus padres.
Es una persona con muchas ganas de salir adelante, es por ello que estudia la carrera de Computación porque quiere conseguir un buen trabajo para poder tener un trabajo bien remunerado.
También desde hace más de 1 año trabaja como niñera y le va muy bien porque es una persona muy dedicada a su trabajo y porque trata con respeto y amabilidad a las personas.
Gwendolyne está muy agradecida con los prestamistas Kiva porque con el apoyo que le han brindado ella podrá empezar con los trámites de titulación para que de esta manera pueda conseguir trabajos con mejor remuneración y así pueda apoyar a su familia y mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Gwendolyne is an enterprising and hardworking young woman. She is 22 years old, single, and lives at her parents’ house in Nazca.

Gwendolyne is person who has tremendous drive to succeed. For this reason, she is studying for a degree in Computer Science because she wants to secure a good job in which she is well-compensated. For more than a year, Gwendolyne has been working as a nanny and is doing very well at her job because she is very devoted to her work and treats others with respect and friendliness.

Gwendolyne is very grateful to the Kiva lenders because of the support they have provided. She will be able to start the process of finalizing her degree. This will allow her to obtain well-paid jobs so that she can support her family and improve her quality of life.

loans.use: to pay the cost of certifying her degree.

loans.name: Carmen

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “VIRGEN DEL CARMEN”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Maranura, perteneciente a la provincia de La Convencion y departamento de Cusco.

La socia Carmen se dedica al negocio de agricultura, ella tiene un terreno donde cultiva cacao y café, la socia trabaja desde las 6:00 a.m hasta las 5:00 p.m,la socia ya tiene varios años en este negocio y le va muy bien, el sueño de la socia es ampliar su terreno de cultivo. La socia solicita le crédito para comprar semillas y fertilizantes.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
This member belongs to the communal bank VIRGEN DEL CARMEN. The bank is located in the district of Maranura, in the municipality of La Convencion, province of Cusco.

Carmen works in farming. She has a piece of land where she cultivates cocoa and coffee. This member works from 6 a.m. to 5 p.m.  She is being in this business for several years and she is doing very well. This member’s dream is to expand the land that she cultivates. The member is requesting the loan to buy seeds and fertilizers. She is glad for the loan and she is committed to make the payments.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizers.

loans.name: Caroline

texts.en:
Caroline has been running a boutique shop for the last 13 years, earning a monthly profit of KES. 10,000 which she uses to support her family. She is 40 years, married and blessed with five children between seven and 20 years of age.

Caroline has applied for a loan of KES. 80,000 to buy more new clothes to sell. She will use the anticipated profit to finish the house she is building for the family.

In future, Caroline hopes to grow her business and put up a rental house.

loans.use: to buy more new clothes to sell.

loans.name: Sr. De Ccoyllority Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “SR. DE CCOYLLORITY”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Delia ella es casada y tiene 58 años y tiene 3 hijos; La socia trabaja en su negocio de venta de ropa, la socia vende pantalones, blusas y polos, la socia ya tiene varios años en este negocio y le va muy bien, el sueño de la socia es tener un bazar. La socia solicita le crédito para comprar zapatos, polos, chompas, polos y blusas.

Los otros socios se dedican al negocio de hotel, negocio de venta de ropa, negocio de tienda de abarrotes y negocio de hotel.



La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
The members belong to the communal bank "SR. DE CCOYLLORITY". This bank is located in the district of Cusco, in the province of Cusco and the department of Cusco. 

The member is Delia. She is married, and is 58 years old with 3 children. She works selling clothing; she sells pants, blouses and polo shirts. She has been working in this business for several years, and it is going well. Her dream is to have a bazaar.

She is requesting this loan to purchase shoes, polo shirts, sweaters and blouses. The other members of the communal bank work in hotels, selling clothing and in a grocery store. 

Delia thanks everyone who has been a part of this dream through Kiva and she promises to make her payments on time.

loans.use: to purchase shoes, polo shirts, sweaters and blouses.

loans.name: Las Reynas Group

texts.es: Este banco comunal "Las Reynas" de esta conformado por vecinos y amigos que viven en el distrito de Maranura de la provincia de La Convención. La socia Rudt se dedica a la venta de productos de primera necesidad como sacos de arroz, sacos de azúcar entre otros, ella es una es una mujer emprendedora pues saca adelante a sus hijos, ella en esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar mercadería como por ejemplo sacos arroz, sacos de azúcar y entre otros. Todos socios están agradecidos por la oportunidad y se sienten contentos por el préstamo pues se compromete a pagar con mucha responsabilidad.
texts.en:
The communal bank "Las Reynas" is made up of neighbors and friends who live in the district of Maranura in the province of La Convención.

Rudt, a member, works selling basic goods such as bags of rice and sugar. She is a very hardworking woman who helps her children to get ahead. 

She needs this loan to purchase merchandise such as bags of rice and sugar. All of the members are thankful for this opportunity and they are happy with the loan. They promise to pay it back responsibly.

loans.use: to purchase merchandise such as bags of rice and sugar.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a new sewing machine

loans.name: Hilda

texts.es:
Hilda tiene 58 años de edad, de estado civil casada, vive en el distrito de Cayaltí, una comunidad que se dedica a la agricultura, especialmente al cultivo de maíz, caña entre otros, comercio y ganadería, ubicada en la Provincia de Chiclayo que pertenece a la Región Lambayeque, costa norte del Perú.

Ella se dedica a la crianza de ganado lechero, comercio de leche fresca y elaboración artersanal de queso fresco, su esposo se dedica a la agricultura y en ocasiones a trabajar una mototaxi que dan a alquiler entre semana son una familia unida, ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 1 000 nuevos soles para la compra de alimentos balanceados para mayor producción de leche y de esta manera tener una mayor producción de leche.
texts.en:
Hilda is 58 years old, married, and lives in Cayalti District, an agricultural community known for corn and sugar cane, among others, as well as commerce and animal husbandry. Cayalti District is located in Chiclayo Province, which is in the Lambayeque Region on the northern coast of Peru.

Hilda works raising dairy cattle, selling fresh milk and making artisanal queso fresco [a creamy, soft, and mild unaged white cheese]. Her husband works in agriculture and also drives a mototaxi, which he rents out during the week. They are a close-knit family.

Hilda has requested a loan of 1,000 PEN from Edpyme Alternativa to buy balanced feed. She hopes to improve the milk production of her dairy cattle.

loans.use: to buy balanced feed to improve the milk production of her dairy cattle.

loans.name: Mesaid

texts.en:
Mesaid is married with five children, four in school and one underage. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

Mesaid has operated a fish selling business at the market for the past 13 years, selling to her town dwellers and neighbors. 

Mesaid is requesting a loan to purchase bundles of fish for her business. She decided to join Yehu to access loans at lower cost to improve her business.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of fish for her business

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy a new sewing machine, an overlock sewing machine, a table and fabric.

loans.name: Shazia

texts.en: Shazia has successfully built her business manufacturing carpets with the support of Kashf Foundation and Kiva. These carpets are made up of special wood which are used in mosques. By this time she attained a good number of customers and makes a good amount of income to contribute to the family income. Previously with the help of Kiva she was able to purchase required raw material. Now she is in her third loan cycle and has applied for a loan of 40,000 PKR to purchase good quality wood in larger quantities with some packs of nails and cutters. This will enable her to increase her sales to gain more profits.

loans.use: to purchase good quality wood in larger quantities with some packs of nails and cutters.

loans.name: Musarat

texts.en: Musarat is 35 years old. She is a responsible mother of two children. She is a housewife and looks after her family, which is comprised of four person. She is well-trained in cloth stitching. She provides stitching services to the people at her own house. She has been running a stitching training center at her home. She needs to purchase a sewing machine and a variety of stitching materials for her work, including thread, needles, and cloth. This is very important for her to continue her work efficiently and professionally. However, due to the lack of money, she finds it difficult. So Musarat is requesting a loan from Kiva partner BRAC Pakistan. BRAC Pakistan issued her loan as she requested. Musarat is very thankful to Kiva's partner, BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy new sewing machine for sewing center at home.

loans.name: Teopista

texts.en:
Teopista is 19 years old and lives in the town of Wobulenzi in the Luwero region of Uganda. She has 2 children. For the past 3 years, Teopista has been working hard to manage her boutique, which sells clothes. 

To help expand her business, Teopista has requested a loan of 500,000 UGX from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy shirts, trousers, and many other clothes to sell.  This will help Teopista to generate greater profits and improve on her family's standard of living. Teopista hopes that in the future she will be able to own a bigger supermarket. 

Teopista is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities, and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: to buy shirts, trousers, and many other clothes for sale

loans.name: Qurbongul

texts.ru: Курбонгул профессиональная швея, которая в течение 18 лет занимается пошивом женских платьев. Ей 54 года. Она разведена и живет в районе Яван с двумя дочерьми, тремя сыновьями, невесткой и четырьмя внуками. Ее сыновья находятся на заработках в России. Сама Курбонгул вместе с дочерью и невесткой занимается швейным делом. Одновременно она работает в больнице уборщицей. Курбонгул сейчас обратилась за кредитом для своей деятельности. Ей необходимо закупить швейные принадлежности. Она надеется на поддержку.
texts.en: Qurbongul is a professional seamstress who has sewn traditional dresses for 18 years. She is 54, divorced, and lives in the Yavan district with her two daughters, three sons, her daughter-in-law, and four grandchildren. Her sons are working in Russia. Qurbongul and her daughters and daughter-in-law are all seamstresses. She also works as a cleaner at the hospital. She is currently requesting a loan for her work to buy sewing supplies. She hopes for support.

loans.use: to buy necessary sewing supplies

loans.name: Gulshoda

texts.ru: Гулшода молодая, но уже разведенная женщина в возрасте 21 года. Сейчас она поставила перед собой цель - открыть собственный бизнес и начать самостоятельно зарабатывать на жизнь. До этого времени она нигде не работала, так как не имеет высшего образования или какой-либо другой профессии. Гулшода решила начать бизнес по открому и продаже скота. Этот вид деятельности развит в сельских районах Носири Хусрав, откуда и сама Гулшода. Ей в начале бизнеса будут помогать советом родители. Гулшода просит кредит, поскольку начального капитала не хватает для купли двух бычков. Она надеется на финансовую поддержку. Благодаря кредиту она обеспечит себя источником дохода.
texts.en: Gulshoda is young woman and already divorced at age 21. She has set herself the goal of starting her own business and earning a living independently. She has never had a job and does not have a higher education or a profession. She decided to start a business fattening and selling cattle. This is a well-developed industry in rural areas like Nosiri Khusrav, where Gulshoda is from. Her parents will help her when she starts the business. She has applied for a loan because she does not have enough money to buy two bulls. She hopes for financial support. Thanks to the loan she will be able to earn an income and take care of herself.

loans.use: to buy two bulls and start a livestock business

loans.name: Juan

texts.es: Juan  se dedica al cultivo de productos agricolas en combinacion con la cria de animales o explotacion mixta Juan recibe ingresos semanales por la venta de sus productos agricolas y quiere un credito para la compra de semilla mejorada Juan lleva bastante tiempo en esta actividad por lo que no hay riesgos en cuanto a la administración del credito ni la búsqueda de un buen proveedor de semillas mejoradas por lo que se recomienda ayudarle
texts.en:
Juan engages in the cultivation of agricultural products along with raising animals, which is also known as mixed farming. He generates a weekly income from the sale of his products, so he is requesting a loan in order to buy improved seeds. Juan has been in this line of work for a long time.

Since there are no risks associated with managing his credit or finding a good seed provider, Juan is being recommended for assistance.

loans.use: to buy improved seeds for cultivation.

loans.name: Evelyne

texts.en:
Evelyne is 16 years old and lives in the town of Wobulenzi in the Luwero region of Uganda. For the past 6 months, she has been working hard to manage her business, which sells dry foods. 

To help expand her business, Evelyne has requested a loan of 800,000 UGX from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more foods such as maize, coffee, and beans for sale.  This will help Evelyne to generate greater profits and pay school fees for her young brothers and sisters. Evelyne hopes that in the future she will be able to take a hair-dressing course. 

Evelyne is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities, and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: to buy more foods such as maize, coffee, and beans for sale

loans.name: Justine

texts.en:
Justine is 16 years old and lives in the town of Wobulenzi in the Luwero region of Uganda. For the past 2 years, Justine has been working hard to manage her livestock business, selling cattle and goats. 

To help expand her business, Justine has requested a loan of 400,000 UGX from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase more cattle, goats, and seeds for her farm and will help Justine to generate greater profits and pay school fees for her young brothers and sisters. Justine hopes that in the future she will be able to become the best farmer in town. 

Justine is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities, and a forum for life-skills training.


"

loans.use: to purchase more cattle, goats, and seeds for her farm

loans.name: Patricia

texts.en: Patricia is a 21-year-old, Lebanese, married woman. She lives with her husband and one child. She cooperates with her husband, to fulfill her family's needs. In 2010, she decided to open her own beauty salon in her house, in order to take some of the responsibilities with her husband.Today, she’s looking to borrow a loan from Kiva's partner, Vitas s.a.l.  She will use the loan to purchase extra products for her beauty salon. This will increase her revenues.

loans.use: to purchase extra products for her beauty salon.

loans.name: Fazila's Group

texts.en:
Fazila's group is comprised of hardworking women. Fazila is 17 years old and lives in the town of Kaliro in the Iganga region of Uganda. She is single and has no children. For the past five years, Fazila has been working hard to manage her clothing shop where she sells clothes. 

To help expand her business, Fazila has requested a loan of 600,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more clothes and will help Fazila to generate greater profits and pay her school fees. Fazila hopes that in the future, she will be able to start a supermarket. 

Fazila is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: to buy more clothes

loans.name: Safina

texts.en:
Safina is a hardworking woman. She is 16 years old and lives in the town of Palisa in the Iganga region of Uganda. She is single and has no children. For the past 1 year, Safina has been working hard to manage her charcoal selling business. 

To help expand her business, Safina has requested a loan of 200,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase more sacks of charcoal, and will help Safina to generate greater profits and pay for the business rent. She hopes that in the future she will be able to open up a restaurant. 

Safina is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to micro-finance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: to purchase more sacks of charcoal.

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en:
Sarah is a hardworking woman. She is 16 years old and lives in the town of Palisa in the Iganga region of Uganda. She is single and has no children. For the past year, Sarah has been working hard to manage her food stall, which sells dry cassava. 

To help expand her business, Sarah has requested a loan of 150,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more cassava, and will help Sarah to generate greater profits and provide basic needs for her family. Sarah hopes that in the future she will be able to start up a retail shop. 

Sarah is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to micro-finance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: to buy more cassava.

loans.name: Khadije

texts.en: Khadije is a 33-year-old married woman living with her husband and two children, who are both still attending school. Khadije works really hard to be able to satisfy her family's needs and demands. She opened her a room in her house to prepare home-made food 3 years ago, and has gained a fair number of customers so far. Today, she’s requesting to borrow a loan from Kiva partner Vitas. s.a.l. to purchase more food provisions such as seeds, refreshments, etc, in order to increase her sales and thus her revenues. In the future, she plans to open her own store.

loans.use: to purchase more food provisions such as seeds, refreshments, etc

loans.name: Zamu

texts.en: Zamu is married with four children, all of whom go to school. She also takes care of one additional family member (a sister). She has a business selling charcoal and green bananas. She has applied for a loan of 700,000 Uganda shillings from MCDT-SACCO to buy more bunches of green bananas and she generates additional income from selling charcoal. She works from home six days out of every week and sells on a retail basis. Her major business challenges include transportation and seasonality. She is aspiring to become a wholesaler and educate her children up to the university level. The family has access to electricity but not to piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees and feeding the family.

loans.use: To buy more bunches of green bananas.

loans.name: Patricia

texts.es:
Patricia es una mujer casada de 42 años de edad y tiene 3 hijos.
Toda su vida se ocupó de su familia realizando labores del hogar y encargándose del estudio de sus hijos, su familia creció y cada vez tiene más necesidades, los niños necesitan cada vez más libros y ropa nueva; ¨La ropa se rompe, todo el tiempo hay que renovar los calzados, mi esposo no da todo pero ya es hora de ayudarlo…¨ comenta mamá.
Hace 2 años patricia vio una necesidad en el mercado: ¨tengo 3 hijos y parecen ciempiés..., todo el tiempo se rompen los zapatos¨ es por eso que con un pequeño capital prestado se animó he hizo la compra por mayor de un mínimo stock de zapatillas, le fue bien, devolvió el préstamo y ahora trabaja con capital propio que se financio de diferentes familiares y amigos. El trabajo es jornada completa desde primeras horas de la mañana hasta que se va la luz del día. Su oferta creció ahora también vende zapatos, ella se siente feliz ayuda a su esposo y también a sus hijos, busca nuevas oportunidades de negocio dentro de su rubro.
Es para mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia que Patricia solicita un préstamo para la compra de zapatos y zapatillas por mayor.
texts.en:
Patricia is a married woman, 42 years old, and has three children.  All her life has been occupied with her family, completing household chores and taking care of the education of her children.  Her family grew and each time with it more needs.  The children need more books and new clothes: "The clothing rips, you have to constantly buy new shoes, my husband gives us everything but it is now time to help him out" she says.

Two years ago she saw an opening in the market: "I have three children and they seem like centipedes - they are constantly breaking their shoes.:  For this reason with a bit of capital that she got on loan she began to buy used shoes in bulk and got a minimal stock of tennis shoes.  Things went well, she repaid the loan and now she is working with her own capital that she raised from different friends and family.  The work is full-time from early in the morning until nightfall. Her offerings have also now increased.  She now sells used shoes of all styles.  She feels happy to help her husband and also her children, and she looks for new opportunities for business within her area.  

She does this to improve the quality of life for her family.  For this reason Patricia is asking for a loan in order to purchase tennis shoes and other second hand shoe styles in bulk.

loans.use: To purchase tennis shoes and used other shoe styles in bulk.

loans.name: Lina

texts.en:
Lina is a 34-year-old Lebanese married woman who lives with her husband and three children. She has worked as a private teacher for four years. She equipped a room in her house with all the needed details in order to receive her students. She likes her occupation so much because she likes to feel her independence. 
To better advance her profession, today Lina is requesting to borrow a loan from Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l. to buy a new laptop so as to facilitate her work. In the future, she wishes to receive more students.

loans.use: to buy a new laptop

loans.name: Khadija

texts.en: Khadija is a 32-year-old Lebanese woman. She has been working for four years since opening a beauty salon in her house to help her parents meet the needs of life and help her brother who is the main income provider for the family. She has her loyal customers and she is well known in her region for her brilliant talents. Today, she’s requesting a loan from Kiva's partner Vitas s.a.l. to purchase equipment for her business such as scissors, hairbrush, and a dryer. In that way, she will be able to serve her customers with a high quality of work.

loans.use: to purchase equipment for her beauty salon

loans.name: Enaam

texts.en: Enaam is a 51-year-old widowed woman with three children. She has been working for four years in the agricultural sector. She works so hard without stopping in order to gain enough money to be able to pay her heavy living expenses. Today, Enaam is applying for a loan from Kiva's partner Vitas s.a.l. to purchase seeds and seedlings for plantings in order to improve her business. She is very positive about her future and wishes to ameliorate her lifestyle.

loans.use: to purchase seeds and seedlings to plant

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.en:
Ahmad is 20 years old and works in a popular market for vegetables. He lives with his parents in Jenin is a Palestinian city in the northern West Bank. 

Ahmad asked Ryada for this loan in order to repair and paint his house walls after winter damage from water and wetness. This will give a good view at home and reflect better living conditions. Ahmad is very grateful to everyone who helps him.

loans.use: to repair his house walls and paint it after winter damage from water and wetness

loans.name: Segundo Guillermo

texts.es:
Segundo Guillermo tiene 48 años de edad, de estado civil casado, vive en casa propia en el distrito de Zaña, una comunidad cercana al valle del río Jequetepeque, lo que le ha permitido desarrollarse mediante la agricultura, también se dedican al comercio y ganadería, ubicada en la Provincia de Chiclayo que pertenece a la Región Lambayeque, costa norte del Perú.

El se dedica a la venta de abarrotes (bodega), tiene más de 5 años de experiencia en el rubro, junto a su esposa se esfuerzan en mejorar las ventas, Segundo ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 800 nuevos soles para la compra de mayor cantidad de abarrotes para ofrecer a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Segundo Guillermo is 48 years old and he is married. He lives in his own home in the Zaña district, a community close to the river Jequetepeque valley, which has enabled it to develop through agriculture as well as commerce and livestock farming. It is situated in the Province of Chiclayo in the Lambayeque region on the north coast of Peru.

Segundo sells groceries, he has more than 5 years experience in this line of work. Together with his wife they work hard to improve sales. He has asked for a loan from Edpyme Alternativa of 800 nuevos soles to buy a greater quantity of groceries to offer to his customers.

loans.use: to buy a greater quantity of groceries.

loans.name: Clara Nohely

texts.es:
Clara es una joven emprendedora, tiene 24 años de edad y vive en el Distrito de Guadalupe junto a su esposo y su hijo.
Desde hace 6 años es dueña de su propio negocio, tiene una pequeña bodega en su domicilio y ofrece diversos productos de primera necesidad. Le va muy bien porque es muy amable, responsable y sobre todo sus vecinos están muy agradecidos porque da facilidades de pago.
Clara está muy agradecida con los prestamistas Kiva porque con el apoyo que le han brindado ella podrá comprar mercadería para surtir su negocio y así pueda tener más ganancias con las ventas y brindarle un mejor calidad de vida a su hijo y un futuro mejor.
texts.en:
Clara is a young entrepreneur. She is 24 years old and lives in the District of Guadalupe with her husband and son.

For the past six years, Clara has managed her own business. She has a small store in her home where she offers different basic necessity products. Clara is doing very well because she is friendly and responsible. Most of all, her neighbors appreciate that she offers payment options.

Clara is very grateful to the Kiva lenders because of the support they have provided. She will be able to buy merchandise for restocking her business. As a result, she will earn more profit from her sales and be able to provide her son with a better quality of life and a better future.

loans.use: to buy merchandise for restocking her store.

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en:
Agnes is 36 years old and married with four children, who are all in school. She works very hard to provide for them.  

Agnes runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 7,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell. She has been in this business for two years and sells a variety of items such as bread, soft drinks, noodles, and other miscellaneous items. 

In the future Agnes would like to save enough money so she can continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell

loans.name: Edin Elferes

texts.es:
Edin tiene 26 años de edad, vive en casa familiar de material rustico junto a sus padres, ubicada en el Caserío Playa Azul, una zona rural del distrito de Pucará, su población se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería, ubicada en la Provincia de Jaén que pertenece a la Región Cajamarca, sierra norte del Perú.

El se dedica a prestar servicio de transporte de pasajeros en una Empresa de transportes de la zona, ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 1 000 nuevos soles para la compra de llantas, batería y sistema eléctrico que le permitirá tener en buen funcionamiento su vehículo y de esta manera generar mayores ingresos para su familia.
texts.en:
Edin is 26 years old. He lives with his parents in a rustic home located in the Playa Azul neighborhood, a rural zone in the Pucará district. Residents make a living through agriculture, commerce, and ranching. It is located in the Jaén province, which belongs to the Cajamarca region in the mountainous northern region of Perú.

He makes a living by transporting passengers with a transport business in the area. He requests a loan of 1,000 nuevos soles from Edpyme Alternativa to purchase tires, a battery, and an electrical system, which will allow him to make his vehicle function well so that he can earn more money for his family.

loans.use: to purchase tires, a battery, and an electrical system for his car.

loans.name: Mwanahamisi

texts.en:
Mwanahamisi is a married woman with four children, all of whom attend school. She lives in a rental house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees. 

For the past five years, she has operated a shop, selling food to her neighbors and passersby. 

With the loan, she wants to purchase wheat flour, cooking oil, and beans for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase wheat flour, cooking oil, and beans for resale

loans.name: Amina

texts.en:
Amina is a very hardworking and enterprising woman who says that she has been able to greatly increase her income and help her family, thanks to her hard work.
Besides selling bags, she prepares and sells fried potatoes. She is asking for a loan to buy potatoes and cooking oil for her business. She is grateful for the financial support she has received.

loans.use: to buy potatoes and cooking oil for her business

loans.name: Celina

texts.en:
Celina is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a general store business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for three years. She is borrowing PHP 14,000 through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell. 

Celina has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Razia

texts.en:
Razia is 40-year-old woman. She lives in Lahore, Pakistan. She is a responsible mother of six children. 

Her elder son owns a video game shop. He has been running this shop for the last ten years. He deals with politeness to his customers. His customers consist mostly of school-going children; mostly children come in his games shop for relaxation of their minds. He also guides them how to run the games. 

His number of customers increases day by day so he has decided to buy a new video game machine. In this way, he can increase his current business as he manages his household necessities from his own shop as well. He does not have sufficient amount to cover the cost of a new video game machine so Razia, has requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner, BRAC Pakistan. In this way she can support her son's business. 

Razia is very thankful to Kiva and field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy a new video game machine.

loans.name: Simon

texts.en: Simon is a repeat client of UGAFODE; he runs a saloon as his major source of income. He is taking a loan of 2,000,000 UGX to pay school tuition for his children. This 44-year-old man is married with 6 children who are all attending school. He hails from a village in Kinyasano ward, Western division, Rukungiri municipality in Uganda. Simon is happy with the financial assistance from Ugafode, which has enabled him to educate his children.  This would not be possible if he was depending on his business alone. He is very grateful for the financial support. Thank you Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to pay tuition for his children

loans.name: Sikukuu

texts.en:
Sikukuu is a married woman who is very hardworking and enterprising. She is living in the coastal region of Kenya. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food.

For the past year, she has operated a business selling leso (women's wrap) cloth. She faces the major challenge of seasonality in her place of operation. She dreams of expanding to become a big supplier of clothes in the future.

With the loan, she wants to purchase more pieces of leso for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase more pieces of leso (women's wrap)  for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To pay for her niece's upcoming semester fees.

loans.name: Bryan

texts.es:
El joven Bryan es un chico con gran capacidad de aprendizaje y siempre teniendo en mente el profundo agradecimiento que tiene por su madre al darle la oportunidad de tener una vida y apoyarlo en todos sus proyectos.
Con apenas 19 años tiene conocimientos en el arte de la barbería, tanto así que ya realiza trabajos con sus amigos y vecinos que lo conocen como un joven juicioso, responsable y dedicado.
Este oficio lo aprendió desde que estaba en el último año del colegio y poco a poco ha ido perfeccionando sus técnicas. Adicionalmente aprendió del comercio de ropa y actualmente vende prendas al por menos en diferentes sectores del municipio de Itagüí.
El solicita un crédito para comprar algunos saldos de ropa que las fabricas de confección ofrecen a muy buenos precios, el desea aprovechar estas temporadas para comprar mercancía y venderla posteriormente.
Todas las utilidades de sus ventas serán destinadas en el sostenimiento de su hogar ya que vive con sus padres y debe aportar con algunos costos.
Su mayor sueño es poder tener un almacén y una barbería y aunque son proyectos ambiciosos, el confía plenamente en sus capacidades.
texts.en:
Bryan is a young man who has a great capacity for learning, but he is always mindful and appreciative of his mother who gave him opportunities in life and supported him in all of his endeavors.

At 19 years of age, Bryan is already skilled as a barber. He finds work among his friends and neighbors who know him as a sensible, responsible, and devoted young man. Bryan learned this trade while he was in his last year of high school. Little by little, he perfected his techniques. In addition, he learned the clothing retail trade and currently sells clothes in different neighborhoods within the town of Itagüí.

The loan he is requesting will be used to buy some discounted manufactured clothing that is being offered at a very good price. He wants to take advantage of this season for buying and selling merchandise. All of the profit from his sales will be used for sustaining his household. He lives with his parents and contributes to some of the expenses.

His greatest wish is to have a store and a barber shop. Although these are ambitious projects, Bryan is fully confident in his abilities.

loans.use: to buy discounted clothing that he can sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for her son's education.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy cosmetics and renovate her workplace.

loans.name: Anjina

texts.en:
Anjina resides in a small village, Kholaigram, in the district of Jalpaiguri. She is only 21 years old, married and a housewife. She is married to Abul, aged 22 years.  Anjima has a secondary education, but her husband attended school up to grade eight. They are raising only one son who is too young for school.

Anjina's husband farms a variety of crops on their own farmland. Anjina helps her husband in farming by sowing seeds, harvesting and carrying the produce to the market for sale. This agribusiness is the main source of income for the family. But the income from this business is so scanty that it is hardly possible for her husband to bear all the household expenses. They have decided to cultivate jute on their farmland. Jute is a very profitable crop, and there is much demand in the present market.

Anjina applied for a loan from BJS to buy jute seeds, fertilizers and other agricultural inputs. She hopes that this new crop will support them with good earnings. She will utilize the profit from her business to overcome the financial hurdles, give a good education to her son and build a concrete-made house for them in the future.

She is very much grateful and thankful towards the lenders.

loans.use: to buy jute seeds, fertilizers and other agricultural inputs for jute cultivation.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for his daughter's education.

loans.name: Sushila

texts.en:
Sushila is 51 years old.  She is from a remote region of the district Jalpaiguri. She is married to Anandamohan and a happy mother of a son.  Sushila is uneducated, deprived of an education due to her parents' poverty.  For the same reason, she could not provide an education to her only son. He is now grown up. Her husband and son both work as masons.

Sushila's husband has an inconsistent income.  He and their son strive to give financial sustenance to the family, but can hardly manage it. So Sushila has decided to start a 'DashakarmaBhandar' (a general store where especially worship items are sold) to strengthen the family economy.  The things sold in this kind of shop are mainly used in different festivals and pujas like candles, artificial garland, incense, utensils etc.  Sushila is an enterprising and responsible woman who strives for her family's welfare. She has always been optimistic about life and knows that her family is her big support.

Sushila has asked for a loan from BJS to purchase the necessary articles for her shop.  She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

Her main goal is to make her business larger for a secured future, for which she wants to thank her lenders ( BJS and Kiva) for their financial support.

loans.use: To purchase things used in religious festivals to start up a store.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy an air-conditioner and an iron.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: A loan of 2,000 helps Fadhila to pay for her son's education.

loans.name: Misbah's Group

texts.en:
